title: Business Monitoring Analyst / Manager
description: The role sits in Business Monitoring function responsible for continuous monitoring of existing merchants, ensuring products and services offered to customers are legal, merchant business is in line with Wirecard policies and is compliant with card scheme rules and local regulations. In addition, the role will support local investigation of new business and act as a backup for Risk Underwriting when needed.You will be the contact point for the regional sales and operation teams on any request raised from existing customers. You will be responsible for initiating, updating, and maintaining regular risk reporting and alerts for any major business changes and/or discrepancies. As part of your responsibility, you will liaise with sales to ensure customer KYC database is up to date.Reporting to Head of Business Monitoring, you will conduct regular status and alert reporting and assists to manage regional customer portfolio.Main TasksMonitor all existing merchants’ business structure and status including any changes of UBO and directors, company structure, company address etc to ensure ongoing solvencyMonitor all existing merchant’s business activities to ensure changes in products and services, URL, Terms and Conditions, mail, phone scripts etc are approved and compliant with Wirecard policies.Review existing merchants on a regular basis to ensure they act in line with their contractual agreement with Wirecard and that the deposit held is sufficient.Report and alert on illegal merchant business content and/or any limit breaches.Research and update the internal and external merchant investigation and monitoring tools available in the region.Perform investigation tasks where are required and / or during peak periodsCo-operate with sales operation to support the merchant boarding process in an efficient manner.Support Risk, Fraud and Compliance functions in formulating strategy, process, and execution.Support the function to maintain and improve merchant monitoring policies and procedures.Preferred Experience and requirements3 years and above relevant experience in business underwriting / financial analysisFamiliar with Payment industry or card acquiring / issuing schemesFamiliar with applicable local regulations across the regionExperience in portfolio management and credit risk reportingExperience in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)Fluent in regional languagesUniversity degree in finance, business or relevantAble to travel 10% of the timeAttention to detailStrong knowledge of automation tools and report buildersAdvanced knowledge in financial statementsExcellent data querying and management skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong prioritization and execution skillsEffective interaction with different departmentsQuality focused with a passion for continuous improvementAbility to learn and adapt to new risk management toolsSelf-motivated and a good team player
skills: ['Automation', 'Brand Management', 'Credit Risk', 'Data Reporting', 'Database', 'Finance', 'Financial Statement', 'Know Your Customer (KYC)', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Microsoft Office', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Research', 'Risk Management', 'Sales Operations', 'Scheme', 'Underwriting', 'Written Communication']

title: Stores Manager
company: ROSEWOOD HOTEL GROUP - HOIANA INTERGRATED RESORT
description: Làm việc tại: Huyện Duy Xuyên - Quảng Nam Mức lương: Mức Thỏa Thuận MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆCImplement hotel's storeroom issuing and receiving procedures.Review all storeroom requisitions daily, conduct spot check on pricing and extensions, thereafter, forward the duly approved and received requisitions slips to Inventory Control Supervisor for costs and expenses allocation.Ensure that storeroom key control and security procedures are in accordance with the established systems and procedures to limit access to storerooms.Prepare Purchase Request for regular replenishment in accordance with the established par stock levels. Review such par stock levels and make recommendations for any changes and modifications to suit operational requirements and ensure more efficient operations.Prepare for monthly storeroom inventory by arranging items in an orderly fashion to facilitate stock take and count. Assist the Inventory Control Supervisor in conducting the stock take.Supervise and assist in planning space, proper receiving, storage and issuance of all supplies in accordance with store procedures. Make recommendations for efficiency of operations.Maintain accurate record of all storeroom items and a proper filing or records related to receipts and issuances of goods.Responsible for maintaining cleanliness and orderliness of the store room. Must coordinate closely with the housekeeping department in cleaning the storeroom area.Responsible for the proper rotation of stocks and issuance to departments on a first-in, first-out basis.Prepare list of slow moving items on a monthly basis and bring to the attention of the Materials Manager. Implement measures to reduce or avoid spoilage or breakage of stocks or items through proper handling and issuing goods that are close to expiry date.Cross train staff members in various storeroom functions such as general store, F&B store items to ensure availability of staff during vacation or sick leave in the different storerooms.Assist the different storerooms during busy or peak periods to enable them to cope with high volume issuance or requisitions.Liaise closely with the Cost Control and other finance staff in the stocktaking of operating equipment in the storerooms.Process merchandise invoices for store items to ensure that the goods are received and prices are correct. Input data into the SCM system and update records and edit reports on a regular basis.Prepare timely management reports such as month-end inventory reports, operating supplies stock take results and any other reports that may be required by management from time to time.Maintain proper inventory control on hotel items and operating supplies.Ensure that the Hotel's policies and procedures relating to purchasing receiving and issuing of hotel items are complied with as they relate to store items.Carry out monthly stock take of storeroom items and quarterly stock take of operating supplies. Prepare all the required reports prior to stock take to ensure accurate and organized stock take. Coordinate closely with Operations Analyst for storeroom items and the Accountant, Asst. Financial Controller, Executive Housekeeper and Chief Steward for operating equipment. Ensure that hotel stock take procedures are implemented and carried. Report any deviations that occur during the stock take.Identify high cost areas so that corrective measures can be implemented.Identify inventory costs methodology - standard, FIFO, or average and implement them where necessary or applicable. Ensure consistency of method for comparison of costs.Identify minimum and maximum, par stock levels for storeroom items and to insure these are implemented, make recommendations where necessary.Ensure the stocks are kept in proper, safe and good condition to minimize any damage, loss or wastage. Issue a report of slow moving items and make recommendations on how to reduce or eliminate wastage.Any other jobs that assigned by the Director of Finance from time to time. title: Project Manager / Senior Business Analyst
description: ABOUT COMPANYHRBoss is Asia's leading provider of data-driven software for both corporate HR and recruitment agencies.JOB DESCRIPTIONHRBoss is Asia's leading HR & Recruiting software provider. We are the first and only HR software platform to be created in Asia, for global businesses. All of our Cloud solutions are intuitive, highly-configurable and supported locally on-the-ground, across the region. The HRBoss philosophy is simple: to provide our innovative, easy-to-use software, at prices that any business can afford, fully localized for business in Asia.We are a strong cultured company with a real passion for what we do. We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to help own the future direction of our product portfolio.Key Roles & ResponsibilitiesSTAKEHOLDER MANAGEMENT: Develop productive working relationships with product and sales business stakeholders in Singapore, Shanghai, Japan and Hong Kong to ensure that their business requirements are captured accurately & succinctly.FUNCTIONAL SPECIFICATIONS: Translate business requirements into Functional Specifications, ensuring that developers and testers have a precise understanding of what is to be built and delivered.SCOPE MANAGEMENT: Working with business analysts, ensure that questions of scope are addressed constructively and clearly with business stakeholders. Once scope boundaries have been established, ensure that any potential deviation from agreed scope is addressed immediately.TESTING: In partnership with a dedicated testing team, ensure that all deliveries are fit for purpose, addressing business requirements in a timely, accurate and complete manner, with minimal defects or technical debt. The BA and QC team contributes to test strategy, test plans and test coordination, as well as participating in the actual testing and diagnosing any defects that arise.USER SUPPORT: Train and support business users through acceptance testing, release preparation, go-live and the post-implementation period of each new delivery, assuring a smooth transition into the latest release.SHARING KNOWLEDGE: Ensure that knowledge is shared throughout the BA team so that team members can support each other and maintain continuity throughout the project.Qualifications & SkillsSUBJECT MATTER EXPERT: In-depth product knowledge covering ATS and CRM systems. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate knowledge across multiple verticals.WORK STYLE: A process-driven and disciplined approach working within HRBoss structures and standards to produce high-quality deliverables to the agreed timetable.PROVEN STAKEHOLDER MANAGEMENT SKILLS: Demonstrable experience of maintaining effective working relationships with business sponsors through the often difficult negotiation of scope and competing requirements.CAN-DO SPIRIT: To be effective in a change environment the individual will require mental agility, an appreciation of the broader picture and the determination to deliver on time, to the highest level possible.COMMUNICATION: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are essential for this role.
skills: ['Business Analysis', 'Customer Relationship Management (CRM)', 'English', 'Golang', 'Human Resource (HR)', 'Negotiation', 'Philosophy', 'Platform', 'Product Knowledge', 'Recruiting', 'Sales', 'TestNG', 'Testing', 'Written Communication']

Annam Group đang cần tuyển nhân sự với hình thức làm việc: nhân viên chính thức. Website tìm việc làm 123job cập nhật tin Media Manager cách đây lúc 2019-10-25 06:30:02. title: Beauty Care - Center Manager
description: Industry: RETAILPosition: QUẢN LÝLocation: HỒ CHÍ MINHCreated: 16:23 - 18/04/2019Job descriptionJOB SUMMARY1. The Center Manager (CM) supports the Chairman/ CEO or designates in over-seeing and managing company and/or other Center services assigned.2. CM is also the Center interface across all services and functional units of Company.3. CM is responsible to plan, develop and manage resources within Company to meet the Centers’ objectives in the delivery of service and Customer care.4. CM works closely with the Chairman/ CEO or designates and staff of the Center5. CM plays an active role in supporting company and assists the Chairman/ CEO or designates in the following capacity:a) providing timely center performance reportingb) actively planning, implementing and managing initiatives and solutions towards determined objectivesResponsibilities and RequirementsI) RESPONSIBILITIES:1) Coordination of Customer Carea) Coordinates the management of company’s Customers across all service settings e.g. daily Center activities, customer care, surgical services and allied health careb) This would include liaising with appropriate parties to ensure, where necessary and feasible, discipline-specific requirements for coordination/delivery of care such that Customer management is seamless across units.c) Functions as the key interface for company with staff of other disciplines/entities as well as other service functions (nurses, therapists, customer service and administrative staff) with the aim to continuously improve care coordination for Customersd) Supports Chairman/ CEO or designates in the delivery of efficient Center and process flow for customer caree) Provides analysis and support to minimise operational bottlenecks throughout customer care2) Financial Managementa) Provides financial accountability: forecast, prepare and justify revenue target, operating & capital budgetsb) Performs review of revenue & budgets and its variances to ensure that company achieves the revenue target and operates within the operating budget allocatedc) Actively manages company’s P&L by identifying key levers and implementing initiatives and strategies to improve P&L performance3) Resource Managementa) Works with all Support Services to minimise operational bottlenecks and ease flow for Customer careb) Assists Chairman/ CEO or designates to manage resources allocated for Customer services by actively engaging Center Staff, Clinicians and Center in dialogues to improve productivity and efficiencyc) Assists Chairman/ CEO or designates and provides resource management support and platforms for other service setting such as surgical services and other clinical support servicesd) Plans and implements upgrading of facilities and equipment to meet service needs of companye) Plans and manages maintenance and replacement of resourcesf) Reviews utilisation of resources and assist Chairman/ CEO or designates in increasing productivity.g) Supports Chairman/ CEO or designates in the management of manpower, including but not limited to:Helping with clinical and non-clinical staff roster in companyh) Assists in general manpower matters, including logis support for training programs for company’s staff, newly recruited Doctors, Doctors working on a part-time/referral basis, training and appraisal of company’s Customer Service staff4) Service Development and Business Promotiona) Assists Chairman/ CEO or designates with the development, business evaluation, implementation and prmotion of new servicesb) Understands the different needs of referring channels for company and implement strategies to engage and promote referrals of Customers to companyc) Manages and grows relationships with key stakeholders such as referring sources, business partners and other players providing complementary servicesd) Facilitates and handles business enquiries regarding services provided by the companye) Assists Chairman/ CEO or designates in managing company’s Customer volume by implementing initiatives to ensure right siting of care as well as managing Doctors’ roster and appointment schedules for all Doctor-related services5) Service Qualitya) Ensures efficient Center and process flow for programs developed to improve care integration and co-ordinationb) Assists Chairman/ CEO or designates to measure, review and report practice variance in services and identifies best practice for continuous improvementc) Institutes and updates operational procedures, work instructions for company and/or Services to ensure smooth operation with optimal efficiencyd) Co-ordinates and maintains company quality systems6) General dutiesa) Management ReportsUpdates reports on performance, finances, work load data across service settings for Chairman/ CEO or designates and/or any other data required by Chairman/ CEO or designatesAssists Chairman/ CEO or designates in company for the preparation of annual reports and work plansb) Plans, drives and manages quality improvement projects at companyc) Any other duties assigned by Chairman/ CEO or designatesII) JOB REQUIREMENTS:Leadership skill, Making plan, organization and supervision skill.Job analyst, general comment, reporting.Strong communication, Good command of English languageGood computer skillAbility to work under pressureBe honest, brave, enthusiasm, creative for the job1 – 2 years’ Healthcare experience in international standard facilities preferred and for local facilities we will evaluate the type of facilities1 – 2 years’ Aesthetic/ Plastic Surgery in local / international standard facilitiesOperations / Management skills, abilitiesFemaleWell-groomedIII. SALARY & OTHER BENEFITS:Attractive Salary NegotiationThe 13th Month SalarySocial Insurance, Health Insurance, Unemployment Insurance according to Government LawMany other benefits added

title: ผู้จัดการสารสนเทศและไอที ( IT Manager ) ด่วน
description: Kitzcho international:: บริษัท คิทซ์โช อินเตอร์เนชั่นแนล จำกัด ::เป็นผู้ผลิตและจำหน่ายผลิตภัณฑ์ไม้แปรรูป, เฟอร์นิเจอร์, ชุดครัวสำเร็จรูป คุณภาพดีที่ผลิตด้วยความภาคภูมิใจ ภายใต้ชื่อแบรนด์ "KITZCHO" ชุดครัวไม้แท้ คุณค่าแห่งความภาคภูมิใจ ได้ก่อตั้งและดำเนินงานย่างก้าวเข้าสู่ปีที่ 15 ด้วยความมั่นคง ด้วยจำนวนสาขาที่มีมากกว่า 200 สาขาทั่วประเทศ ครอบคลุมทุกจังหวัดเรามีบริษัทฯในเครือ คือ บริษัท บุญวู้ด จำกัด, บุญเฟอร์นิเจอร์ จำกัด และ บุญทิมเบอร์ อินเตอร์ จำกัด :เป็นโรงงานไม้อัดประสาน และผลิตเฟอร์นิเจอร์ไม้ยางพารา, ชุดครัวสำเร็จรูป คุณภาพดี ฝีมือประณีตได้มาตรฐาน โดยผลิตเฟอร์นิเจอร์หลักให้กับชุดครัวแบรนด์ "KITZCHO"เราต้องการบุคลากรที่มีความรู้ความสามารถ ที่มุ่งมั่นทำงานที่ท้าทาย เพื่อมารองรับการขยายตัวของบริษัทที่มีเพิ่มขึ้นอย่างต่อเนื่อง ... หากคุณ มั่นใจในความสามารถที่มี เราขอเชิญมาร่วมงานกันผู้จัดการสารสนเทศและไอที ( IT Manager ) ด่วน1.บริหารดูแลหน่วยงานเทคโนโลยีสารสนเทศในภาพรวม2.วางแผนกลยุทธการวางระบบทางด้าน Software และ Hardware Firewall Web3.วางแผน คิดค้นร่วมกับทีมงานเพื่อหาเทคโนโลยีใหม่ๆ มาปรับใช้เพื่อให้เกิดประโยชน์ในองค์กร4.ควบคุม ดูแลระบบ IT ของทุกหน่วยงานทั้งในบริษัท และที่โชว์รูมต่างๆ ที่บริษัทตั้งอยู่5.วางแผนจัดทำงบประมาณในการจัดซื้อคอมพิวเตอร์ และอุปกรณ์ รวมถึงโปรแกรม Software ต่างๆอัตรา : 2 อัตราเงินเดือน : ตามตกลงและประสบการณ์สวัสดิการ :สวัสดิการ1. ประกันสังคม / กองทุนเงินทดแทน2. โบนัส (ตามผลประกอบการ)3. ปรับเงินเดือนประจำปี4. เงินช่วยเหลืองานแต่งงาน งานศพ5. ชุดฟอร์ม6. คอร์สอบรมพัฒนาบุคลากร และอื่น ๆ7. ค่า Commission (บางตำแหน่ง)8. เบี้ยเลี้ยง/ค่าสึกหรอรถยนต์/เงินประกันรถยนต์/ ค่าน้ำมันรถ/ค่าเดินทาง (บางตำแหน่ง)วันเวลาปฏิบัติงานจันทร์ - ศุกร์ เวลา 08.30 - 17.30 น.คุณสมบัติผู้สมัคร :1. วุฒิการศึกษาระดับปริญญาตรี - โท ด้านคอมพิวเตอร์,สารสนเทศ หรือสาขาที่เกี่ยวข้อง2. เพศ ชาย-หญิง อายุ 25 ปีขึ้นไป3. มีประสบการณ์บริหารดูแลภาพรวม Data base / System analyst / Programmer4. มีประสบการณ์ทางด้านเกี่ยวก้บโปรแกรม ERP เช่น Sap และโปรแกรม Erp อื่นๆ5. มีความรู้เกี่ยวกับโปรแกรม ออกแบบต่างๆ6. เป็นผู้นำและพัฒนา IT ของบริษัทฯ ให้ระบบต่างๆมีความทันสมัยสถานที่ปฏิบัติงาน :สำนักงานใหญ่จังหวัด : กรุงเทพมหานครวิธีการรับสมัครงาน :สามารถสอบถามข้อมูลการสมัครงานได้ที่บริษัท คิทซ์โช อินเตอร์เนชั่นแนล จำกัด (สำนักงานใหญ่)เลขที่ 790 ถนนบรมราชชนนี แขวงบางบำหรุ เขตบางพลัด 10700โทร 02-886-5544 ต่อ 501,502 / 095-369-8011 (ฝ่ายทรัพยากรบุคคล) ทุกวันจันทร์-ศุกร์ เวลา 08.30- 15.30 น.หรือส่ง Resume / CV ได้ที่ Mail : hr@kitzcho.comKitzcho international::: บริษัท คิทซ์โช อินเตอร์เนชั่นแนล จำกัด ::: เลขที่ 790 ถนนบรมราชชนนี แขวงบางบำหรุ เขตบางพลัด กรุงเทพมหานคร 10700 วิธีการรับสมัครงาน สมัครด้วยตัวเอง (ทุกวันจันทร์-ศุกร์ เวลา 08.30- 15.30 น.) หรือส่งมาที่ Mail : hr@kitzcho.com 02-886-5544ต่อ 405-406 // 095-369-8011 Web site : www.kitzcho.com กรุงเทพมหานคร 10700ติดต่อ : คุณทิพย์วรรณ / คุณชัยยศโทรศัพท์ : 02-886-5544 ต่อ 501 // 095-369-8011แฟกซ์ : 02-886-4791

title: Procurement Assistant Manager
description: An exciting Procurement Assistant Manager (x 1 vacancy) job has just become available at one of the best chemicals production and trading company based in Bangkok, Thailand. Reporting directly to the Commercial VP, this is a role for a procurement analyst who experienced contract procurement, cost reduction, process improvement and able to manage stakeholders across global marker in petrochemical industry.About the Procurement Assistant Manager Role:In this business critical role, you will be responsible for daily operations and update information related to procurement of the petrochemical product - Ethylene Glycol, global market except USA. You will also be a key person for contract procurement and take the lead of cost saving project and process improvement in procurement function. The salary range is competitive and addition with provident fund and medical Insurance.Key Responsibilities:Organise the procurement contract with global suppliers, negotiate the best deal for companyCooperate with other functions both internal and external to get update data/ information on products that under responsibility and refresh information on databaseReview procurement and logistics cost and initiate cost reduction measures as well as process improvementStrengthen good relationship with all stakeholdersTo succeed in the Procurement Assistant Manager job, you will need to have the ability to work effectively and co-operatively with stakeholders, across borders and internal matrix.Key Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, or related fieldAt least five years’ work experience in chemical procurementEssential knowledge of contract procurementProven ability to achieve cost reduction and process improvementHigh level of proficiency in English (listening, reading, writing, speaking)Experience using SAP, ERP, and good skill in MS OfficeThis leading intermediate petrochemicals producer is one of the largest vertically integrated polyester value chain producers in the world, serving world-class customers in diverse end-use markets including food, beverage, personal home care, healthcare, automotive, textile and industrial use. With 101 manufacturing facilities in 31 countries across four continents and 2018 revenues of $10.7 billion, this is a great brand to join at an exciting time in their development. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential is significant.If you are a professional and seeking the right opportunity to take your career forward, this Procurement Assistant Manager job is the role for you. You will be a part of a global company that values innovation and a continual focus on cost and efficiency.Apply today to chase this new opportunity.Robert Walters Recruitment (Thailand) LimitedRecruitment License No.: น. 1188 / 2551An exciting Procurement Assistant Manager (x 1 vacancy) job has just become available at one of the best chemicals production and trading company based in Bangkok, Thailand. title: Compensation & Benefits Manager
description: The Comp & Benefits Senior Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual.Responsibilities:Assists in ensuring that the firm has competitive and cost effective reward policies and practices.Contributes to developing and executing the firm's reward strategy,managing the key areas of reward, benefits and pensions and liaising with third parties to develop a consistent best practice approach.Ensures that reward practices are compliant with the relevant regulatory recommendations and requirements.Being fully knowledgeable on the day-to-day activities of a product or process as well as able to provide input on more complex issues.Contributes to resolution of complex problems or transactions, where expertise is required to interpret against policies, guidelines or processes.All other duties as assigned.Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.Compensation and BenefitsAssist head of reward to plan and complete year-end salary increase and promotion process upon Regional and Country Guidelines.Support other off cycle salary increase and promotion by obtaining appropriate country and regional approvalProvide additional compensation related data and reports as required by local or Regional management.Liaise with line managers or Regional Office for special award programs approval and process payment instruction.Assist the head of reward to conduct annual compensation & benefits surveys and provide data analysis support of survey results.Support head of reward to communicate survey results and to develop and implement compensation and benefits solutions to address issues identified in the surveys.Liaise with Provident Fund Managers and Provident Fund Committee to ensure balance between risk / returns and compliance with relevant regulations.Incentive ProgramsParticipate and represent HR in the Country Incentive Council CIC meetingSupport CSC & CIC and Regional Incentive Council (RIC) by providing employee’s compensation data and analysisMonitor & record all incentive programs to ensure smooth payment.Equity CompensationAs a “Country Equity Coordinator” of Thailand, ensure smooth process on all equity mattersEnsure the smooth process in monthly CAP Amortization, CAP dividend payment and quarterly CAP and stock options chargeback process.Ensure the accuracy of tax submission to Revenue department for all equity programsSupport employee for stock option exercise, Stock Options Election and CAP Vesting Election processMobility CoordinatorTo ensure that expatriate services comply with local regulations and US policies.To be a focal point for internal, expatriate, vendors and regulators for all expatriate related.Qualifications:5 -8 years experienceProficient in Microsoft Office with an emphasis on MS ExcelAbility to meet deadlines while dealing with multiple priorities.Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skillsEducation:Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience-Grade :All Job Level - All Job FunctionsAll Job Level - All Job Functions - TH-Time Type :Full time-Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Minority/Female/Veteran/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. With CREATORY, you would be surprised by how far you can grow so quickly with the greatest people.A, GENERAL DESCRIPTIONThis role plays a critical part to take full ownership of the assigned brands by leading the brand development strategy & plan including budget responsibility, revenue growth management strategy, research and read insights, future trend prediction, and integrated marketing communication activation.B, MAIN RESPONSIBILITIESStrongly support Brand Manager effectively and passionately in leading the assigned Creators' brand names to achieve the best results based on set objectives by Brand Manager;Play an important role to build team capabilities, operating effectiveness, driving positive one team spirit, and establish a collaborative culture based on the Creatory Values across the Talent Planning team;Analyze talent's market positioning and target audience insights;Formulate talent's short and long-term strategy including talent's identity, concept, objective and direction;Develop and analyze marketing plans on all channels;Monitor market trend and predict future trend;Manage approved budgets for marketing activities;Analyze talent performance and revenue to evaluate ROI and KPI;Directly manage a group of 1- 3 Junior/Brand Executive and Report to Brand Manager;Other tasks assigned by line manager.C, REQUIREMENT:Qualification:College or Bachelor’s degree, Marketing major is a plus.Minimum of 3 years of equivalent experience or brand communication, social.Experience in company size from 100 - 200.Experience in Entertainment field is an advantageExperience working directly with talent and creators to collaborate on campaigns is a plus.SkillsAbility to make marketing plan, strategy and report.Budget planning and management skills.Strong experience in channel, community management and monitoring.Have the ability to work under high pressure and handle multitaskings.Possess excellent data analyst and data management skills.Positive and “can-do" attitude.Proficient in MS office; as well as the capacity to efficiently learn about new systems.Good communication in both English and Vietnamese.D, OFFER:Amazing Teammates"Hiring the smartest, most talented and innovative people in Vietnam" is our consistent strategy from the beginning. That being said, we bring you a group of brilliant colleagues who can help you to move your life to a whole new level.A World-Class Company CultureDare to dream bigEvolve through learningPositive and passionatePractice transparency and candorTurn customers into raving fansHelp others rock their greatest livesHonor my words with action.Happiness is around youWe don't need people to obey working time of 9-6, we don't force them to stay serious on their seats all day. title: Operate Landscape Manager
description: The RoleThe Operate Landscape Manager Voice Analyst is end to end accountable for the operations of the landscapes and the delivery of the day-to-day E2E application and/or infrastructure services according to the agreed Service Levels and/or Operate Level Agreements. They ensure IT applications and services remain available, are delivered in a secure manner and perform appropriate oversight on any changes to the landscapes. They must have awareness of basic IT Architecture concepts. They are the escalation point for operation-related issues within their landscapes and ensure that regulatory and compliance controls are embedded in landscape operations and assist with evidence collection. They are responsible for reviewing the landscapes for enhancement and continuous improvement opportunities and must have awareness of basic IT Architecture concepts.Provides technical expertise at a 'skill' level in ensuring that operational services are robust and restoration time is minimized.Together with other team members the role is also critical in ensuring Shell retains critical control points and technical knowledge to avoid over reliance on suppliers.Provides the technical advice to Service Managers for discussion with stakeholders (internal and external) to help ensure Shells interests are well represented and protected from a technical perspective.The incumbent works in close collaboration with Suppliers to ensure that Incident, Problem and Capacity Management functions support effective the delivery of secure and reliable Connectivity services.Incumbent is also adept in keeping key stakeholders informed when incidents are occurring and following up on Problem management issues.Creates and analyses process performance reports enabling monitoring of compliance against CSLs and KPIs and together with service management teams raises back to green plans as title: Supply Chain Excellence Manager
description: The Supply Chain Excellence Manager will be overall responsible for continuous improvement of cost and processes within supply chain and GEOS MY. The SCE Manager will also lead and ensure compliance in SAP transactions and processes including segregation of duty (SOD) and optimization plan of SAP and SAP integration & optimization projects align with global BPO for GEOS MY. Key person to monitor overall supply chain performance including spend vs budget and trigger any hotspots or potential risk/ issues. Lead and/or implements high complexity projects as the lead or representative from supply chain.Principal AccountabilitiesAccountability Category #1: CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT & COST SAVINGS (40%)Lead and/or coordinate the discussion with others internal or external of supply chain for the cost savings initiatives including ACIs. Be the agent of change for the team and any other interdependencies.Consolidate total supply chain cost savings initiatives into a tracker and dashboard for updates and reporting based on the frequency that was preset.Monitor and trigger any hotspot for any potential supply chain performance including KPIs and spend vs budget by using the available data, dashboard and intelligence from various stakeholders.Accountability Category #2: SAP COMPLIANCES & OPTIMISATION (40%)Lead, monitor & enforce all matters related the compliance of SAP KPIs, transactions and segregation of duties specifically for those related to supply chain & GEOS MY processes in alignment with global BPO and FP&A.The lead and is the main contact point within supply chain to implement any SAP and other system integration or enhancement related to SAP.Ensuring most efficient processes are in place within the supply chain and GEOS MY structure and its interdependencies/ linkage. This is including doing periodic checks to ensure that the SOP are in place and adhered to, else either update the SOP to the relevant business needs or re-aligning the process back to the right SOP.Own the end-to-end supply chain footprint and mapping for GEOS MY.Accountability Category #3: PROJECT MANAGEMENT (15%)Be the lead or main coordinator for supply chain for high complexity projects as required.Ensure projects are managed to meet the agreed timeline and provide timely updates of any potential risk or upsides. This is including monitoring of any key measurements related to make the project a success.Ensuring all relevant stakeholder including management and dependents are kept in the know when and as needed on project updateAccountability Category #4: PEOPLE, TALENT & BUDGET MANAGEMENT (5%)Accountable for performance management, talent development, succession planning and engagement directly and through subordinate supervisors.Manages and provides coaching and/or training to team, including coaching Cargill core values, and development of specific competencies/skills.QualificationsRequired QualificationsUniversity Bachelor’s Degree in Business / Supply Chain/ Analytics.Minimum 5 years’ experience in supply chain analyst and continuous improvement management related roles, prefer to have the experience in food industry.Must have decent knowledge of SAP3 years team supervisory experienceStrong Word, Excel skillsBroad perspective on keen sense of priorities.Problem solving skillsEffective communication skillsPreferred QualificationsStrong preference given to candidates with experience on end to end supply chain knowledge related to continuous improvement and project management.Candidates that has implement SAP as super user or design approval.Job Supply Chain ManagementPrimary Location Malaysia-Kuala Lumpur-Kuala LumpurSchedule Full-timeJob Type StandardShift Day Job

title: Project Manager - Microsoft Dynamics CRM
description: Location: BangkokShift: General (9 am to 6 pm)About Ignify:Ignify is a fast growing software and IT Services company and winner/ award finalist of the Microsoft Partner of the Year for five years in a row in 2014, 2013, 2012, 2011 and 2010. Ignify has been ranked as one of the fastest growing companies for 7 years in a row by Deloitte and Inc. magazines. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer providing a great work environment and rich benefits.Categories: Software Project ManagementHourly Rate: Commensurate with experienceMinimum Education: 4-Year College IT or Business DegreePosition Description:Ignify is seeking versatile and talented CRM Project Managers to work with Ignify’s clients to deliver solutions in their CRM Systems. Projects are typically related to Microsoft CRM and the award winning Customer Relationship Management Applications of Dynamics CRM. Ignify is seeking full time candidates to fill this position.CRM Project Managers are dedicated to executing project initiatives to deepen the relationship with customers and drive additional sales. The Project Manager is a key position for the implementation and execution of Microsoft CRM and CRM Applications as well as operational project initiatives. This position works with a multitude of different teams including CRM Implementation Consultants throughout the project lifecycle from strategic definition and proposal through scoping, requirements gathering, development, and implementation, user acceptance testing, and establishing and documenting business processes where needed.The ideal candidate will possess outstanding communication, technical, and problem solving skills, as well as proven business consulting and project management experience.Project Management ResponsibilitiesCRM Project Managers are responsible for process definition and management oversight of medium and large sized CRM projects. Projects generally run 3–9 months in duration.Determine Project needs and business resources required to execute CRM projects.Work with Client Executive Project Sponsors to clarify and define strategy & objectives, scope and CRM business requirements.Define success CRM Project criteria for projects.Manage project scope, drive resolution and keep project on schedule.Develop and track project action items and issues. Document all necessary items as needed.Identify and communicate risks and responses to mitigate project risk.Responsible for the coordination and creation of project documentation and project processes.Work with CRM client team to develop appropriate testing plans to ensure user acceptance, data quality, and system integrity.Coordinate the development of training materials, user manuals and other documents as needed to enable successful implementation and turnover of the process or system to the business owners and users.Business Analysis ResponsibilitiesThe Business Analyst will drive the conversation in regards to defining the specific requirements and design for the CRM solution.Facilitate requirements definition meetings with customers.Needs to be able to quickly understand the business issues and challenges of the client’s organization and industry.Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solution.Develop functional specifications and system design specifications.Work with customers/prospects to identify key business issues and their priorities.CRM Implementation ResponsibilitiesBe hands on to drive the technical aspects of the project.Software Installation – Install the CRM software suites of MS CRM and Powertrak in clients’ environment.IT Requirements Evaluation – Be able to determine and evaluate the appropriate IT environment for clients based on the requirements of the CRM applications software.Review and edit requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to proposed solution.Application Customization and Configuration – Make base level application configuration and customization in the MS CRM application and Powertrak Toolkit environments.Requirements4–Year College or University Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Technology, or related field of study.Demonstrated ability to execute multiple, interdependent end to end projects. This includes identifying CRM project objectives, creating requirements and solution design, managing schedules, tracking project progress, facilitating testing and determining and measuring success criteria.Demonstrated ability to learn and master technical detail related to CRM.Verbal and written communication skills.Documentation and presentation skills.Attention to detail and follow–up skillsConflict management and problem diagnostic and solving skillsAbility to influence without authorityStrong time management and organizational skillsMinimum 5 years’ experience as a customer facing consultant in a software environmentExperience working with either CRM, ERP or similar product preferredExperience with Microsoft CRMExperience working within High Tech Manufacturing is preferred.Coding skills such as SQL server/.Net/ASP.NET.DesiredProject management methodologies, PMP certification or project management continuing educationKnowledge of MS Windows OS, MS Exchange, and MS OfficeUse of Visio and Microsoft ProjectStronger coding skills such as SQL server/.Net/ASP.NET.Type of position: Full time positionHow to apply:Please email thaihire@ignify.com with Job Code: ‘CRM-PM-BKK’ in the subject of the email, a resume in Microsoft word and a cover letter in the body of the email stating your interest and qualifications.

title: Payroll Manager
description: The RoleJob Purpose:Manage the delivery of payroll processes, the team responsible for those activities, leading future migrations, supporting country and global projects and ensuring KPIs are met. Focus is on:Driving success of HR model, focused on providing inputs and solution to effectively manage end to end Payroll processing, administration of all relevant tax and social security payments and reporting, management and oversight of the end to end controls framework involving the Pay People process.Continuously improving and documenting payroll processes, proactively addressing end to end HR/Payroll process gaps and unlocking potential as well as productivity partnering with various business stakeholders.Supporting implementation of Shell’s HR Transformation Journey.Represent Payroll SBO as part of the wider HR agenda by collaborating with key stakeholders such as HR Operations, HR, Tax, Legal, IT and Payroll Accounting.Supporting and Advising Regional Payroll Managers and Country Payroll Managers to build further synergies, collaborations and strategies enabling Shell’s business objectives through flexibility, simplicity and actionable insights.Principal Accountabilities:1. Payroll Operations ManagementResponsible for delivery of end to end Malaysia Payroll Processes and support Shell's Payroll compliance across an increasingly complex statutory and regulatory landscape working across Country HR, Policy, Tax, Legal, IT and Finance to meet business objectives and realizing defined business value.Accountable for advice to the Payroll team and business partners in managing more complex HR/Payroll queries and projects including support country 3rd party contract implementations relating to external service providers.Always ensure all Financial Control Manual and Data Privacy Rules are accurately executed to fully address the business risk in an environment with high monetary materiality and safeguard from Data Privacy breaches.Translate business requirements into system solutions like SAP, Workday, Assignment Pro with Functional Leads and Payroll Specialists to meet Shell business obligations and implementation of Global Payroll Strategy.Effective and timely issue management ensuring all stakeholders are well informed/consulted, risk contained, and long-term solutions put in place.2. Lead and ManageLead and manage a team of 4 to 7 Payroll Analysts.Manage dynamic people agenda by providing leadership support and coaching to team including regular one to ones, meaningful IDP conversations, goal setting, actively manage succession planning and building Global Payroll Capabilities.Ensure all KPIs defined for the team are met, and team members are equipped with the knowledge, skills and support to perform accurate, timely and compliant pay at high standards.Continuously improve the performance of the team and the services provided through embedding of applicable skills and behaviours. Utilize data and look for opportunities like data analytics to improve and refine ways of working.3. Continuous ImprovementEmbed continuous improvement in E2E processes, to drive operational excellence, standardization and harmonization by optimizing Continuous Improvement tools such as visual management, leader standard work and waste elimination.Collaborate with broader HR operations and country stakeholders to deliver greater impact at less costs through continuous improvement, continue to introduce simpler process and enhanced employee experiences.Build a culture of continuous improvement to deliver better results, improve systems and processes to support future growth of the business and remove roadblocks to team members execution.4. Business PartnershipEstablish strong working relationships within HR model (i.e. HROPS include International Mobility, Country HRM’s, Country Payroll Managers, Policy teams, Finance Operations, IT, Treasury/E-banking, 3rd party service providers.Liaise regularly with business stakeholders to ensure the team has access to all relevant information to perform effectively in their roles.Represent SBO Payroll on local HR/Payroll team forums and put the employee and key stakeholders at the heart of process to create an exceptional employee experience through pay delivery.5. LeadershipDeliver Global Payroll Strategy objectives and manage significant change journey over the coming years.Periodically review payroll process performance identify patterns, themes and linkages in areas of improvement and deliver internal reviews in alignment with business partners.Acts as a coach/mentor. Leads by example.Key Challenges:Strong leadership experience is required to drive team performance improvements and coach Functional Leads and Payroll Specialists for their personal effectiveness regarding engagement and competing priorities.Manage risks and issues for the relevant process areas and plan delivery in line with Global Payroll Strategy and standards.Full understanding of rapid & often complex changing governmental regulations can create differences in countries compensation requirements.Data Privacy: Ensuring personal and sensitive data is appropriately managed and protected at all points in the E2E payroll process. Building and embedding collaborative ways of working across the integrated E2E payroll process working across multiple countries and functions.RequirementsMin 8 years of professional experience and minimum 4 years in Payroll managementStrong mindset of continuous improvement (CI certificates preferred) to achieve efficiency with highest standards (accuracy, timeliness and compliance); ability to drive many improvement initiatives at the same timeStrong communication and personal skills to enable and maintain strong relationships with stakeholdersLeadership and organizational skills to meet deadlines and provide best in class payroll serviceControls/finance background (awareness and understanding of SOX/Finance Controls processes)Strong knowledge of SAP, Salesforce and Microsoft Excel/PowerPoint is a must. Interest or experience in other systems is a plusDemonstrates knowledge and practical application of Data Analytics tools and concepts will be an additional assetStrong written and verbal communication skills in English and the ability to interact at all levels of the organization with confidence and professionalism.Company DescriptionShell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies, active across more than 80 countries, employing 90,000 people.Shell Business Operations Sdn Bhd (503619-D), a LEED Platinum certified green facility in Cyberjaya, provides a wide range of professional services to support the efficient operation of the Shell Group. The Centre delivers world-class operational excellence to the business through shared operations and services that include Human Resource, Information Technology, Finance, Customer Services, Order to Delivery and Contracting & Procurement. The Centre is currently on a growth path and as part of this rapid growth, we are looking to recruit talented professionals to join us!If you would like to be a part of an innovative energy leader that offers a rewarding career in a multi cultural environment, then apply to us today and be a part of this vibrant, world-class organisation.DisclaimerPlease note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Royal Dutch/Shell Group companies around the world.The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand.Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

May supervise a graduateJob Title:Planner / Senior Planner / Assistant Manager, Brand ManagementJob Description:Media Planning and Activation:Demonstrate a high degree of agility in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrate ability to utilize resources to help guide client’s marketing goals in their respective markets (syndicated, proprietary, analyst data)Understand and adopt new techniques and technologies that are relevant for clients’ media strategiesProvide and discuss industry information on media, markets and related dynamicsMaintain relationships with media community; title: Senior Development Manager
description: Job Purpose *The Development Manager role is to provide program specification and development for all code change (enhancement /maintenance/problem fixes). Unit Testing and System Testing will be conducted by this role.Key Responsibilities *Oversee Unit Testing (UT) and System Testing (ST)Assist in System Testing and tracking as well as closure of all System Test Defects prior to the Code submitted to Testing Competency Center.Accountable for Estimation and Management of resources, tools and budget for Development Phase for Interfaces.Manage the Coding and Unit testing for the IT Service Request (ITSR) for that Tower/Module.Ensure compliance with design and coding standards, IT-Security, good project management practices, good quality and unit tested code.Supervise the provision of inventories for integration and conversion and involve in reviewing of the Development Lite Document (DLD).Review codings developed and oversee the checking of System Test script.Reinforce compliance to IT standards, SDLC standards, policies and procedures.Ensure compliance with design and coding standards, IT Security, good project management practices.Project Planning PhaseAttend project meeting based on invitation from PM.Review project plan based on Testing activities and deliverables.Determine the need for revision.If revision is not needed, then agree with the project plan.Design PhaseDetermine the need for revision.Revision not needed then sign off on the Detailed Level Design (DLD) and send the DLD to project manager for review.Build and Unit Test (UT) PhaseReview the UT Test Plan.Communicate test plan to Project Manager and prepare test case.Communicate DLD to Development Manager.Perform code review once UT has been signed off and identify any defects found. If defects not found then conduct System Test. If defects are found, then submit to Development Manager to debug and rectify the defects.Once Development Manager has performed the UT, then verify fixes and determine the status of defect. If defect fixed then system test. If defect not fixed then debug and rectify the defects.System Test (ST) PhaseReview ST plan and communicate test plan to project manager before preparing System Test script.Verify the fixes and determine status of defect.If defects not fixed then assign to Development Manager to analyse the defect.If defects fixed, then perform code review and identify any defects found.Once code review is performed, to analyse:If defects found, then log defects in test defects tracking system.If defects not found, then sign off System Test and handover to PM to determine compliance of ST exit criteria. If comply, set ST status to closure (sign-off), then perform SIT. If non-comply, then conduct build and unit test.System Integration Test PhaseUnderstand the defects and assign to appropriate Development Manager.Verify the fixes after system test, determine the status of the defect. If defect not fixed, then analyse the defects in defects log. If defect fixed, then reassign to tester for retest.User Acceptance Test PhaseUnderstand the defect and assign to appropriate Development Manager.Verify the fixes, determine the status of the defect. If defect not fixed, then analyse defects in defects log.If defects fixed, then reassign to tester for retest.Liaise with Support teamUnderstand the defect and assign to appropriate Development Manager.Verify the fixes, perform code review. Determine status of the defect. If defect not fixed, then analyse defects in the defects log.If defects fixed, then assign ticket to Project Manager.Liaise with BAU SupportUnderstand the defect and assign to appropriate Development Manager.Verify the fixes. Perform code review. Determine the status of the defect. If defect not fixed, then analyse defects in the defects log.If defects fixed then assign ticket to Support.Oversee Facilitation of Data ExtractionReview and provide inputs to the data extraction program and data transmission program.Review data design and oversee data testingManage the debug and rectification of the defects that were identified by code reviewer.Oversee the Coding FunctionAdopt uniform coding standards as established by the Bank across all projects and enhancements undertaken.Ensure code for all interfaces in line with the product features required by user groups for all the projects planned for the release.Ensure the good quality and unit tested code.Handling of System / Application DocumentationsProvide all technical and operational documentations, ensure system / application documentation.Oversee the preparation of required trainings for system support handover and review of training materials where required.Periodically review application documentation to ensure it is kept up-to-date.Regularly update internal capabilities via established reporting templates for progress updates.Defect TrackingAnalyse defects through joint effort with testing, business analyst and solution architect.Provide inputs to defect resolution when necessary.Develop initiatives to reduce the number of defects arising over a period of time.Audit FindingsRemediate Audit Findings with IT Security team to ensure audit reviews are carried according to Governance standards, policies and procedures.Rectify and assess on audit reviews conducted by IT Security team.Alert Development team on any updates to audit review.QualificationsJob Specifications *Qualifications(Basic Degree/Diploma etc)Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or a related study, or equivalent experience.Professional Qualification and/or Regulatory, Licensing requirementsN/ARelevant Work ExperienceMin 6-8 years of working experience in application development, preferably in the banking industryKnowledge of application development by using RPG/RPGLEExperienced in major application program developmentExperienced in using AS/400 Tools like RDp, X-analysis, ALDONPrepare detail design document, technical documentation, unit test cases.Experienced in coding and programmingRequired Competencies and Skills *Competencies/Skills(Essential to succeed in this job)Good technical, analytical and written and oral communication skillsWorking in teams, time managementHighly technical and result oriented and can work independently.Strong design and estimation skillsPossesses strong technical, analytical, design and estimation skills.Programming logic in arithmetic operations, program flow control, multiple file access and use of externally described files, display screens and print reportsPrimary Location: MalaysiaSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day ShiftEmployee Status: PermanentJob Posting: 29/05/2019, 9:09:28 PM

title: Travel & Expense Compliance Manager
description: The T&E Compliance Manager is the link between the T&E Compliance organization and the local affiliate and serves as a key contact point. The Manager is generally someone with a strong understanding of the business and finance processes. In general, his/her main responsibilities related to the T&E Process is as follows:Facilitate and establish documentation to support the compliance reviews of travel and expense submissions with the objective of ensuring the company’s policies and external regulations (where applicable) are addressed appropriately during claim submissions.Support day to day operations, ad hoc reporting and guidance of team member’s in addressing daily operational issues.Ensure resources are utilized appropriately, performances are maintained and organizational goals/objectives are accomplished.Your responsibilitiesLeadershipDefines compliance monitoring protocols and works closely with the Affiliate Compliance teams (Pharma, DIA, DC) in highlighting key areas for improvements and supports the execution of the Compliance review activities pertaining to policy updates/changes.Reviews/Prepares monthly or ad hoc communications to affiliate(s) to address key performance indicators (e.g. number of claims reviewed, cycle time, reason of claims returns).Provide guidance and ensure proper closure of all escalations from team members.Establish annual objectives / goals in collaboration with the HOD to ensure resources are utilized appropriately, performances are maintained and organizational goals/objectives are accomplished.Promote a working environment and leadership that encourages personal development and process improvement. Develop staff and their career goals; leading teams to execute on operational targets.Ensure effective knowledge transfer/on boarding for sustainable development and sharing of best practices within the team.Ensure quality and accurate delivery of services within agreed key performance indicators (KPIs) and as defined in the Service Level Agreement (SLA) and SOPs of the respective business sub-processes.Team engagement activities - Assist and drive initiatives which are related to enhancing team engagements – i.e. Team building etc.Provides coaching of Analyst on daily operations and workload management.Resource Planning -Provide accurate data and information on all resource planning initiatives.OperationalResponsible for establishing compliance checkpoints/checklist of travel and expense reviews, against the Company’s Policies, Procedures and External regulatory requirements.Plan, manage and monitor the delivery of services of the in-scope entities managed by the SSC.Conducting random T&E reviews on a spot check basis on team’s support of the T&E compliance activities.Participate in compliance program, projects and other ad-hoc tasks assigned by manager.Escalates issues and recommended resolution plans in a timely manner to the SSC line manager and affiliate (where required).Prepare reports and training material on a periodic basis to address updates process changes and re-training or onboarding of new team member’s.Ensures the accuracy and reliability of the KPI Dashboards and automation reports used to support the Compliance review process.Key RequirementMust be people manager (mid-level) and have proven experience in managing a big team of 20 pax.Day to day activities: 70% managing staff & 30% strategic.Experience in SSC is preferred.You will haveYou should have a minimum of 10 years of working experience in recognized, accounting firm, multinational company's compliance, Finance or internal audit function with strong interest in compliance and a minimum 5 years of people management or leadership experience.You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies.Degree qualification in accounting/commerce and /or professional qualification (e.g. CPA, ICAA, CIMA, ACCA).Demonstrates good communication skills with a focus on customer service.Strong presentation and analytical skills are very critical to the role. Ability to effectively communicate, influence and lead both with and without authority is vital.Demonstrates good judgment in identifying methods and techniques to support the compliance process.Demonstrates problem solving and sound decision-making skills.Fluency in written and spoken English is mandatory.Excellent team player and ability to work independently under pressure.

title: Senior Manager - Commercial Strategy & Intelligence (Product Analyst)
description: Job Purpose: Act as key data support and business partner for Marketing Division to ensure timely decision making and justification Key Accountabilities: • Responsible for managing the product analyst team and ensure an effective combination of channels and campaigns to optimize ROI of campaigns. Set measurable KPIs and objectives for all activity and ensure from the outset that these are built into campaign design by product owners • Business modelling and evaluation of business idea with the underlying aim to maximize opportunities for the company. Work closely with the various business stakeholders to prepare and gain approval on the business cases that are required for the campaigns in a timely manner. • Lead the team of analyst in forecasting the business outlook and provides measures to close gap • Regular engagement with the business stakeholders in the planning of revenue, usage and churn campaigns. • Lead and ensure that feedback, key learnings from the campaigns and improvement recommendation for future campaigns and disseminate to the business stakeholders • Lead the Market intelligence and benchmark of Product pricing best practices. Key Experiences and Qualifications: • Professional degree in finance / business / marketing related • Min 8 years working experience in similar role • Knowledge in commercial and analytical skills around pricing.Company OverviewU Mobile is Malaysia’s most dynamic and innovative mobile telecommunication service provider that offers millions of next generation mobile consumers the freedom to “Live Connected”. Since 2007, the company has been constantly providing high quality mobile voice and data services with its wide distribution network backed by affordable pricing strategies. It has one of the most unique telecommunications network structures in the region backed by its own-built network infrastructure, which supports high-speed mobile broadband; and Asia’s first active 3G Radio Access Network (RAN) sharing, covering major urban areas in the East and West Malaysia.Customers of U Mobile can choose from a variety of competitive prepaid, postpaid, high-speed mobile Internet plans and latest mobile devices to achieve a fully connected lifestyle anywhere and anytime . The products and services distinguish themselves through attractive value propositions and value-added services, giving consumers high quality mobile services at best value rates. U Mobile also made its products and services to be highly accessible through traditional and non-traditional distribution channels to broaden audience reach. These strategic business approaches are the core reasons why U Mobile was awarded the coveted Frost & Sullivan’s “Most Promising Service Provider of the Year” at the 2012 Frost & Sullivan Malaysia Excellence Awards.U Mobile’s major shareholders include U Telemedia Sdn Bhd (an investment by Tan Sri Vincent Tan, Founder of Berjaya Group) and Straits Mobile Investments Pte Ltd (a subsidiary of Singapore Technologies Telemedia Pte Ltd - ST Telemedia). U Telemedia’s stake in U Mobile provides an unparalleled support advantage, as U Mobile is able to reach out to a wider audience through the Berjaya Group of Companies for its nationwide distribution channels, local business network and joint marketing collaborations. This partnership is also supported by ST Telemedia’s telecommunications expertise, which gives U Mobile an edge by increasing competitiveness in the marketplace.U Mobile will continue to leverage on strategic partnerships and innovation to translate technological advancements into more affordable and flexible products and services for its millions of customers. The aim is to provide customers an enhanced and seamless mobile experience with U Mobile.Live Connected with U Mobile!For more information, please visit http://www.u.com.my or participate in U Mobile’s various social activities by visiting http://www.fb.com/umobile.Why Join Us?We’re a company that’s all about fun and we welcome new members to join and grow further with us. Today, U Mobile boasts a vibrant workforce and culture that centre on its 5 corporate values of excellence through Passion, Trustworthy, Innovation, Teamwork and Fun . These values are pillars to the company’s overarching mission:- ‘To be the admired Mobile + Digital brand that people entrust to transform their lives"Where all employees are encouraged and challenged to be creative and innovative, always think out of the box and strive to surprise customers with the best products, services and the entire mobile experience with U Mobile.So if you’re passionate and ready to explore a rewarding career with us, send in your application now!

title: Corporate Planning Manager/ Planners
description: The Role:Location: Kuala Lumpur, MalaysiaTenure: PermanentOpen to Malaysia passport holder only.Reporting Line: General Managers - Senior Managers - Managers - ExecutivesFocusing on Projects & Business Improvement Initiatives.Responsibilities:Lead and manage the formulation of long-term strategic initiatives and business plan in support of the assigned business units (BUs), service units (SUs), and/or subsidiaries to ensure cohesiveness and consistency with the Group's overall corporate strategic vision and mission.Lead the implementation of the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) activities/programs to monitor, manage, control and mitigate business risk to safeguard shareholder's return and the group's sustainability.Lead and manage the evaluation of potential business ideas, merger and acquisition (M&A) or corporate projects within allocated portfolio of businesses, as well as the development of effective execution plans (i.e. transaction structures, capital structures, and/or corporate structures) to facilitate the effective execution of identifies projects to support the Group's corporate strategy operational needs.Develop business intelligence and research to support the formulation of strategic vision, evaluation of business ideas, and implementation of ERM and investor relations.The Company:Incorporated as a shipping line in 1968, our client is one of the world's leading international shipping and maritime conglomerates with principal businesses that include the ownership and operation of ships, tank terminals and offshore floating facilities; the repair and conversion of marine vessels; as well as the engineering and construction of offshore structures for the oil and gas industry.Essential Skills / Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in accounting/Finance/Business Studies/Economics or equivalent with accounting/finance/legal/economics background and/or knowledge in Finance/Management Accounting.Professional qualification or relevant post graduate degree would be an added advantage e.g. Chartered Financial Analyst or MBAMinimum 10 to 15 years working experience in finance/accounting/corporate planning/equity research/audit/investment banking environment with specific experience in financial forecasting/financial modelling/corporate restructure/M&A.Experience in Investor Relations would be an added advantage. By applying for this job you give consent for Fircroft to contact you, via email & telephone, to discuss your application along with future positions and Fircroft's services.Fircroft is registered as a Data Controller with the Information Commissioner as required under the General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679. Fircroft will only process your personal data for the specific purposes of managing your application.Fircroft Tanjung Sdn Bhd (Co. Reg. No: 1103286-X)

title: AD / Director, Relationship Manager, Network Clients - China Corridor
description: Job: Institutional BankingPrimary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Malaysia-Kuala LumpurSchedule: Full-timeEmployee Status: PermanentPosting Date: 27/Nov/2019Unposting Date: OngoingAbout Standard CharteredWe are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.Job PurposeRM would be responsible for Origination of network business from China. RM would work closely as a team with Credit Analyst (CA) and Client Coverage Managers (CCM) in on-boarding clients, deepening relationships and driving revenue growth.The RM will be primarily responsible for developing the CB China corridor, working with the Global &/ Regional Account Manager (GAM/RAM) where relevant, and the China corridor team to deliver the SCB Network to China MNCs in Malaysia.Responsibilities include the execution/ formulation of country account plans of the clients they cover, establishing and maintaining an understanding of the client and their needs and steering the client relationship along with the relevant GAM where applicable. Candidate will be accountable for revenues, profitability and risk acceptance (AML, CDD and Credit) of the clients they cover at a country level.The RM is also expected to act as a champion of the Bank’s brand, culture, and values.The Role ResponsibilitiesOriginationResponsible as the primary coverage and origination point for the China client portfolio (both existing and NTB) which are in line with Commercial Bank’s appetite and strategy.Leverage on SCB’s network and franchise to capture more China investment into Malaysia as well as to ‘throw’ non-GAM Chinese prospects to the network.Actively identify client needs across a full range of relevant products, originate new business by capitalizing on the bank competitive attributes (e.g. Network).Develop and maintain an understanding of clients’ business needs and decision-making processes and identification of new opportunities for the Bank to maximize returns whilst maintaining focus on client outcomes and deepening client share of mind. It is key that the RM stays abreast of developments in markets/ sectors in which their clients operate.Engagement of senior internal stakeholders where necessary to deepen client relationship and resolution of any other pertinent issues.Client on-boarding & deal executionResponsible for working with the GAM &/ RAM (where relevant) & other relevant internal parties to deliver the SCB network to our clients by ensuring an efficient client on-boarding and deal execution process.Working collaboratively with the GAM &/ RAM (where relevant), Product Partners and other relevant parties to provide well-designed solutions that meet client needs.Take the initiative regarding regulatory, reputational and ethical matters, and provide proactive advice to clients on these issuesEmbed the Group’s values and code of conduct and ensure adherence to the highest standards of ethics and compliance with relevant policies, processes and regulations.Account Management & portfolio qualityOverall responsible and accountable for the credit quality of the assigned/acquired portfolio. Working closely with relevant internal parties to ensure that client.Establishing effective working relationships with key client contacts and to maintain a strong working relationship with other key (internal & external) stakeholdersProactively manage the designated client portfolio to ensure:Risks are appropriately identified and managed. Consult with internal relevant stakeholders to ensure that the portfolio remains credit worthy and within the policies of the bank.The client portfolio is managed in compliance with the regulatory environment, keeping up to date with applicable changes and Group policies with ability to contribute to policy formulation.Key regulatory risks and concerns are raised through the governance framework and with Banking management.Adhere to relevant sales disciplines in accordance with Commercial Banking standards e.g. Account Planning, Call Reports, Deal Pipeline Management, and static data management.Regular engagement with product partners to ensure breadth and depth of client coverage and deepening of share of mind.Regulatory and Business ConductTo display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. To possess an awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which country operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.To take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.Drive to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.Our Ideal CandidateFluent in both spoken and written Mandarin & English.University Graduate. A degree in Banking or Finance is preferred.Ideally 7+ years of relevant experience in serving commercial/ corporate clients is preferred. Experience in servicing international businesses under the cross-border context is a plus.Strong financial analysis skills and ability to assess client creditworthiness and key risk considerations/ mitigation. Sound knowledge of commercial/ corporate banking products/ procedures as well as a good understanding of local and regional business drivers would be an added advantage.Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages.

as needed for escalation of service impacting issues.Coordinates with Director of Operations to interface with client and handle account management issues.Manages the staff schedules and performance objectives for direct reports.Coach and develop a high performance team through organizational leadership.Demonstrate sound judgment and fairness when administering Arvato Services initiatives.Prepare daily/weekly/monthly reports and distribute to Management.Manages staffing ratios and seat utilization/optimization to ensure call center goals are met.Builds effective working
