title: Senior Business Analyst/Product Manager
description: Who We Are:More than 30 years ago, E*TRADE pioneered the online brokerage industry by executing the first-ever electronic individual investor trade. While the landscape of our industry has changed dramatically, our culture of innovation and drive to make online trading accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in challenging the status quo, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first.About the Role:SUMMARYE*TRADE Financial is looking for an experienced Sr Business Analyst/Product Manager to work on a portfolio of initiatives dealing with large and complex trading systems. The desired candidate should have prior experience crafting requirements for complex software development - preferably in the Financial Services Industry. The ideal candidate will serve the dual role of Business Analyst to conduct various requirement gathering and data mapping, but also act as a Product Manager for a new initiative to roll a digital monthly statement to all ETRADE retail clients. The desired candidate should be a self-starter, a problem solver and must be driven to solve complex business issues.RESPONSIBILITIESServe as the primary contact between our business partners and technology and vendors to ensure that business requirements are well-documented and transformed into technical solutionsPartner with business teams to support and ensure delivery of technology solutions that align with business product road mapsStrong analytical skills to identify, evaluate and define complex systems. Create product artifacts (business requirements, functional requirements, migration plans, communication plans, project updates for senior management) and gain approval from business and technology leadersUnderstanding of multiple data formats and the ability to relate the same to business processing needsUnderstanding of brokerage industry data formats such as FIXMLAbility to analyze and map data across multiple platforms and define data format specifications for technology and testing teamsA good working knowledge of data models as applied to databases and an understanding of how to extract and analyze data from a product requirements perspectiveAnalyze incidents and requests and ensure issues or defects are identified, documented, and result in timely resolutionAbility to work closely with vendors and provide feedback on vendor-proposed solutionsAbility to apply technical skills to understand and communicate the potential and limitation of technology solutionsAbility to build and maintain strong relationships across functions and levels of an organization to lead teams towards success-based resultsAlign with user experience team on user interaction, customer experience and integrate resulting designs and methodology into projects.Ability to lead user design and focus group discussions.Lead process mapping workshops with diverse business groups.Brokerage services knowledge.Qualifications:Basic3+ years of experience in product development, web UI development and/or project management.Experience managing the definition and execution of projects (conceptualization, requirements, design, development, testing, and implementation).Knowledge of financial products is required.PreferredExperience in the financial industry preferred.Working knowledge of Excel, Visio, JIRA.Superior analytical, interpersonal, communication (written, verbal, and technical), presentation, negotiation and problem-solving skills.Self-motivated, detailed-oriented, team player, and organized.Able to effectively prioritize tasks in a high-pressure environment.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.We offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please visit https://www.etradecareers.com/why-work-at-etrade/employee-benefits/ to learn more about the opportunities.E*TRADE Financial is an Equal Opportunity Employer who encourages diversity in the workplace. title: Manager, Data Analytics & Metrics
description: With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!ResponsibilitiesQualificationsThis position is responsible for assuring simple access and delivery of data, metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) through the creation of dashboards and reports to support the organization. Enables operational excellence by developing and promoting data analytics and metrics to drive visibility, insights, and actions that facilitate decision making across CSL Plasma. Creates, maintains and then collaborates with customers to provide training and support of department-specific metrics.Responsibilities1. Creation of Data Visualizations and dashboard development using Qlik Sense data modeling to provide easy and timely access to data for use in supporting the decision-making process.2. Data Steward responsible for overseeing data from source systems. Aids in ensuring the validity of all data loaded into data systems by following appropriate business rules, metrics, and validation criteria.3. Member of Data Analytics Team with representation from functions with key data providers/consumers, responsible for:Establishing agreed Plasma-wide metrics and KPIs used in routine reporting and decision making.Developing and driving a process to routinely provide information to the Plasma Leadership Team (PLT)based on an analysis of key metrics and trends that can be used in routine operational and strategic decision making.Supports the development of a culture of Operational Excellence, in part by assuring awareness of the importance of accurate, unbiased data, metrics/key performance indicators, and analysis to drive actionable intelligence and excellent decision making around performance and efficiencies.4. Coordinates with all stakeholders (including all function heads, DD's, RD's, ADOQ's, OE roles, etc.) to identify useful data and to interpret data in an unbiased fashion to help make the right adjustments/improvements. title: Senior Manager, Data & Analytics
description: Kraft Heinz, The CompanyAs one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic master brands like Heinz, Kraft and Planters. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like DEVOUR and Primal Kitchen. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love.Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people.Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and CollaborationWe’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage.As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.Job DescriptionRole / TitleThe Data & Analytics Senior Project Manager will play a pivotal role driving Data & Analytics projects that have material impact on the global KHC Data & Analytics organization and our vision to be the best analytics team in the CPG industry while empowering Kraft Heinz to become the best food company growing a better world. This newly created position will be charged with driving transformational projects aligned with Kraft Heinz’s next generation of sell-out data infrastructure. This infrastructure will be key for our Company’s ongoing digital transformation.The successful candidate will be a highly skilled Project Manager who is comfortable working as an individual contributor, he/she will be experienced driving multiple concurrent projects engaging with multiple business units/functions with both on-shore and off-shore resources/teams. The Project Manager will work on complex and multi-faceted projects. He/she will have to place projects within a manageable scope; identify key business issues and questions to be addressed; assure all open items are addressed and demonstrate a high degree of social and political IQ when synthesizing and pushing forward a single strategy from multiple viewpoints.While activities will vary and evolve, the Project Manager can expect to spend 60% of their time coordinating and leading projects. Of the remaining 40%, half will be allocated to developing and executing impactful project communication within the KHC project teams and with all stakeholders up to the level of our global CEO and half will be focused on developing and implementing new processes for our Data & Analytics Organization.Key Responsibilities include:Leading and working cross-functionally with Data Analytics, IT, Sales, HR, Marketing and BU Finance, for the deployment of Data & Analytics projects across the organizationPartnering with different project stakeholders, the role will be responsible for setting and managing a detailed cross functional project timeline for the roll out of solutions across the US and Global Zones.Meet and exceed pre-established project goals and deliverablesChange management liaison, partnering with Consultants, Implementation Partners and Data Providers to develop and deploy change management programs to facilitate the transition and adoption of solutionsCreate measurements of success for the different expected goals spanning across adoption, user impact, accuracy, etc.Provide updates for Project Steering Committees, providing status updates on project progress and visibility allowing steering committees to make well informed tactical and strategic decisionsDevelop and implement new data governance processes for Priority 1 datasets in our Data & Analytics organizationMinimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree3-5 years relevant experience working in roles whereby candidate was not only in charge of projects, but also had a strong focus on being a true business partner of the organization.1-3 years of experience in complex multi-functional project implementation, involving system and change managementExperience should include not just executing but setting up processesExperience working with Traditional CPG data sources (e.g. Nielsen, IRI, SPINS)Demonstrated strong communication skills, including presentations, written and oralStrong facilitation skills to manage differing opinions and requirements across stakeholdersHands-on, pro-active, entrepreneurial, independent, self-driven and can work in a fast-paced environmentExperience with large data setsPreferred QualificationsMBA or other Masters degree preferredPMO CertificationIntroductory SQL KnowledgeExperience in a large, complex, global, corporate environmentLocation(s)Chicago/Aon CenterEqual Opportunity Employer–minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity

title: Manager, Donor Data & Analytics
description: --------------------------About the Obama Foundation--------------------------At the Obama Foundation, we are guided by a core belief: that ordinary people working together can change history. Our mission is to inspire those people to take action, empower them to change their world for the better, and connect them so they can achieve more together than they can alone.That approach begins at home, on the South Side of Chicago, where we are building the Obama Presidential Center (OPC). The Center represents a historic opportunity for Chicago: a chance to build a world-class museum and public gathering space that celebrates our nation's first African American President and First Lady, steps away from where he began his career, where she was raised, and where—together—they made their home. But that approach extends to all our work, whether it's holding leadership training sessions in communities throughout the U.S., bringing local leaders together in countries around the world, working to support the global education of girls, or ensuring young men of color have pathways to opportunity.As we advance in our programmatic initiatives and move closer to the actualization of the OPC, we are investing heavily in fundraising and development talent that can serve as drivers of our mission-critical work. The key to success in these roles is a commitment to philanthropic excellence and leveraging our community-at-large to support our cause in transformational ways. As President Obama has said, "we cannot solve the challenges of our time unless we solve them together."For more information, please visit www.obama.org ( http://www.obama.org/ ).--------------About the Role--------------The Manager of Donor Data & Analytics is responsible for implementing and managing the analytical processes that underpin an effective Development operation and is the ultimate owner of all insights generated from the donor and gift data. As the subject-matter expert of the department's database (Salesforce) and the driver of the Development Team's data management strategy, this position reports directly to the Vice President of Development Operations and manages one direct report, the Associate, Gift Processing. A vital member of the team, the Manager is responsible for translating data for decision-making purposes that will impact the organization's short and long-term fundraising strategies and enable realistic projections and goal setting.Given that the Foundation is a young organization and the analytics efforts are relatively new, this role has the ability to continue to identify areas where analytics can contribute to improved operations and effectiveness of the Development Team. They are also responsible for driving a culture of Salesforce utilization throughout the Development Team, as well as advising on Salesforce adoption across the Foundation.----------------Responsibilities----------------Continue to improve Salesforce's capability as a portfolio and pipeline management tool for the Foundation's development departmentCreate statistical models to continuously assess the donor data and utilize those insights to better predict the giving inclination of our donors in order to help identify, rank and organize the best prospects for the frontline team.Refine and analyze dashboards and reports that integrate various data sources to provide a succinct, clear picture of fundraising health and trends; produce material to share with the Board of Directors as neededLead monthly review meetings with senior Development Team leadership to interpret reports and dashboards, translate findings, and use them to guide strategy developmentPartner with Finance to provide inputs that will inform near- and long-term fundraising projections, including analysis of historical data points such as gift size and win ratesDevelop and maintain a manual and SOP for all Salesforce processes and enforce Salesforce adoption across the Development TeamProvide insights and support to the Digital Team to help improve the Foundation's low-dollar acquisition program--------------Qualifications--------------Experience8+ years of professional experience; experience with data analytics in a Nonprofit Fundraising setting strongly preferredExpert-level proficiency with Microsoft PowerPoint and ExcelExpertise with CRM required; Salesforce experience strongly preferredMust have excellent math skills and attention to detailExcellent relationship building skills, with an ability to engage with, influence, and motivate people at all levels of an organizationKnowledge, Skills and AbilitiesOutstanding analytical skills, with ability to conceptualize a strategic analysis, convince others of its value, and return findings on an accelerated timelineExceptional communications abilities (oral, written, slide-based) and comfort developing highly tailored slide decks for leadership & key Foundation principalsDemonstrated ability to manage complex projects involving many diverse stakeholders and meet deadlines under pressureComfort and acceptance of rapidly changing priorities, along with an incredibly professional demeanor and temperament, and comfort interacting with key public Foundation stakeholdersStrong analytic capabilities, with an eye for objectively evaluating risks, tradeoffs, and options in making recommendations and decisionsSelf-confidence, integrity, humility, action-orientation, trustworthiness, calm under pressure, and deep commitment to mission and team--------------------------Equal Opportunity Employer--------------------------The Foundation is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Foundation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, parental status, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable laws. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply. If you are a qualified candidate with a disability, please e-mail us at careers@obama.org if you require a reasonable accommodation to complete this application.

description: General Description:Responsible for managing a team of business analysts, in the development of systems requirement specifications, coordinating development to meet business or other requirements, researching problems, and planning solutions.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Leads and Manages a team who is responsible for researching business problems, analyzing business needs, documenting requirements, developing functional specifications, documenting business process flows, coordinating with development, testing software solutions and coordinating user acceptance testing.Develops policies, standards and procedures related to business analysis methodologies, best practices, and standards to achieve the highest product quality while continuously improving performance and the productivity of the organization.Creates frameworks and processes, including defining business requirements, to support UNA's system development methodology. Ensures consistent application of methods and tools.Participates in the prioritization and coordination of systems defect corrections and enhancements. Prioritizes and manages resource allocation for the products based on changing business priorities and budget constraints. Provides input to the systems development roadmap, which provides the long-term vision for the Universal IT platforms.Collaborates with peer managers on department-wide strategy, issue resolution and decision-making. Identifies and oversees the achievement of targeted accomplishments and special project assignments on an ongoing basis.Collaborates with key business leaders to ensure alignment of business priorities and department initiatives. Works to identify current and future business processing capability needs.Participates in IT Quality assurance testing processes. Provides team members to complete QA Testing in a matrix manner to achieve desired application quality and stability targets.Ensures staff follow project delivery best practices and adheres to effective time, cost, quality, and scope management resulting in customer satisfaction. Assists staff in ensuring scoping of engagements, estimation efforts and work plan development.Ensures that customer expectations are met and ensures that necessary organizational or functional knowledge is transferred among team members.Advises project teams on the direction in the analysis and selection of strategic business automation solutions, including the identification of vendor solutions. Provides senior leaders with alternatives, financial analyses, staffing requirements and estimated timeline impacts.Promotes and ensures effective interdepartmental, departmental and enterprise-wide communications. Communicates and supports goals and decisions made by executive and senior management.Stays abreast to trends within the insurance and technology industries. Communicates relevant industry news and information to peers and staff.Manages staff, including hiring, training, scheduling work assignments and conducting evaluations. Learns the responsibilities of the functional departments and understands the approaches and tools of current management to meet those responsibilities as they relate to necessary IT. Develops and leads execution of project plans inclusive of assigning and monitoring tasks.Serves as backup or escalation point of contact for on-call support to operational systems. Makes recommendations to eliminate future production problems or service outages.Reviews and/or approves project plans, estimates, schedules, status reports, issue logs and deliverables as required. Coaches staff to ensure continued progress, risk mitigation and issue resolution as necessary. Serves as an escalation point of contact for resolution of issues.Prepares and delivers status reports, proposals and presentations to executive and senior management.Performs other duties as required.Supplemental Information:This job description has been prepared to indicate the general nature and level of the work that the employees perform within their classification. This description is not and cannot be interpreted as an inventory of all the duties, tasks, responsibilities and qualifications required for the employees assigned to this job.Education and/or Experience:Bachelor's degree in management information systems, computer science, or equivalent experience, required. Masters preferred.8 years of previous experience in functional business area, information technology, insurance systems, technical applications, information systems, or equivalent, required.Strong management and leadership skills. Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills. Superior interviewing and negotiation skills.Subject matter expertise regarding current systems and business process optimization, requirement elicitation, facilitation and client expectation management.Strong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Strong customer service orientation and commitment to quality. Ability to handle difficult situations with tact and diplomacy.Excellent research, analytical, problem-solving and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.Must be proficient in the following: Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Word, Power Point and Visio).Ability to direct the work of others in a team environment. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Experience working as a part of an Agile development team.Self-motivated, detail-oriented, energetic, and highly organized leader while remaining flexible & effective under pressure.Must possess strong organizational skills with demonstrated attention to detail.Must be flexible and able to adapt in a changing business environment.Must possess a positive attitude and strong work ethic. Must be able to see tasks of the team through to completion without significant guidance.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group (executives, managers, and subject matter experts).Prior experience in the insurance industry preferred (Property & Casualty ideal).Licenses and / or Certifications:Systems certifications and / or licenses are preferred.

title: EDUCATION RESEARCH ANALYST MANAGER (Academic Policy)
description: Supplemental InformationOffice of Academic Policy – Division of Data AnalyticsJob Focus Areas:This Education Research Manager is located within the Division of Data & Information Management, and reports to the unclassified Division Director. This position is responsible for directing an organizational unit of data analysts and system managers in order to design, implement and maintain a comprehensive data collection program and measures for the Department. This position also manages, guides and builds analytical and systemic processes for data management. Additionally, this position directs the collaboration between Local Education Agencies (LEA), data stewards, technology staff, data staff, and program/policy offices to ensure that quality data is collected, stored, shared and reported in a manner consistent with the needs of the organization.**Note regarding the advertised pay range: The Education Research Analyst series has an established special entrance rate and is the advertised minimum. The maximum amounts listed are the maximum salary amounts a person can make at each level over their career and not the maximum amount we are allowed to pay a new hire.One position is available and will be filled by promotion of a permanent classified employee of the Department of Education.You may attach a resume; however only the information listed on the online application will be considered to determine qualification. All education, prior experience, including dates related to education and prior experience MUST be listed on the online application.To be considered for this position, you are encouraged to attach a copy of your college transcript(s) to your online application, fax to the Department of Education (DOE) Human Resources Office at 225-342-1499 or mail to the DOE Human Resources Office, P. O. Box 94064, Baton Rouge, Louisiana 70804 by the closing date of this announcement.This is Announcement #50591352.No Civil Service test score is required in order to be considered for this vacancy.To apply for this vacancy, click on the "Apply" link above and complete an electronic application, which can be used for this vacancy as well as future job opportunities. Applicants are responsible for checking the status of their application to determine where they are in the recruitment process. Further status message information is located under the Information section of the Current Job Opportunities page.For further information about this vacancy contact:ldoejobs@la.govLouisiana Department of Education – Human ResourcesPO Box 94064Baton Rouge, LA 70804Louisiana is a State as a Model Employer for People with Disabilities.QualificationsQUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:A master's degree which included a total of twelve graduate semester hours (excluding dissertation hours) in any one or a combination of the following: statistics, educational research, psychometric measurement, research methodology, research design, quantitative business analysis, educational evaluation, program evaluation, qualitative methods, data management, mathematics, or computer science plus three years of professional level experience in program evaluation, educational research, statistical analysis, psychometric measurement, data management, mathematics or information technology.SUBSTITUTIONS:A Ph.D. in qualifying fields will substitute for two years of the required experience.NOTE:Data management includes such duties as the use of megadata to develop comprehensive data catalogues, the development and application of data extraction and replication tools to build and maintain data bases, and the establishment of on-line application processing processes for accomplishing multi-user data access.NOTE:Any college hours or degree must be from a school accredited by one of the following regional accrediting bodies: the Middle States Commission on Higher Education; the New England Commission of Higher Education; the Higher Learning Commission; the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities; the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools; and the Western Association of Schools and Colleges.Job ConceptsFunction of Work:To supervise an organizational unit responsible for state-level research and planning, and multivariate data analysts.Level of Work:Manager.Supervision Received:Administrative direction from an unclassified Division Director.Supervision Exercised:Direct line over subordinate Education Research Analysts, Education Information Consultants and other professional and technical staff. Functional supervision is exercised, as needed, in project settings.Location of Work:Department of Education.Job Distinctions:Differs from Education Research Analysts and Education Information Consultants by the presence of administrative responsibilities and direct line supervisory duties.Differs from all other education job titles by the emphasis being on research work within the agency rather than educational programs.Differs from all other education job titles by the complexity of the work required in the areas of research design and statistical analysis.Examples of WorkDirects Education Research Analysts and/or administrators in order to design, pilot, and/or implement data collections, including such specialized activities as (a) designing sampling schemes and developing/piloting survey instruments; (b) analyzing data sets using various univariate and multivariate statistical software packages, relational or spreadsheet programs; and/or (c) using qualitative methods to gather and analyze data from observations, focus groups, interviews, and/or other text materials using qualitative software.Recruits, interviews, and recommends approval for hiring personnel and evaluates performance of personnel.Advises the unclassified division director of specific issues related to education research.Directs Education Research Analysts and/or other staff in conducting basic research projects and/or segments of larger or more complex studies. Works collaboratively with contractors or subcontractors on research projects.Drafts data collection and/or management policies and procedures for review by an unclassified Division Director. Directs Education Research Analysts and/or other staff in the review and verification of data collected by the Department for validity and accuracy, using a variety of analytical and statistical methods.Serves as the chief liaison to educators and members of the general public in collecting and/or interpreting education data for school improvement and/or other education decision-making purposes. Advises other Department units in the collection and/or utilization of education data for research and/or evaluation purposes.

title: Senior Manager, Operational Excellence & Data Analytics (OE/DA) – Quality Control Project Manager
description: With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 20,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL's therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!ResponsibilitiesQualificationsCSL Behring is a global biotherapeutics leader driven by its promise to save lives. Analytics methodologyManaging and driving cross-functional project teams involving the sites and functions, ensuring the execution of the project, implementation of the defined solutions and environment and improvement activities in a highly regulated environmentProven track record in managing performance and delivering business valueExceptional interpersonal and collaboration title: Senior Manager - Business Intelligence / Data Analytics
description: Summary:The Senior Manager - Business Intelligence / Data Analytics directly oversees a team of 8 IT professionals to design, plan, coordinate, implement and maintain and related application technologies tied to Business Intelligence and Data Analytics. This position will work closely with application owners, management and faculty members as a customer-oriented partner to identify, categorize and prioritize requests; to contribute to the development of project and program roadmaps, and to develop and support cost-effective technology solutions.Responsibilities:Define and communicate milestones, service level agreements, and resource allocation to executive team, department leads, support staff, and end users.Develop and review budgets and ensure they comply with stated objectives.Review performance of IT systems to determine operating costs, productivity levels, and upgrade requirements.Develop vendor bid requirements, reviews submitted bids for compliance with stated requirements, and makes the appropriate award.Contribute to business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for IT spending and initiatives.Responsible for ensuring an exceptional customer experience; for streamlined processes and stable operations; for managing vendors; for developing a culture of and skills in process improvement; for proper documentation; and for staff training, performance and development.Responsible for establishing service level agreements that align with business and research strategies and requirementsWorks with on contracts and budget managementPresents business cases to Senior Management alongside top business stakeholdersWorks directly with IT Enterprise Architecture, IT Operations and with the top business stakeholders to make key strategy decisionsQualifications:Bachelor's Degree, preferably in an analytical field - e.g. Economics, Operations, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or related field; or equivalent work experienceMinimum of ten (10) years’ experience within a management capacity, as well as experience working within Business Intelligence/Data Analytics.Experience implementing & supporting Business Intelligence/Data Analytics applications at the enterprise level; strongly prefer experience with Lawson, MS Dynamics AX for Production, Customer Service, Finance and Human Resource managementExperience presenting to and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders to achieve program go/ no go decisions and budgetary decisionsExperience with systems design and development from business requirements analysis through to day-to-day operationsInterpersonal relationship skills sufficient to allow incumbent to effectively lead others, to develop consensus among those holding disparate opinions and to work effectively with individuals and groups made up of people representing a diversity of levels and degrees of sophisticationAbout Us:The Jackson Laboratory (JAX, www.jax.org) is a nonprofit biomedical research institute with over 2,000 employees whose mission is to discover precise genomic solutions for human disease and empower the global biomedical community in the shared quest to improve human health. A National Cancer Institute-designated Cancer Center, JAX has a mammalian genetics headquarters in Bar Harbor, Maine, a facility in Sacramento, California, and a genomic medicine facility, The Jackson Laboratory for Genomic Medicine (JAX-GM), in Farmington, Connecticut.The Jackson Laboratory's 43-acre scenic Bar Harbor campus is nestled between the Gulf of Maine and the mountains of Acadia National Park. Some of the best hiking and biking in the world (over 50 square miles of mountains, lakes, views, and dramatic coastline) is accessible from our campus. We are one mile from downtown Bar Harbor, which offers a vibrant downtown district with a plethora of restaurants, shops, museums, and galleries.JAX employees work in a collaborative, value-driven, and team-based environment where the focus is on advancing science and improving patients’ lives. Researchers apply genetics to increase the understanding of human disease and advance treatments and cures for cancer, neurological and immune disorders, diabetes, aging, and heart disease. JAX was voted among the top 15 “Best Places to Work in Academia” in the United States in a poll conducted by The Scientist magazine!Our Values:INTEGRITY - Courage and commitment to do what is rightPEOPLE - Inspiring our people to enhance the health of allONE TEAM - Unified by our promise to transform medicine and scienceEXCELLENCE - Achieving world-class resultsINNOVATION - Leading with discovery and creative solutionsSTEWARDSHIP - Caring for and enhancing the resources entrusted to usWhat do we have to offer?JAX offers a dynamic and supportive work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package, including a medical plan, outstanding retirement plan, generous paid time off, and tuition reimbursement including an MBA program. Our campus offers a fitness center with an award-winning wellness program, an onsite full service cafeteria, and a fully operational primary care facility available to employees and their families.Most importantly, every position contributes to JAX’s mission of discovering precise genomic solutions for human disease and empowering the global biomedical community in our shared quest to improve human health.The Jackson Laboratory provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, age, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, gender, sexual orientation, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, national origin, veteran status, and other classifications protected by applicable state and local non-discrimination laws.Learn more about career opportunities at JAX: http://www.jax.org/careers.

title: Data Analytics Recruitment Manager
description: Principal Consultant / Manager - Data Analytics - Los AngelesRecipe for success = 300 days of sunshine + Hottest tech market + Glowing new offices.LHi Group has seen continued growth since we arrived in the US, just over 3 years ago. With that growth comes the need for experienced, humble & successful recruiters. Our longest standing and most established brand - Lawrence Harvey is ready to grow their analytics desk, and needs an exceptional Manager to grow out that market, link with our strong client relationships and make their own mark in the industry!What You'll Be Doing?Leading, mentoring, and nurturing a team that you will be hands on in hiring.Managing already built key accounts while creating new long lasting and lucrative relationships with our clients.Running a 360 desk - focusing on business development as well as finding the best candidates for your clients.Working closely with the SVP to continue Santa Monica's growth in 2020.Building our presence, networking, hosting events & making the role your own!What Are We Looking For?Prior experience managing a 360 desk (agency rec) - including business development, screening, cold calling, and placing candidates.Experience managing, training, or mentoring a team in a leadership capacity.Self-motivated, organized and detailed oriented.Ability to manage client and candidate development.Why Apply?LHi Group has a renowned reputation in the UK, the last 3 years in the US speak for themselves; 35% of global headcount, year on year increased turnover & 2020 see's us striving for more! What makes us difference to any other recruitment agency or business... Our collaborative, high performing but unique culture! We offer a commission structure paying up to 40%, transparent career plan to divisional ownership or directorship, mentorship from some of the most successful but honest leaders in the industry! If 2020 is time for a change, clarity on your career or new adventure... Let's have a confidential chat!What's Next?If you're ready for the next step in your career, let's have a confidential chat. Either click apply, email me your resume to me - or give me a call - +447867 483 062www.wearelhi.com

title: Healthcare Business Intelligence Manager
description: Here @ Strata…We are committed to our mission to help heal healthcare. Our unique culture is driven by a social, hardworking environment full of talented people solving problems together. We embrace learning, cross-team collaboration, and continuous career growth. Lifting each other to lift our clients, our product, our company. If being part of a fun, fast-moving, innovative team is what you seek? Keep reading.We look for someone who:Is Service-Centric: Someone who desires to make an impact in and outside of our office. We look for service minded people to support our customers, each other and our community.Has a Growth Mindset: Driven to own your individual learning and development (We’ll help you - we have a team dedicated to training you and providing extra educational resources).Rocks Impact: Thinks two steps ahead to ensure the work we do will solve problems and make a difference.Will be a StrataPro: Accountable. Prepared. Positive. Core to who we are and how we treat one another.What you’ll do in this role:As Healthcare Business Intelligence Manager, you will be part of a team that is charged with increasing the value of existing products and delivering new products for our market. You will work directly with our customers to build compelling, actionable, and reusable analyses to solve the cost crisis in healthcare. You must be able to effectively interface directly with healthcare professionals and business leaders to understand the key drivers of their performance, as well as design effective reports and visualizations that help them track and improve those drivers.You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with product management and development to advise on analytics product requirements. You will work with marketing communications to define the go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the positioning, key benefits, and target customers. You will also serve as the internal and external evangelist for your designed content, regularly working with the sales channel and key customers.Define market segments and personas for reusable analyticsDevelop and maintain analytics content roadmap and backlogCommunicate vision to key stakeholders within the organizationInterview analytics end-users and facilitate customer advisory groupsDesign, build, and validate reports and visualizations to be deployed across the entire healthcare provider industryTrack utilization and impact of delivered analyticsDevelop and implement a company-wide go-to-market plan, working with all departments to execute.Your accomplishments include:A Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent, preferably in Human Computer Interaction, Engineering, or Clinical Informatics, but not required if degree is coupled with applicable work experience.5+ years of healthcare industry experience required3+ years of business analysis and/or analytics development preferredExtensive experience designing and delivering persona-based dashboards to numerous healthcare business unitsFluency with both healthcare clinical and administrative dataAdvanced written and verbal communication with the ability to interact effectively with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholdersExcellent presentation and listening skills, with ability to think quickly and deliver consultative responseStrong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects at one timeAbility to make real-time autonomous decisions when conditions change, based on understanding of the user context, business objectives, and client needsEqual Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Manager, Business Analysis and Integration
description: Logistics done differently.Ranked as the #1 North American logistics company according to Transport Topics, XPO Logistics is constantly looking for talented people who can create and inspire high-performing teams. As the Manager, Business Analysis and Integration, you will be responsible for the implementation and execution of Oracle Transportation Management (OTM) for new and converting clients. You’ll also drive continuous improvement and support for existing clients. Become a part of our fast-growing, dynamic team and we’ll give you the tools to build a rewarding career.Pay, benefits and more.We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), life insurance, disability and more.What you’ll do on a typical day:Analyze, document, configure and test OTM; identify and implement improvements to existing operational systemsTrain and deploy for new and converting clients while providing continuous support to existing clientsDevelop value-added approaches to Transportation Management System (TMS) project challenges by employing analysis, innovation and experienceCollaborate with internal and external customers, business development and IT teams to employ Lean principles to develop solutions and standards for complex and critical assignmentsConfigure solutions in TMS, based on defined business requirementsBuild and improve strategic relationships with client senior managementLead, mentor and inspire a team of professionalsWhat you need to succeed at XPO:At a minimum, you’ll need:Bachelor’s degree in Logistics and Supply Chain, Operations or Management Information Systems, or equivalent related work or military experience5 years of cross-functional business experience, including business analysis, transportation, logistics and/or supply chain solutions5 years of hands-on OTM experienceDemonstrated experience with gap analysis and managing multiple complex projects simultaneouslyIt’d be great if you also have:Availability to travel up to 30% of the time7 years of cross-functional business experience, including business analysis, transportation, logistics and/or supply chain solutionsDemonstrated project management experienceCapacity to learn and understand a full suite of technical solutions and make recommendations to internal and external customers based on business needsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills with experience leading a team of professionalsLean knowledge, including value stream mapping and Kaizen execution planning/managementBe part of something big.XPO is a leading provider of cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the most successful companies in the world. We help our customers manage their goods most efficiently using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team – energetic, innovative people of all experience levels and talents who make XPO a great place to work.We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran or other protected status.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Value Manager - Central
description: Join our team and experience Workday!It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.Job DescriptionIf you’re an experienced Value Manager, we are interested to make connections now, for our future growth.Our mission is to partner with our amazing prospects to help them tell their stories, to quantify what life with Workday will mean for them, and to work side-by-side to craft their business case for change.We focus on relationships, analytics, and business strategy. We get the privilege of advising leaders from the C-Suite of the world’s biggest companies to the first Recruiter or Finance Analyst hired at a small startup. We are workmates, teammates, and coaches. We are Value Managers.If this sounds like who you’d like to be, then you should consider a career as a Value Manager at Workday.As a Value Manager, you will:Develop relationships as a consultant and business advisor to a team of Workday Account Executives – working alongside them and the industry’s best pre-sales teams to engage, excite, and educate Workday prospects on their transformationCommand a strong understanding of Workday’s technology to deliver compelling and relevant messages around Workday’s unique and differentiated valueDrive engaging discovery interviews with HR, Finance, and IT stakeholders to help uncover pain points and to understand business processes within their organizationsDevelop and deliver compelling, highly narrative and engaging business case presentations to senior, including C-level, business audiencesConduct consultative quantitative analysis, ROI modeling, and benchmarkingOther requirements:3-5 years of relevant work experience, ideally in consulting, professional services, corporate strategy, project management, pre-sales, value engineering, sales, or other applicable rolesExcellent collaboration, executive presence, and storytelling skillsDeeply curious about business, highly motivated to have an impact on prospects/customers, and broadly interested in leveraging technology to solve business problemsUnderstanding of software deal dynamics and ability to think strategically about driving software opportunities forwardDomain experience in enterprise software, human capital, finance and/or corporate planning is highly desiredBachelor’s degree required; MBA encouragedTravel 50%, typically in region (mostly day trips or one overnight)

title: ERP BUSINESS ANALYST/ PROJECT MANAGER (PROCUREMENT/ INVENTORY MANAGEMENT)
company: Cook County Offices Under the President
description: Under the direction of the Director of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), works directly with the procurement and inventory management business process owners to support, analyze, document and enhance procurement and inventory management ERP systems. Collaborates with the procurement and inventory management community to assist them on ways to use the system and advance the adoption of best practices. Collaborates with business process owners to analyze current-state buying processes including sourcing, Electronic Data Interchange (EDI), solicitations, contract management, requisitions, purchase orders, vendor management, asset/inventory management and compliance monitoring. Participates in the review, evaluation, configuration, testing and implementation of solutions to correct and minimize gaps. Gathers requirements, recommends solutions, prioritizes requests and develops reporting solutions. Leads efforts to onboard additional agencies to the inventory solution. Supports third-party interfaces within the purchasing and inventory systems. Participates in the county-wide data governance initiative.This position is Actively Recruited and At Will.Minimum QualificationsGraduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree is required. (Must provide original transcript at time of interview). Five (5) years’ full-time work experience implementing or supporting procurement and inventory management applications including two (2) years’ full-time professional work experience documenting business processes, identifying requirements, evaluating solutions, developing test scripts, supporting application implementations and providing post-implementation user support is required. Two (2) years’ full-time professional work experience in project management is required.Experience supporting or implementing Oracle EBS or other ERP system is required.Preferred QualificationsTier 1 ERP system for multi business units experience.Experience leading/facilitating user discussions related to procurement business processes.Experience training users and facilitating business process change.Degrees awarded outside of the United States with the exception of those awarded in one of the United States’ territories and Canada must be credentialed by an approved U.S. credential evaluation service belonging to the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES) or the Association of International Credential Evaluators (AICE). Original credentialing documents must be presented at time of interview.Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Other CharacteristicsThorough knowledge of MS Office Tools (Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint, and Visio) and Adobe. Strong technical and leadership skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team. Ability to work in fast-paced environment and with limited resources.Typical DutiesCollaborates with business process owners to support current-state buying process, including sourcing, EDI, solicitations, contract management, requisitions, purchase orders, vendor management, and compliance monitoring.Maintains comprehensive business process documentation such as narrative descriptions, process workflows, sequence diagrams, activity descriptions, trigger points, end points, system interfaces, business rules, system users, and reports.Participates in the review, evaluation, configuration, testing and implementation of solutions to identify and minimize gaps.Partners with the finance and human capital management functional and technical teams to validate enhancement design prior to configuration.Develops test scripts and leads user acceptance testing.Provides user support; addresses user concerns related to system functionality; assists users with report generation, and training refresh.Works independently and as part of a larger project team to manage time, prioritize work and multi-task across many assignments with minimal direction. Prioritizes efforts, including directing support resources, to ensure that projects remain on schedule and on budget.Develops and maintains project management plans to efficiently perform duties, and identify risks that could derail plan, project benefits, or user satisfaction.Results oriented, and measured against deliverables, deadlines, and procurement user satisfaction levels.Identifies development plans to improve professional skills and abilities annually.Contributes to the creation of positive working relationships with employees, vendors, business process owners, and system users.Supports cross functional end-to-end Inventory Management meetings to understand linkages between inventory management and other business processes.Develops a working knowledge of end-to-end inventory management, best practices, as-is business process, event participants and triggers, master data management, transactional data management, item lifecycle, including sourcing, stocking, distribution, replenishment, reverse logistics, and/or dispositions and any and all regulatory compliance guidelines and/or ordinances that influence the business process.Utilizes knowledge to support analysis and develop recommendations based on business needs, or opportunities to drive cost savings or efficiencies.Creates business requirements documents such as Use Cases, workflow diagrams, traceability matrixes, and dataflow diagrams.Leads strategic analysis to support efficiencies in inventory management.Performs data analysis on Key Performance Indicators and makes actionable recommendations.Tracks and facilitates the completion of action items. Distributes timely and comprehensive communication to appropriate stakeholders.Analyzes recommendations for new processes or technologies considered by the business process owners for inventory management Responsible for working with them to define requirements, and risk mitigation plans related to testing, core implementations, extended functionality, compliance improvement, etc.Supports collaboration efforts with business partners involved with inventory management functions, by performing analysis.Physical RequirementsSedentary WorkSedentary Work involves exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally or a negligible amount of force frequently to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.The duties listed are not set forth for purposes of limiting the assignment of work. They are not to be construed as a complete list of the many duties normally to be performed under a job title or those to be performed temporarily outside an employee's normal line of work.Benefits PackageMedical, Dental, and Vision CoverageBasic Term Life InsurancePension Plan and Deferred Compensation ProgramEmployee Assistance ProgramPaid Holidays, Vacation, and Sick TimeYou May Qualify for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF)http://www.cookcountyrisk.com/Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.This position requires successful completion of post-offer tests, which may include a background check, drug screen and medical examination.Falsification of any information in the application process will result in disqualification, dismissal after hire, and/or placement on the County’s Ineligible for Rehire List for a period of two (2) or five (5) years. title: Enablement Manager – Data & Analytics
description: Enablement ManagerServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.Data & Analytics creates assets to enable data driven decisions to diverse audiences, and to ensure success we are creating the Enablement & Change Management discipline in the department for howAnalytics assets are adopted by user community. This includes determining what our analytics product does, how it is changing and the impact of changes; creating the best approaches to enable user community and manage change; developing and executing communication plans; creating and managing training plans & content; identifying and measuring success/adoption metrics.What you get to do in this role:Build technical understanding of Analytics assets being deliveredCreate the enablement practice for Data & Analytics teamBuild relationships and deliver results for diverse audiences including Sales, Marketing, Finance, Partners, Professional Services, Product, IT, etc.Create and execute methodologies to analyze the change impact of analytics products, determine the level of enablement needed, and create plans aligned to the expected adoption goals of the product.Tactically perform enablement activities, or manage execution using resources in other departments of contractors.Leverage enablement best practices, while working in an environment oriented to specific outcomes, resulting in “practical” enablement management.In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who can: This role requires 12+ years of relevant experience with mim 3 years of people management experience.Understand technical analytics assets being deliveredBuild Understanding of Data & Analytics products being delivered.Create artifacts for analytics assets being deliveredLearn what is being created / changing, and create training artifacts, align to adoption plans to ensure the meeting adoption goals of products being delivered.Deliver LearningTrain users and / or partner with other enablement team members to deliver learningLead and manage the enablement work of analytics products projects, large and small, and execute tactically.Manage the work of other internal departments, and vendors/contractors (when needed), to plan and execute enablement activities.Understand business processes of constituentsDemonstrate knowledge of how different departments in a software company operate and familiarity with core business processes.Navigate seamlessly between the “levels” of a product audience; sponsor; stakeholder; different user types; different locations.Quickly understand business processes and the needs of different audiences and be empathetic to their change while successfully leading them to success.Manage risks and issues to associated with enablement activities.Communicate and influence at all levels in a company.We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

title: Business Intelligence Manager (Sales/Customer)
description: Sazerac Company Overview:Build your career at Sazerac. Sazerac Company produces and markets the most award winning bourbons and whiskeys in the world, including Buffalo Trace, Pappy Van Winkle, Eagle Rare, Blanton’s, and Sazerac Rye. Additionally, Sazerac owns many popular brands across a range of spirits including Fireball, Southern Comfort, Margaritaville Spirits, Dr. McGillicuddy’s, 99 Brand, and Platinum Vodka.We’re proud of our award winning culture and distilleries. Our Louisville location has been named a “Best Places to work in Kentucky” four times and our Buffalo Trace Distillery has earned the title of “world’s most award-winning distillery” through the dedication of our craftsmen for well over 200 years.Since 1850, Sazerac Company has thrived as an independent, American family owned company with operations in the United States and around the world. Since 2008, Sazerac has experienced double digit growth every year! We attribute our success to a unique blend of our history, culture, brands, relationships, innovation, technology, and most importantly, our people. Whether you’re a recent graduate or an experienced professional, Sazerac provides extraordinary opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, entrepreneurial industry.Job Description/Responsibilities:Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence (BI), the Business Intelligence Manager will be a key player working with Sales, Distributors, Retailers, and Marketing to develop customer insights and identify opportunities to grow our business domestically and globally. Opportunities are identified through the analysis of internal shipments/depletions and syndicated data from VIP (iDig),NABCA (SAM/Diver), IRI/NIELSEN, TDLinx, IWSR, etc. The ideal candidate has an entrepreneurial spirit, is mentally agile, able to learn on the fly, and motivated to lead change.Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:Helps build a growing team of insights and analytics professionals to influence and drive the organization’s decision making. Establishes himself/herself as a strategic business partner with Marketing, Sales, Distributors, and RetailersLeads identification and communication of customer and channel insights driving insights from the data into actionable solutions regarding product, pricing, distribution, placement, and promotion to drive growthIntegrates insights, consumer and market trends, competitive data, channel insights, shopper insights, etc., to fuel solution-based selling materials, Corporate Initiatives, New Business Development, and Category ReviewsLead contact with Nielsen and NABCA concerning data integrity, database hierarchies and geographies, and report functionality. Provide support for organizational training related to Nielsen/NABCA/IWSR databases, tools, measures, and analysis.Perform detailed analyses with Nielsen, NABCA, IWSR, VIP (iDig), and industry data to present holistic business analysis and recommendations regarding pricing, distribution, product, and promotion to support sales and marketing priorities. Work with sales, trade marketing, and marketing teams to create custom reports, perform analysis in key markets, new item tracking, etc. to fuel sell sheets and presentations.Leads national account sales support with tools, customer insights, and compelling consumer and trade rationales to support fact-based presentations based on sales, velocities, pricing, distribution, product, and promotion analysis.Drives an agile, analytically-driven approach to identifying and defining business opportunities for growth; Develops learning/analysis plans based on business needs, executes, analyzes, communicates learning and growth opportunities, and delivers actionable business recommendations on time and within budgetDrives introduction and adoption of a comprehensive range of analytical approaches, suppliers, and tools to increase effectiveness; Seeks continuous improvement in techniques and costComfortable working independently with strong time and project management skills.Maintains the prioritization of insights/analytical work and seamlessly handles the organization’s analytical needs with internal and external resources (e.g. vendors)Actively participates in improving skills and documenting learning by identifying opportunities for self-improvement, measuring skill improvement progress, improving effectiveness at job, and achieving goalsQualifications/Requirements:QualificationsThe successful candidate will be a developing insights & analytics professional demonstrating 5-10 years of experience producing high quality, well-regarded insights & analytics work, preferably in the alcohol beverage industry. Additional qualifications include demonstrated experience in the following areas:Bachelor Degree in Business or commensurate experience required, Master’s degree preferredProven track record of delivering actionable business recommendations, influencing decisions, and impacting resultsStrong analytical and problem solving skillsProven strong oral and written communication skills with all levels of an organization, especially the ability to explain difficult concepts and insights in simple, applicable business termsDemonstrated active learner with the ability to make independent observations, and “connect the dots”Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new systems / processesDemonstrate the ability to work as a team as well as self-directedAbility to manage multiple projects at one timeProficient in Microsoft office productsWillingness to travel

title: Business Analyst/Project Manager, Alternatives
description: General InformationRef #: 28183Functional Area: TechnologyEmployee Type: Full TimeLocation: Newport BeachExperienced Required: 3 - 5 YearsEducation Required: Bachelors DegreeDate published: 06-Apr-2020About Us:We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $1.78 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 2,800 employees in 17 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.Position Description:PIMCO’s Alternatives platform has over $34 billion in assets under management across a mix of private equity, evergreen and hedge fund vehicles, and with a range of target returns. The alternatives platform comprises a broad and growing suite of flexible strategies, focused primarily on corporate, real estate and specialty finance sectors, as well as securities trading, and spanning the US, Europe and emerging markets.We are building a dedicated technology team to focus on the alternatives business. We are seeking strong technologists who want to sit at the intersection of finance and technology who will work closely with the desk to provide technology to the alternatives business. As a technologist in this team you will be working on anything from deal capture solutions to risk and stress testing.In the role of Business Analyst / Project Manager, you will be responsible for managing the technology pipeline end-to-end for PIMCO's Alternatives technology team. Your responsibilities include understanding the business workflow and demonstrating that knowledge to assist in the design and implementation of technical solutions, in some cases directly chipping in to the code base. In another key function of this role you will be communicating directly with Alternatives Portfolio Managers to document and prioritize their requests while effectively communicating status throughout the organization. title: Senior Manager, Epidemiology Real World Data Analytics
description: Job SummaryThe Senior Manager, Epidemiology is a scientific role that involves supporting the development, coordination, and execution of cutting-edge, effective, and impactful research for rare disease epidemiology at a global level. The Senior Manager, Epidemiology has accountability for supporting the development of Epidemiology Department deliverables to improve disease understanding supporting clinical development programs, regulatory submissions, and drug safety evaluations. The Senior Manager, Epidemiology will work closely with Associate Director and Director-level Epidemiologists in the Department and may represent the Epidemiology department in cross-functional teams consisting of Clinical Development, Pharmacovigilance, Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Health Economics and Outcomes Research, and Commercial members. The Senior Manager, Epidemiology must have mature team-working behaviors with organizational awareness and insight. The Senior Manager, Epidemiology will work with Epidemiology Department leadership to interface with key Alexion senior management and external stakeholders to ensure appropriate communication of results from epidemiology deliverables. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with analysis and interpretation of epidemiologic data within the context of rare disease, and will be passionate about the application of epidemiology to support developing and delivering life-transforming therapies for patients.Principal ResponsibilitiesSupport planning and execution of epidemiology deliverables relevant to drug development to characterize incidence and prevalence, time trends, co-morbidities, and co-medications.Systematic identification and critical appraisal of epidemiological literature to characterize incidence, prevalence, natural history, and phenotype/genotype associations.Oversee development of epidemiology sections of Regulatory, Pharmacovigilance, and Clinical Development documents, including Orphan Drug Applications, Risk Management Plans, PSURs/DSURs.Summarize results in written reports and oral presentations.Participate in cross-functional team meetings with presentation of summary findings to Alexion internal/external stakeholders.Maintain awareness of epidemiology with respect to regulatory requirements, payer trends, and advancement of pharmacoepidemiology methods.Support development of Epidemiology department processes and procedures.Travel may be required (up to 10%).QualificationsWork ExperienceAt least 3 years of industry experience in the pharmaceutical industry, biotechnology, or consulting environmentEducationMaster’s Degree (MPH / MSc) in EpidemiologyMajor SkillsExcellent oral and written communication skillsKnowledge of drug and clinical development processExcellent attention to detail and quality, and scientific rigorAbility to work under pressure and lead by exampleStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teamsThorough and up-to-date technical knowledge of epidemiology and biostatistics methods*LI-MW1Boston, MA, United StatesSome opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the extraordinary opportunity to change lives. At Alexion, such opportunities arise through our unwavering mission to serve patients and families affected by rare diseases. These patients are our guiding star, and we act with integrity, urgency, and discipline because we know their lives are at stake.
