title: Product Marketing Manager
description: About Perx:Perx Technologies provides a fully integrated solution that combines a next-generation SaaS loyalty management system and omni-channel marketing technologies to deliver revenue-driving digital customer experiences.The Perx Loyalty and Customer Engagement platform allows large B2C enterprises to drive meaningful digital customer experiences targeted at millions of customers. The A.I. enabled platform is trusted by the likes of UOB, HSBC, Central group, AXA, Prudential, Digi, among others in the South East Asian and European markets to drive revenue.We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders and HIPOs throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture and talent pool, join us!Job Description:We’re looking for an experienced SaaS Product Marketer to join our in-house marketing team. This role acts as a key conduit between Marketing, Product and the Sales organization. Besides product marketing experience, this role requires strategic thinking, SaaS and martech domain knowledge as a prerequisite.Focusing on driving demand for and adoption of a product among existing customers and prospects at the top of the funnel, the role demands an acute understanding of the product’s vision, feature set, key differentiators and our target audience. This understanding will help develop the product’s positioning, messaging and customer facing assets and tools that would enable sub-teams of sales such as customer service and customer success. It covers the launch and execution activities in addition to the marketing strategy for the product.Responsibilities:Support Head of Marketing to drive product Go-to-market strategy and execution – Starting with mapping and aligning product’s roadmap with corresponding marketing initiatives.Define and deliver core professional services, training and support deliverables cover positioning, messaging, and content to enable sales and customer success teams.Work with cross-functional teams to support press & analyst briefings, demand-generation campaigns, and events.Work closely with Channels/Alliances team to on product evangelising, onboarding and training for specific categories of partners such as re-sellers.Thought leadership – Express your opinion on hot topics and trends pertaining to our space and your field of expertise through blogs, social posts and other field usable assets.Field enablement – Work with sales leadership, field engineering, and user marketing to create and deliver compelling enablement materials and collateral to the sales team and partners.Focus – Constant prioritization across several competing objectives for optimal use of time and resourcesSkills And Qualifications:Experience in leading cross-functional teams to develop and launch enterprise software products (SaaS an added plus)Experience in positioning and differentiating in a crowded marketGreat communication skills, including written, verbal, and visualUnderstanding of Martech and Adtech ecosystem and applications and/or managing a data platform is a plusAbility to travel as requiredWhat can you expect:Treat you like an adult – It’s all about a healthy work-life balance. We’ll trust you to get work done and take a break when you need it.Give you what you need – We’ll supply the environment and tools for success, allowing you to focus on professional growth and career development.Challenge you – You’ll be surrounded by people equally committed to driving their KPIs keeping in mind the over all KPIs of the organization related to culture, top-line growth and customer satisfaction.

We analyse, optimize and implement operational models for a diverse range of problems for customers’ online experience, ranging from customer purchase conversion to fraud anomaly detection and chargeback selection management.The primary role of the Fraud Operations Analyst is to protect our clients and our company from ecommerce fraud. with a desire to proactively uncover new fraud patternsWillingness to raise awareness of patterns, including presentationsObsession with making things right for customersExcellent spoken and written title: Product Support Manager
description: Anaplan is seeking an experienced and hands-on Manager to lead and inspire an incredible team of support personnel that help transform traditional customer care interactions into outstanding customer experiences. Our Customer Care Product Support teams connect with customers through a variety of mediums including chats, calls and emails to enhance and support the use of the Anaplan platform.We are looking for someone to help transform the level of experience we provide our customers and partners, by inspiring, coaching, motivating and developing our support team members. At Anaplan, we see Customer Care to differentiate our company from any competition and become a proactive support team dedicated to elevating our customers' use of Anaplan.What you will contribute:Lead a global team with members in US, EMEA and APAC regionsManage escalations when immediate focus is neededCoach, mentor, and performance manage a highly skilled team of product support analystsMaintain best practices in customer management to ensure acquisition and retention of customers, and increased customer satisfactionCreate efficiencies and increased capabilities through innovation in support deliveryDrive World Class support through flawless execution through each contactEnsure adherence to SLAsFoster a culture of empowerment, enablement, and accountability within the immediate and larger teamCreate and document SOPs to share across the organizationProvide insights based on the team experience and customer contact driversCollaborate across Anaplan to improve our product, processes, and culture based on constant learningsDocument, track and monitor problems to ensure resolution in a timely manner. Requirements/Skills:Customer First mentality5+ years of experience in managing a team of technical individualsStrong interpersonal and leadership skillsExperience managing customer and employee experience through multiple inbound and outbound contact types (emails, calls, and chats)Experience and working knowledge of telephony, CRM tools (ZenDesk, SalesForce, etc.) and other mainstream support platformsStrong communication (written and verbal) to all levels within AnaplanProven track record of increasing efficiencies and customer satisfaction scores through technical supportExperience managing and working within a remote and global environmentAbility to create cohesion within teams and foster professional growth and development in each team memberExperience with SaaS and other technology companies (A Bonus)Comfortable in a fast-moving and dynamic environmentDo you align with Anaplan's Values?Collaborative: We go out of our way to help others succeedExplore all of our Values on Anaplan.com/careers#AnaplanLOVEAbout AnaplanWe're building a truly unique technology. From our calculation engine and in-memory data store, to apps and predictive analytics; amazing technology is being developed every day.We're addressing a $100B/year problem that all global businesses face. Our mission is to break the traditional business planning mold, currently performed through spreadsheets or legacy systems. Anaplan's Connected Planning platform is enabling customers to improve decision-making by turning response time into real time. With 1000+ customers and 175+ partners globally, Anaplan's platform is solving some of the most complex challenges in business. CEOs, analysts, and the press agree—Anaplan is changing the way the world does business. Learn about our history, see our recognitions and achievements, and take a look at what it's like to work at Anaplan. Get to know more about working at Anaplan by checking out our social channels.FacebookTwitterInstagramYouTube#LI-TT1

One of the requirements of this role is to take time to fully understand the investment universe including equities, bonds and funds, so as to be able to assist clients with their long-term investment decisions.You should consider this job if you are:Keen to learn more about the various investment asset classes and gain financial industry exposurePassionate to help others invest for the futureHighly ethical and place clients’ interests as top priority at all timesEnjoys working in a nurturing and supportive environment that offers a breadth of learning opportunitiesAble to commit to long hoursYou will be responsible for:Engaging in the investment process including global trend analysis, securities research and selection, maintain and document investment decisionsConducting due diligence, evaluating corporate financial statements, and analysing both macro and corporate events that would potentially impact performanceInvesting client capital in line with their investment objectives and risk profile to achieve maximum returns and asset growthEvaluating risk across investment process and managing asset allocation and positionsParticipating in account reviews & preparing and delivering client presentationsTo assist in Marketing and Sales of fund productsWhat you need to have:A Degree, preferably in Business, Banking & Finance, or EngineeringFresh graduates new to financial industry who possess positive attitude and aptitude will be consideredPossess strong analytical skills and are comfortable dealing with numerical dataPleasant personality with good communication skills (oral and written)If you are up for the challenge and are looking for an environment of growth and opportunities, please direct a full resume, including cover letter to the HR department via careers@ix8capital.comWe regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Manager Financial Analysis
description: Job DescriptionThe ideal candidate for this role will be able to successfully manage a team of analysts dedicated to providing analytical, strategic, and organizational support to the Travel Solutions agency commercial team. As manager, this role requires the ability to oversee multiple simultaneous projects, while providing feedback to team members but also producing updates to key stakeholders beyond immediate team. Capacity to understand paramount situational impacts and financial outcomes from limited and fast-paced discussion is critical.This role requires proficiency in communication and organization; messaging key deliverables daily to internal partners. Critical to this role is managing multiple projects while ensuring each is getting proper attention and deadlines are always met. The individual taking on this role will be expected to successfully manage a team tasked with winning high-value deals while ensuring company performance standards and goals are met.Responsibilities:Team management: provide support and organization as needed; ensure all team members have everything they need to perform at maximum efficiencyPrimary liaison between Finance and Commercial Account TeamsIdentify down-the-line headwinds and address well in advance to ensure progress toward goalsEnsure frequently used programs, systems, and tools are driving expected value to team, and act when neededWork across teams alongside Sales Operations, Accounting, Contracts Management, etc. to ensure end-to-end processes are fluid and operationalWill require a flexible work schedule due to frequent meetings across time zonesWill need to consolidate large amounts of data and complex scenarios into concise, easily digestible highlight points when updating leadershipAble to manage certain global processes and/or facilitate deal meetings on recurring basisConsistently find ways to motivate team membersMay require limited travel.Disclaimer: The duties and responsibilities described above is not a comprehensive list and additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time. The scope of the job may change as necessitated by business requirements.Job RequirementsBachelor's degree (Finance preferred)Management or other leadership experience, especially in financial or commercial settingDemonstrated commercial skills: Possesses an understanding of the sales cycle, customer purchase drivers, pricing and value analysis and the challenges and best practices of a high performing field sales organization.Desirable – a sound understanding of Sabre, the travel industry and the airline world or a demonstrated aptitude to quickly acquire and deploy complex, technical and commercial expertise.Ability to quickly distill large numbers of variables and data into simple decision frameworks.Versatile communication skills, including the ability to take an independent stance on issues while maintaining a collaborative style.This role will interface directly with Sales, incl. Account Managers, Regional Sales Directors, VPs, SVPs and C-suite leaders; candidate must possess communications skills required to influence and educate as necessary.Ability to summarize complex opportunities at the Executive level.Results oriented, passionate and demonstrates a bias to action. Always meets commitments. Pragmatic and tough minded.Must be a self-starter, highly analytical, with sound decision-making skills.Ability to work in flexible work hours during periods of higher volume deal flow or to meet large deal response deadlines.Sabre Corporation is the leading technology provider to the global travel industry. Sabre’s software, data, mobile and distribution solutions are used by hundreds of airlines and thousands of hotel properties to manage critical operations, including passenger and guest reservations, revenue management, flight, network and crew management. Sabre also operates a leading global travel marketplace, which processes more than US$120 billion of global travel spend annually by connecting travel buyers and suppliers. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre serves customers in more than 160 countries around the world.

title: JR Project Manager, Finance PMO
description: Job Requisition ID #20WD42409Position OverviewWe are looking for a junior-level project manager to join our Finance Project Management Office (PMO) team. As a member of the Finance PMO you will play an integral role in supporting global project teams starting with project managers and stakeholders working on in-flight initiatives. Specifically, you will help to build out a new Finance PMO SharePoint site including a PMO dashboard and roadmap, a project resource utilization model and access to project templates and PMO process documentation. title: #SGUNITEDJOBS PROJECT MANAGER - ASIA
description: Who We AreAt Iress, we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993, people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players, we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better, every day. Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 1,900 people across Australia, United Kingdom, South Africa, Canada, New Zealand and Asia.The RoleAs a Project Manager covering Asia implementations while based in Singapore, you will manage all aspects of a client implementation project across Iress Financial Markets and Wealth Management solutions including overall coordination from solution discovery, design validation to development to launch. You will ensure the project methodology aligns with Iress Delivery Framework (“IDF”) in which the right processes and disciplines are followed to deliver positive outcomes for both clients and Iress.When leading a project, you work closely with Iress account managers, business analysts and client project teams to articulate what success looks like and define strategic business outcomes for our clients and Iress post-project implementation. You will also work closely with Client Solutions and Products, to leverage cross functional capabilities across Engineering, Product and Data to drive the effective implementation of the project.As a project manager, you will lead the presentation of project updates, interact closely with senior stakeholders and teams both internally and externally where a combination of your drive, communication skills and adaptability will ultimately lead to the successful execution of projects resulting in positive commercial and business imperatives for both our clients and Iress.What you will be doing:Excellence in this role is ultimately defined by successfully implementing projects that meet the needs of clients and is reflected in feedback while aligned to Iress strategic goals.Lead the overall planning and implementation of projects to ensure all parties know their key deliverables and potential risks of any delaysManage a software development project using an agile development methodology and IDFFacilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables and manage this on an ongoing basisDefine project tasks and resource requirementsDevelop project plans to enable all parties to understand and monitor the deliveryTrack deliverables against project plans and report on the progress of the project to all stakeholdersManage project resources to ensure the project operates within agreed timescales making optimal use of the available resourcesEnsure project delivery meets internal and client quality expectationsManage the prioritisation, resolution and reporting of project risks and issuesWork closely with the Account Managers and Business Analyst to manage client expectations with regards to project scope and deliveryImplement and manage project change managementProject evaluations and assessment of resultsWhat you will need:Qualification in project management or equivalentExtensive work experience in a project management capacityKnowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project managementKnowledge of project management techniques and tools (eg Jira, Confluence)Proficient in project management software, agile methodologies and team collaboration software (e.g Miro, Slack and G Suite)Proven experience in client projects deliveryKnowledge of both the local and regional financial markets industryWhy work with us:Competitive base salaryGlobal opportunitiesState-of-the-art officesCasual dress, flexible work policyAccess to various learning and development programs3 days’ leave per year for charity initiativesGlobal 36-hour hackathonUp to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers), and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.

title: Senior Manager, Digital Analytics and Insights
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWildlife Reserves Singapore (WRS) is the holding company of the award-winning attractions Jurong Bird Park, Night Safari, River Safari and Singapore Zoo. WRS is dedicated to the management of world-class leisure attractions that foster conservation and research while educating visitors about animals and their habitats. As champions for Wildlife, we lead actions to protect them, inspire a love for wildlife and spark a sense of wonder in everyone, regardless of our roles.Come 2024, we will add a new Bird Park, a Rainforest Park, nature themed indoor attraction and Eco-resort as part of our Mandai rejuvenation plan. If you are a team leader, self-driven, and looking for growth and new challenges, we want you to be part of our team.Job Responsibilities:We are seeking an experienced Digital Analytics and Insights manager to be part of a team that takes on increasing growth opportunities in the digital sphere.The candidate serves as the data expert within the Digital Marketing team and would be responsible for defining the audience insights and segmentation framework, providing guidance on opportunities to grow online revenue and strengthen the quality of the funnel. The candidate would be collaborating closely with the Marketing team to optimize conversion rates and KPIs through data analysis across channels (media, website, mobile etc.), user journeys, conversion funnels and campaigns. He/She would also be the creator and owner of the segments in Adobe Audience Library.He/She would be a key member of the digital campaign management team, who will be familiar in ensuring optimal capture and utilisation of data to generate actionable customer insights. He/She would also be responsible for enhancing the taxonomy of campaign tagging to ensure proper tracking and dashboarding are in place.The candidate shall drive monthly online sales and performance reporting, KPI & target tracking with the objective to automate reporting as much as possible. He/ She is also expected to be able to identify process improvements for better data collection and ensure appropriate tools and practices are in place to support business needs.Job Requirements:Degree in Digital Marketing, Statistics, Business Management or equivalentMinimum 8 years of experience in working as business analyst or analytics role in a marketing setupAnalytical and possess strong business acumenFamiliar with digital concepts such as custom audience, look-alike audience etc.Experience with Adobe Suite (Experience Manager, Analytics, Target, Campaigns, Audience Management, Audience Library, Adobe Launch) is requiredExperience in collecting and managing first-party, second-party and third-party data to unlock customer insights is a plusStrong communication skills to convey ideas, issues and solutions with technical and non-technical audiencesWell organized and proactive with excellent attention to detailProactive in leading analysis and troubleshoot data anomaliesPossess a curious mind to want to investigate and constantly ask “why” and provide data driven answersAbility to engage stakeholders to build synergies within and across teams8 years exp

title: Business Intelligence Manager
description: It's an interesting time for you to come on board at Vopak! Around the world, we connect the supply of and demand for vital products and resources. Energy that allows people to heat their homes and travel the world. Food for a growing planet. And chemicals for the production of various materials. Products that are vital to people’s lives. We ensure the safe, efficient and clean storage of such vital products. The global energy transition, the growing world population, and all new possibilities of emerging technologies and new energy sources make this a very interesting time to join our company.Business Intelligence Manager (Chemicals Team)Global Commercial & Business DevelopmentInternal applicant: Please be reminded to speak to your current manager before applying.This position is responsible for leading a team of analysts that conducts worldwide product and market research, develops opinions for commercial, sales and business development projects and undertakes management reporting. Key products to be covered are chemicals, gases, veg oil / bio fuels and base oils. Position reports to the Global Chemicals Director.Responsibilities:Undertake Research to Acquire Product and Market IntelligenceKeeps abreast of market trends in chemicals, LPG/chemical Gases, veg oil and base oil products in a timely mannerExamines those market trends and develops opinion on customers/products to benefit from changing market or customer conditionsUnderstands key features of petchem complexes and clusters from a feedstock, product and derivative perspective and resulting market developmentsGenerates and communicates market intel to all divisions in a well-timed manner through appropriate well written reporting structures.Develops and maintains relationships with key internal stakeholders to identify emerging needs and business challenges.Works with internal stakeholders across functions and time zones to enhance their strategic analysis and market and competitor intelligence.Oversees a team of two analysts who conduct similar work to support the overall targets of the Global Chemicals Product Team.Conduct Market StudiesTakes lead role in scoping and conducting (or supporting) market studies for Divisions and OpcosCoordinates with internal or external parties to meet the objectives of the study scopeMaintains lead role in external relationship with key chemicals / gases product consultants (eg IHSMarkit, ICIS, Nexant, Argus, WoodMac, FGH, etc). Maintains a healthy relationships with external product specialists worldwide to support the requirements of all divisions/opcos.Delivers high quality study results, which are beneficial to the company in taking decisions for commercial, business development and account management objectivesSupports analysts in other divisions from a functional aspect and takes lead in their networking across the company.Initiates discussion, challenges and influences strategic management decision making and identifies opportunities for growth.Write and Manage Reporting ActivitiesActs as primary originator of product and market reports from a GC Team perspective supported by analystsTakes lead responsibility in developing / managing all routine and scheduled reporting activities worldwide, including EB/SB, global newsletters, divisional product information, presentations, opinions on SIP/FIP business cases, etc.Coordinates with other product analyst teams eg Oil, LNG, etc.Coordinates with other global corporate functions such as finance, corporate communications, operations and technology, new ventures, new energies, etc.Prepares written reports and presentations of findings, illustrating data graphically, and making complex matters/findings insightful.Support Business Development ActivitiesSupports BD projects in building a business case for products and markets in scope.Conducts investigations for port and site analysis, with a view to create an opinion on the viability of the location.Assists in coordinating market intel with consultants and product specialists when needed.Supports project teams in developing write-ups for SIP/FIP or tender submissions.Translates complex findings into actionable recommendations.Requirements:Bachelor's degree (technical/engineering or business/economics);Minimum of 5-7 years commercial and business development experience in the petrochemical sector or an associated oil and gas industry, and business intelligence experience an added advantage.Knowledge of petrochemical products/markets and ability to investigate developments that lead to demand / supply changes. Skills to conduct market research, manage large data.Ability to quickly learn and develop new concepts and technologies.Positive stakeholder management capabilities with strong communication skills.Excellent writing and ability to generate detailed reports.Capability to develop own opinion on key developments, and be able to influence others.Be able to handle multiple study projects concurrently, in different products and geographies, and work the time zones effectively.Leadership to manage own team, as well as work with divisional team members, to prioritize and conduct market research effectively.What we offer:Every career at Vopak is given the opportunity to shine! When you join Vopak, you can count on:A challenging position with a high degree of responsibility in a Dutch multinational with a history over 400 years;Highly motivated colleagues;Room to grow through professional training and personal development opportunities at national and international level.

description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHO WE ARE:Talend, a leader in data integration and data integrity, enables every company to find clarity amidst the chaos.Talend is the only company to bring together in a single platform all the necessary capabilities that ensure enterprise data is complete, clean, compliant, and readily available to everyone who needs it throughout the organization. title: #SGUNITEDJOBS GROUP PRODUCT MANAGER FOR PAYMENTS AND USER PLATFORM
description: About our companyWe envision a digital world that’s private and secure. Our industry-leading cybersecurity products empower millions of individuals to take control of their privacy and security online.Our SaaS business is very successful. We’ve been at this for over a decade, and we’re still growing fast in a rapidly expanding industry. We have the resources to tackle large challenges for the long term and are always innovating to stay ahead of the curve.Now we need you.We’re a skilled team with 800 people all over the world. Our processes are efficient, we make decisions based on data, our culture is meritocratic, and we offer ample opportunity for career growth. We’re bright, diverse, and experienced, and we love challenges. We’re looking for talent across all functions to join us as we strive to become the very best in our industry.Sounds like the place for you? Come be part of our mission.Join us as our Group Product Manager of Payments and User Platform!This is a new role and a terrific leadership opportunity. You’ll hire and lead a group of product managers covering our two most critical business domains: our payments system and customer database platform.Your ultimate goal will be to improve our rate of successful payments.Role ResponsibilitiesCreate the hiring plan for your team worldwide. We’re currently under-staffed. You’ll need to grow the team significantly.Create your headcount budget, structure your teams and align them with partner teams, design plans for assessing candidates, work with our recruiting-team to source and test candidates, and hire and onboard new staff.Lead your direct reports. Hire, train, motivate, assign responsibilities, and hold people accountable.Define the customer and their needs, and track how well we meet those needs.Envision what we should build and operate. Understand our industry, user needs, business strategy, and competitors. Describe your visions as clearly defined requirements covering user experience, business logic, capacity, performance, security, privacy, availability, internationalization, the metrics needed to judge operational health, and more.You’ll get support from specialists like designers, data analysts, engineers, operations analysts, marketers, and other roles.Coordinate across organizational boundaries and ensure that “what we should build and operate” is very clearly defined.Articulate business value and influence prioritization decisions. Prioritization decisions are typically made by consensus of 3 people: the product manager, development leads, and quality assurance. The results of those decisions are articulated in our roadmap, which you’ll make sure stakeholders can understand.Project management. Tweak and operate processes to ensure clear expected results, well articulated priorities that align with business needs, properly managed dependencies, clear timelines and status updates, and excellent stakeholder managementDefine how to measure the health of operations of your services. Review those metrics on a sufficiently frequent basis, and ensure that health-levels meet business needs.Manage stakeholders, including external partners, as well as internal teams, like customer support, marketing, and operations.Be the “oil in the machine.” Spot problems no matter where they lie, and make sure they’re fixed, either by yourself or others.What Your Team Will DoYour team is responsible for a broad range of areas related to how our customers pay us. Here are some things you will do:Decide which payment methods we should offer our customers through our website and apps.Determine how we should present these visually to maximize the rate of successful signups.Manage relationships with payment providers. Identify and select new providers worldwide. Make sure that customers anywhere in the world can pay us using the payment methods that are most convenient for them and serve the business with reliable rebill rates and reasonable transaction costs.Decide which payment providers to use in our backend to process payments.Define business logic and user experience for all scenarios involving requesting and processing both one-time and recurring payments and payment results. Account for a large number of failure and edge-cases. Do this across all touch-points: web, email, and apps for both customers and operations teams.Mitigate risks from payment fraud through well designed user experiences and automated and manual fraud-detection systems and processes.Role RequirementsProven experience in hiring and growing product managers. You can quickly ask questions to get to the core of an issue. You listen actively to understand the needs of many different types of people, from salespeople at payment providers to backend engineers. You express yourself crisply verbally, in writing, and in pictures. People understand you and are persuaded.Proven experience as an effective project manager. You identify and manage dependencies, you insist on tickets having very clear definitions of “done”, you lead by example in writing very clear tickets, you influence stakeholders to make efficient triage decisions, you keep work-in-progress-counts to reasonable minimums, your backlogs are well-sorted, and your stakeholders know what’s coming next. Most people on your team feel that the project-management process serves them well.Proven experience in defining requirements and shipping. Internal and external customers enjoy using the software products or services that you’ve spec’ed.Very useful but not absolutely required: you’re able to read code in high-level languages like Ruby. There is a large amount of existing business logic. It’s well-tested with automated tests expressed in Ruby. You should be able to read and understand those.Nice to have: Experience in paymentsWhat we offerChallenging work in a fun and collaborative environmentAttractive compensation and time-off benefitsSpacious open-concept and centrally located officesFinancially successful and profitable companyFull-time employment with flexible working hoursFully stocked pantry with healthy foods and fresh fruitTeam lunches and company events every quarterMulticultural teams represented by 30+ nationalitiesPlease do not include any salary details in your CV submission

title: Investment Analyst Manager / IPO
description: Our client is a one of South East Asia’s fastest growing tech companies operating in the online / eCommerce sector and has been one of the most widely recognized tech brands in the SE Asian region. With a forthcoming IPO planned in the forthcoming year, our client is seeking an experience Investment Banking professional to take on a crucial role in analysis of their financial performance and forthcoming Initial Public Offering in the following capacityINVESTMENT ANALYST MANAGER / IPOBANGKOK – TECHThe Investment Analyst will be responsible for managing a team of Financial Analysts on a regional capacity and reporting to the Chief Financial Officer. The role will be managing the continual analysis of their financial and commercial performance and helping to prepare for the forthcoming IPO. This will involve the following key responsibilities.Assist with identifying leads for the investment team, which may involve some travel.Support the investment portfolio by directly managing the weekly/monthly performance reporting process.Review monthly results and identify successes and opportunities.Monitor the company's performance, maintain and develop insightful financial and operational metricsLiaising with key function heads within the business to enhance their understanding of financial resultsAssists the Regional Finance Director and regional leadership teams as needed in annual budget preparations and forecastsPrepare reports to the Board, Shareholder and Investors as required from time to timeCore part of the fund raising team (together with Regional Finance Director), manage the data room, liaison with internal teams and work closely with investorsQualifications:Thai National qualified to graduate degree level in a financial subject with preference given to those attending overseas universities. .7+ years of related experience within an international private equity and/or Investment Banking Organization.Independent and a self-starter with ability to be part of a team, building from the ground up.Comprehensive Knowledge of finance, full sets of accounting, budgeting/forecastAbility to analyze financial data & prepare financial reports, statements, and projectionsPrior experience in preparing financial consolidated forecasts from multiple countries and managing budgetsA good team player who is pro-active, Can-do attitude and able to work under tight schedules and multicultural working environmentsProven integrity and maturity to accept added responsibilitiesExcellent English speaking and writing abilities.

title: Senior Manager, Marketing Business Strategy
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology.The Opportunity:We’re looking for Senior Manager, Marketing Business Strategy and Innovation to scale and drive growth across multiple verticals. You will work directly with multiple stakeholders, including executive leadership, product leadership and data analyst teams.In this role, you will impact Agoda's business through exploring new opportunities, identifying experiments, analyzing complex scaling challenges, and formulating structure and framework to existing operations. We’re looking for the future leaders who think critically, test, learn from mistakes, and adapt quickly.This position offers high visibility with senior management and with other departments within the company. This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand.In this Role, You'll Get to:Drive business-level vision by providing strategic context to product roadmapsImplement competitive analysis and develop actionable insights on our markets and business trends, and disseminate this knowledge across Agoda to make key decisionsSet up operational processes and help our leaders run the business skillfully, which includes clarifying accountability, putting structure and framework, as well as seeing through business-critical success metricsWhat You'll Need to Succeed:Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative/numerical field; MBA or other advanced technical degree preferred5+ years' experience in top-tier management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or strategy/business operations for a fast-growing globally operating tech companyStrong analytical abilities, especially with respect to experimental design and analysisStrategic thinking and planning, hands-on mentalityExcellent skills in presenting and analyzing data and creating actionable reportsExperience in and a passion for projects involving big data and statistical modelsExcellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to report and persuade different levels, including senior managementEqual Opportunity EmployerAgoda prides ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.By applying to this job, you agree that Agoda may process your personal data in accordance with Agoda applicants privacy statement.

description: Mô tả công việc:(Mức lương: Thỏa thuận)Job description:One of our long-term clients has recently decided to use Pentalog to develop a new version of their main application. title: Assistant Manager, Business Analyst Customer Servicing
description: Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!1. To deliver all activities related to the facilitating and creation of accurate and clear User Requirements for all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents related to the Customer Experience Division2. To deliver all activities related to the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) management of all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents related to the Customer Experience DivisionUser RequirementsReview project/new product specification/enhancement/production incident request.Facilitate the necessary discussions with relevant stakeholders to clearly identify and articulate the business outcomes needed for the project/new product specification/enhancement/production incident request.To be constantly in-tune with business goals, objectives and strategies of the organization and to use that knowledge to help ensure the business outcomes are aligned with broader organizational picture.To maintain a deep awareness on how business process works, to enable effective impact analysis of the changes requested on existing business processes.Where possible, provide options or possible solutions from a technology and process perspective, to meet these business outcomes.Identify processes related dependencies, and highlight processes improvements where needed, to facilitate these changes.To actively participate in impact analysis from a system perspective, identifying dependencies in peripheral systems, modules etc.To clearly articulate and document the agreed business outcomes, and business solutions into a User Requirements Documents, and to facilitate and obtain sign off from relevant parties.Participate and provide input into design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate system designs and validate proposed solutionPrepare and finalize Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) to sync up with Business Requirements, Functional Specifications Document and Test Plan with input/participation from Business Subject Matter Expert, IT Developer, System Analyst and Test Manager.UAT Management & Post Deployment SupportDevelop test strategy, plan, criteria, and expected results; aligning Test Plan with UR, FSD, and/or system impact (regression testing).Review and plan resources such as provide estimation on man-days required base on total test cases, test scopes, complexity of test cases, determine total testers required and work with Tester Resource Manager for resource allocation for UAT.Ensure all project parties are aligned on the project plan by reviewing the Test Plan with Business SME, Business Tester, System Support Tester, IT System Analyst, and facilitate sign off.Ensure necessary system access are granted to testers for UAT so that testers are able to carry out UAT assignments within project timeline.Ensure availability of test environment and thereby test scope can be completed within project time frame.Monitor the progress of test case execution, pass rates, while coordinating defect fixes with IT System Analyst.Follow up and manage UAT defects/ errors reported in identified Defect Management Tool in a timely manner.Approve the UAT upon the sign-off of UAT results by testers.Coordinate Post Deployment verification with Production usersDaily ResponsibilitiesEnsure accurate effort estimation for tasks / project work and timely updating of actual time spent for all work in eResource Scheduler.Weekly report to supervisor on works progress and issues. Ensure issues are tracked and resolved in a timely manner.Consolidate gaps identified during UAT for follow up in a master list.Perform other job functions and ad-hoc tasks assigned by supervisor in order to meet operational and/or other requirementsExternal interaction and management of stakeholders :Demand & Supply TeamTo ensure accurate inputs on resource availability to the D&S team; to enable meaningful discussions on task / project scheduling APO / Product Team / Other stakeholdersEnsuring quality and timely delivery of the User Requirements for all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents, focusing on “On-Time, On-Budget, On-ScopeEnsure accurate assessments on required effort for tasks /projects, advising & securing on resource required on test execution, to enable projects to be delivered ‘on-time, on-budget, on-scope’Actively identify and highlight risks and issues related to the tasks, and to actively contribute in identification of solutions and mitigating steps.IT / Business StakeholderPrepare accurate and detailed Change Request, User Requirements and walkthrough with System Analyst & Business Subject Matter Expert and perform any revisions as necessaryFacilitates necessary discussions to identify viable solutions to the business problem, factoring in the outcomes of the impact analysisWork with System Analyst & IT Business Analyst to identify test scope, scenarios and total test casesEnsure clarity and deep understanding of the new product/enhancement background/features, UR, FSD & System Design, to enable a robust and comprehensive Test Plan to be createdBusiness StakeholdersPerform impact analysis and work with relevant stakeholder to make a decisionAgreed test scenarios / situations where Business Users (as Tester) will assist in test executionCommunicate effectively or provide training to keep relevant stakeholders and business users of latest system enhancement/changes or issuesBuild a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

title: CRM Manager
description: Company DescriptionDigitas is The Connected Marketing Agency, committed to helping brands better connect with people through Truth. Connection. Wonder. With diverse expertise in data, strategy, creative, media, and tech, we work across capabilities and continents to make better connections and achieve ambitious outcomes through ideas that excite, provoke and inspire. Curious and fully transparent, we are always examining real human behavior to create authentic connections—between brands and consumers, clients and partners, and ideas and outcomes.Digitas is a highly-caffeinated playground where brilliant minds come together to bring bold, award-winning ideas to life.The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Lead Analyst – someone who can lead a team of analysts, provide strategic data-driven recommendations to drive client goals, and collaborate with internal partners to drive cross-functional success. Sound like you? Read on.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an enthusiastic and forward thinking CRM Manager to join our team in Digitas, Malaysia. The CRM Manager is a highly experienced, creative, collaborative individual. Someone that brings natural presence, business acumen and an exceptional track record working with leading brands, to blend strategy into extraordinary ideas that achieve effective results. They have a central role in building Digitas’ reputation for connected CRM effectiveness, leading to new case studies and accolades that will drive our growth plan. They work with creative, data analysts, user experience architect and technology professionals. This is because we believe that at the intersection of technology, connectivity and data can create powerful new connections between people and brands. The CRM Manager is tasked with managing the day to day aspect of CRM, help in developing programs, setting overall strategy and facilitating implementation.Key Responsibilities:Playing a leadership role for all CRM activitiesIdentifying strategic opportunitiesGuiding the entire ideation process and support efforts all the way through to deliveryBeing a champion for effectiveness and how to develop data-driven strategy and CRM programs – Setting KPIs and analyzing effectiveness against the programAbility to plan email campaigns and email journeys is a must.QualificationsThe ideal candidate that we are looking for should have:5-7 years of CRM program experience – consulting and client-side experience will also be a considerationAn excellent track record for leading CRM engagements and creative outcomes with global client brands in multi-cultural, multi-agency and network teamsStrong creative, brand planning and / brand consulting pedigree demonstrated through case studies, awards, etc…An analytical mind with deep industry knowledge, able to make recommendations using various research sources, tools and analytics techniques to uncover insightStrong creative problem solving, both on a conceptual level in defining the strategic vision and a practical level in handling planning and operational considerationsUp-to-date knowledge of marketing technologies (MarTech) and digital experience platforms spanning Paid, Owned and Earned / social media – email automation tools such as Salesforce, Salesforce Pardot, Microsoft CRM is a plus.Exposure to a variety of industry verticals with depth and breadth of expertise in one or two categories – FMCG, Infant Nutrition preferred.Authentic leadership qualities when working within project teamsAdditional Informationhttps://www.digitas.com/en-sg

title: Actuarial Pricing Manager, Takaful
description: Leading the market as one of the strongest insurance player within Asia.Your new companyThis foreign takaful operator is looking to onboard an Actuarial Pricing Manager as the organization expands and experience a growth. They are leading the market as one of the strongest insurance player within Asia in providing a diverse array of products as well as a leader in digital technology within Insurance.With keen interest in growing their market share by developing a variety of competitive new products, they are now looking to scale the Actuary team with the aim of having a strong management layer within the Pricing team itself.Your new roleAs an Actuarial Pricing Manager, you will report to the Head of Pricing and will lead a team of Actuarial analysts and providing product pricing services across the region. In doing this, you will not only review the validation of data needed for pricing products, but also provide the necessary documents needed for product approval report in accordance to Group’s pricing benchmark and local regulatory guidelines.Other than that, you will ensure maintenance and validation of pricing model is in place. In this role, you will be well exposed to engagements with BNM, Group, the Centre of Excellence as well as external consultants. You will lead the team in reviewing product filing as well as system requirements related to product pricing.What you'll need to succeedYou will have at least 4 years of strong track record in and knowledge in the actuarial pricing department at a Life Insurance company and has interest to expand your skills of merging digital technology with technical actuarial work. You will also be progressing well on your actuarial papers towards being a qualified member of an actuarial professional body.You will have a strong work ethics, proactive and innovative when it comes to technically pricing new products. You will also be the type of person who will thrive under the expectancy of doing something new to the market and industry.What you'll get in returnYou will be offered a salary of up to RM168k, plus a very generous employee benefits. You will be in an environment where exciting changes are happening and will have an opportunity to be a pioneer in a digital insurance. You will be a part of a tight-knit group that is always adding direct value to the business, and are very supportive of one another.If you are the type of person who is result-oriented and wants to make a real impact to the organization by being able to be proactive and giving innovative suggestions, you will fit in very well within this organization.What you need to do nowIf you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: Project Manager (Fixed-Term)
description: About DimagiFounded out of Harvard University and MIT in 2002, Dimagi is an award-winning global technology social enterprise with an impact-focused business model. We deliver open source technology, through our platform-CommCare, to help underserved communities in over 60 countries around the world. Our partners include the World Bank, WHO, the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, USAID, UNICEF, Novartis, Johns Hopkins, the University of Pennsylvania, the Harvard School of Public Health and more. Dimagi's work has been profiled in the New York Times, the Washington Post, Huffington Post, the World Economic Forum and Forbes, among others.Our team of exceptional public health and development specialists, software developers and engineers apply their experience in technology development, implementation, and global healthcare delivery to further public health and wellbeing.About the RoleLocation of Assignment: Dushanbe, Tajikistan, with occasional local and international travelDuration of Contract: 24 months, with possibility of extensionDimagi is seeking a Project Manager to represent Dimagi in Tajikistan, as it works with its partners to implement a mobile technology solution for providing health services in under-resourced settings. This will be a 24-month fixed-term contract with possibility for extension.Dimagi works on a broad range of international development issues, including strengthening community health programs, electronic medical records, care coordination, agricultural extension programs, and in remote data collection. The work we do currently involves the design, development and large scale deployment of mobile applications and dashboards for health programs and intense collaboration and coordination with partners to ensure the broader success of their programs. This role will also collaborate closely with Dimagi's teams in India, South Africa, and the USA.You will provide project management, technical consulting, capacity building, and training of trainer services associated with developing and deployment a health system strengthening IT program. You will have the opportunity to become an expert on digital health products and technologies (like CommCare) and develop solutions that enable people to live healthier and more productive lives. You will be working remotely in Dushanbe, but in an agile environment, alongside a dynamic, multi-skilled team of Dimagi's product managers, engineers, and development specialists.The successful candidate will have strong relationship management and communication skills and be comfortable working independently and part of remote, distributed teams. It is estimated that this person will spend the significant majority of their time on project work, while also engaging in some partnership building activity.Responsibilities of this role:Acting as the representative of the client on-the-ground in TajikistanCoordinate communication between partners in Tajikistan and the broader Dimagi project and engineering teamsGather requirements for the ongoing refinement, evolution, and expansion of the client's applications and associated digital systems more broadlyManage expectations of the client's project stakeholders in terms of system features, capabilities, and service standards. Manage the project with an eye to the big picture as it relates to long term sustainability, strategic value and impact of the overall interventionCoordinate with client's partners and vendors both within and outside of Tajikistan to ensure an end-to-end solutionPrepare and maintain project plans outlining the activities, necessary steps, risks, and dependencies of given work streams as the project progresses and report updates on a bi-weekly basisLead meetings to review project progress, mitigate risks, coordinate tasks, and ensure quality implementation, with the client's designated teamsConduct training of trainers on Dimagi's technology systemsWork alongside the client's technical leads in strengthening applications, visiting implementation sites, and building partner capacityTravel to attend client meetings with government officials and project leaders, as neededOther responsibilities, as required, to ensure the success of Dimagi's work in TajikistanCapacity building, and sustainability planning for eventual end client handover of systems to the governmentMinimum Requirements5+ years of relevant work experience, including 2+ years of project management experienceSelf-starter who can work with minimal supervision and operate reliablyStrong oral and written communication skills. Ability to represent us in meetings at various levels.Excellent partnership management experience. Experience of having managed expectations in a multi-stakeholder environment.Highly adaptable and able to learnWell organized and able to handle a high volume email inboxInterested in technology design and able to grasp and manipulate technological concepts quicklyComfortable with software tools such as Asana, G Suite, and SkypeProfessional fluency in oral and written EnglishProfessional fluency TajikBonus Points:Agile project management experienceExperience as a business analyst or technical product ownerKnowledge of the public health system in Tajikistan or other Central Asian countriesExperience working with governments in Central AsiaConversational RussianCompensation: Compensation will be competitive with market rates. The consultant will be reimbursed for any travel or business-related expenses.

title: Manager (Data Analyst - Physiotherapy)
description: You determine and collect relevant data from active units and training institutes to monitor and analyse injury related attrition trends which will help identify casual factors to prevent injury. You also collect data on physiotherapy and clinical rehabilitation services provided to SAF personnel and derive data-driven insights to assess the effectiveness of our rehabilitation programmes. You assist in the development of the communications and data architecture to support data analysis and decision-making, and work with stakeholders to develop routine and ad-hoc reports on rehabilitation outcomes. Your challenge lies in establishing routine systems to sense-make data derived from multiple data storage systems.You must have a tertiary qualification in Statistics, Basic Sciences, Life Sciences, Engineering, or Physiotherapy, preferably with at least three years relevant working experience in the fields of data analyst, scientific research and/or clinical physiotherapy. A background in clinical rehabilitation care will be advantageous. You should have the necessary technical knowledge, and be familiar with analysis methods, data management, data analytics, and data visualisation software such as SAS and Qlik Sense. Possession of strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills, and good organisational awareness are required. Appointment will be commensurate with your experience.(Candidates with no experience may apply.)Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Manager, Marketing Strategy and Innovation
description: About AgodaAgoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.Get to Know our Team:The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology.The Opportunity:We’re looking for Manager, Marketing Business Strategy and Innovation to scale and drive growth across multiple verticals. You will work directly with multiple stakeholders, including executive leadership, product leadership and data analyst teams.In this role, you will impact Agoda's business through exploring new opportunities, identifying experiments, analyzing complex scaling challenges, and formulating structure and framework to existing operations. We’re looking for the future leaders who think critically, test, learn from mistakes, and adapt quickly.This position offers high visibility with senior management and with other departments within the company. This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand.In this Role, You'll Get to:Drive business-level vision by providing strategic context to product roadmapsImplement competitive analysis and develop actionable insights on our markets and business trends, and disseminate this knowledge across Agoda to make key decisionsSet up operational processes and help our leaders run the business skillfully, which includes clarifying accountability, putting structure and framework, as well as seeing through business-critical success metricsWhat You'll Need to Succeed:Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative/numerical field; MBA or other advanced technical degree preferred3+ years' experience in top-tier management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or strategy/business operations for a fast-growing globally operating tech companyStrong analytical abilities, especially with respect to experimental design and analysisStrategic thinking and planning, hands-on mentalityExcellent skills in presenting and analyzing data and creating actionable reportsExperience in and a passion for projects involving big data and statistical modelsExcellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to report and persuade different levels, including senior managementEqual Opportunity EmployerAgoda prides ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. title: Quality Systems & Compliance Section Manager
description: At Jabil, we empower the brands who empower the world – it's our reason for being and the guiding force that's driving us to become the most technologically advanced manufacturing solutions provider on the planet. Whether we're serving one of the world's biggest and best known brands or the coolest tech startups, our resolve never wavers. We share common desires with these brands: to make the world a better, safer and cleaner place.SUMMARYDrive continuous improvement through the development and implementation of Quality processes, systems, tools and techniques. Provide exceptional support to customers, team members, and shareholders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESRecruitment and RetentionRecruit, interview and hire Quality Engineers, OBA (out of box audit) personnel and Quality Analyst resources.Communicate criteria to recruiters for Quality Engineers, OBA (out of box audit) personnel and Quality Analyst candidates.Coach Quality Engineering staff in the interviewing/hiring process.Monitor team member turnover; identify key factors that can be improved; make improvements.Employee and Team DevelopmentIdentify individual and team strengths and development needs on an ongoing basis.Create and/or validate training curriculum in area of responsibility.Coach and mentor Quality Engineering staff to deliver excellence to every internal and external customer.Create and manage succession plans for Quality function.Performance ManagementEstablish clear measurable goals and objectives by which to determine individual and team results (i.e. operational metrics, results against project timelines, training documentation, attendance records, knowledge of operational roles and responsibilities, personal development goals).Solicit ongoing feedback from Workcell Manager (WCM), Business Unit Manager (BUM), peers and team member on team member's contribution to the Workcell team. Provide ongoing coaching and counseling to team member based on feedback.Express pride in staff and encourage them to feel good about their accomplishments.Perform team member evaluations professionally and on time.Drive individuals and the team to continuously improve in key operational metrics and the achievement of the organizational goals.Coordinate activities of large teams and keep them focused in times of crises.Ensure recognition and rewards are managed fairly and consistently in area of responsibility.CommunicationProvide weekly communication forum for the exchange of ideas and information with the department.Organize verbal and written ideas clearly and use an appropriate business style.Ask questions; encourage input from staff.Assess communication style of individual team members and adapt own communication style accordingly.FUNCTIONAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESBusiness Strategy and DirectionKnow and understand the campus strategic directions.Define, develop and implement a Quality strategy which contributes to the campus strategic directions.Develop an understanding of the workcell business strategy as it pertains to Quality.Provide regular updates to BUM, WCM, and Operations Manager on the execution of the strategy.Cost ManagementIdentify creative ways to reduce cost by streamlining processes and systems (i.e. modification of responsibilities or consolidation of tasks, elimination of non-value-added processes, or complete re-engineering of processes and systems).Utilize tools to monitor departmental cost and cost trends, striving continuously to improve value.Provide feedback to peers (BUMs, WCMs, Functional Managers (FMs) on cost and cost trends.Forecast Development and AccuracyPrepare timely forecasts for the department.Compare forward forecast results to historical actual results for trend assessment and analysis.TECHNICAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESDrive continuous improvement through trend reporting analysis and metrics management.Assess the adequacy of data gathering methods utilized by the workcells.Assure that procedures and work instructions are efficient and not redundant.Offer new ideas and suggestions for improvement. Identify and implement new practices and processes that are "best in field."Demonstrate a commitment to customer service; anticipate, meet, and exceed expectations by solving problems quickly and effectively; making customer issues a priority.Understand and drive regulatory and compliance certifications as appropriate (i.e. regulatory requirements surrounding ISO9000, ISO14000, QS9000, BABT, TUV). Act as the company's quality management representative (QMR).Establish new measurement systems if/where possible.Exchange knowledge and information with other Jabil facilities to ensure best practices are shared throughout the Jabil organization.Ensure 100% adherence to all company policies and procedures (i.e. Health and Safety, Quality).Ensure all sensitive and confidential information is handled appropriately.Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor.Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree and seven years experience, including two years in a supervisory role required.Jabil, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Quality Analyst- Manager
description: Our Smart Compliance team within PwC is a centralised risk and control teams that assist the financial institutions in helping clients in regulatory related initiatives based on a standardised methodology and processes. We are Asia’s leading financial services practice and our firm is offering you an exceptional opportunity to work for top blue chip and high-profile clients in this sector.To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.As a Data Quality Analyst, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:Leading a team to perform first and second level analysis when the exceptions are being generated from the system highlighting potential data quality issues.Conduct in-depth review on exceptional cases raised by the team, gathering additional details through external research or from a RFI, to determine whether the exceptions are factual.Develop checklist and establish KPIs for the team to carry out the checks.Ensures consistent delivery of services based on the KPIs set.Interacting with other support functions across the bank such as Finance, Risk, Operations, Compliance, etcGather and document data quality findings after analysing the information and documents provided by the banks.Follow up on outstanding information or documents in order to conclude the exceptions.Communicate the findings and work closely with the regulatory specialist team to understand the regulatory requirements and establish the data quality checking processes.Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.About YouExperienced in banking industry, preferably in operations department or shared service centred of the banks.Regulatory reporting knowledge is preferred.Meticulous and attention to details, possessing an analytical and enquiring mind-setGood verbal and written communication skill in EnglishProfessional, confident and highly motivated self-starter, with an ability to handle multiple engagements/projects in a fast pace environmentPositive attitude to learn and strong team playerAble to work under pressure and tight deadlines

title: Manager Marketing
description: Tugas analis investasi untuk memastikan semua fakta ada ketika keputusan investasi dibuat. Pekerjaan itu menuntut, membutuhkan berjam-jam dan sering bepergian, tetapi bayaran dan manfaatnya bagus. Mayoritas analis saat ini melaporkan kepuasan kerja yang tinggi.Analis investasi mengumpulkan informasi, melakukan penelitian, dan menganalisis aset, seperti saham, obligasi, mata uang, dan komoditas. Analis investasi sering fokus pada kemampuan khusus untuk menjadi ahli di bidang yang mereka pilih, seperti industri tertentu, wilayah geografis atau kelas aset tertentu. Penelitian ini kemudian dipresentasikan kepada manajer portofolio atau investasi, sering sebagai bagian dari tim di mana para pakar di bidang yang berbeda dapat menimbang wawasan mereka satu sama lain sebelum rekomendasi akhir dan keputusan investasi dibuat.Seorang analis investasi secara terus menerus mengumpulkan dan menginterpretasikan data, seperti laporan keuangan perusahaan, perkembangan harga, penyesuaian mata uang dan fluktuasi hasil. Pengumpulan informasi juga mencakup perkembangan makro, seperti mengikuti perubahan politik laut suatu negara, perubahan iklim dan dampak bencana alam, serta industri dan sektor jasa yang muncul.Memeriksa dan menilai tren ekonomi dan pasar, prospek pendapatan, laporan keuangan, dan berbagai indikator dan faktor lainnya untuk menentukan strategi investasi yang sesuaiMelihat kembali keputusan investasi sebelumnya dan proses pemikiran untuk membuat keputusan investasiBerhubungan dengan manajer investasi dan jaringan dengan profesional industriMelakukan monitor tekanan keuangan dengan cermat dan catat tren pasar, peluang, risiko, dan produk investasi baruMenyusun laporan penasehat dan membuat rekomendasi berdasarkan informasi tentang peluang investasi baru dan dana yang dapat meningkatkan atau mendiversifikasi portofolioMengembangkan model keuangan yang kompleks dan analisis dokumen hukumMeneliti perusahaan, terutama dalam hal fungsi keuangan merekaMenganalisis akun perusahaan, lembar laba rugi dan informasi arus kasMenafsirkan informasi keuangan yang rumitMenulis ringkasan penelitian keuanganSecara teratur bertemu dengan manajer perusahaan, pedagang pasar saham, manajer dana dan pialang sahamMampu bekerja secara mandiri dan tim serta mampu mencapai target perusahaanMampu mengolah dan memperbaharui database client/ Nasabah rutin setiap bulanMenggali permasalahan keuangan client berdasarkan fakta di lapanganPotensi income 8 jt - 15 jt/ bulan, selain gaji pokokPelatihan dan pengembahan secara berkala dan bersertifikasi gratis dari perusahaanJenjang karir pasti dimulai dari Marketing, Manager Marketing, Chief Manager Marketing, General ManagerReward dan trip Luar NegeriGaji, Komisi, Bonus bulanan, Insentif dari Manager dan Royalti ManagerJam kerja normal dari hari Senin-Jumat (08.00-17.00), Sabtu-Minggu Libur"Kandidat baru" diberikan support sistem, pengembangan skill dan masa kontrak 2 bulan, diperpanjang apabila kinerja dinyatakan lulus dalam masa trainning.
