title: Manager, Projects, R&C Managed Services
description: By selecting “Apply” above, you indicate you have read and acknowledge the Dow Jones Applicant Privacy Notice and Dow Jones Cookie Policy , including data transfers as described in the Policy.Job Description:Job SummaryWhen you join Dow Jones you become part of one of the most dynamic news and information companies in the world. This position is part of DJ’s Data Strategy Group, which collects and integrates proprietary data and third-party licensed content, processing more than 500,000 articles a day from more than 35,000 news and business sources in 26 languages. Data Strategy also provides equity exchange data from 43 countries and creates content on markets, companies and people to help users identify business opportunities and manage Risk.The Manager, Projects, R&C Managed Services, leads a team of Data Analysts whose primary responsibility is performing AML risk-based review and analysis on individual and business accounts who match with Dow Jones Sanctions, Politically Exposed Persons and Adverse Media lists and adjudicate alerts accordingly for further review.Key Responsibilities:Interpret and develop data analytics with an aim to improve business performance and strategies.Identify trends and patterns to build simple frameworks out of complex data sets.Create best-practice solutions based on data mining, analysis, and visualization.Streamline processes by identifying trends and patterns.Hire, train, motivate and coach employees to provide attentive, efficient service to customers.Lead and develop a team of data analysts in a collaborative environment, with an aim to enable and encourage optimum performance of its people and available resources.Foster an employee-oriented company culture that emphasizes high performance, continuous improvement, key employee retention and development of a superior workforce.Promote a spirit of teamwork and unity among department members that allows for disagreement over ideas, conflict and expeditious conflict resolution, and the appreciation of diversity as well as cohesiveness, enabling each employee and the department to succeed.Focus on knowledge, demonstrate operational effectiveness, and eliminate unproductive practices.Liaise with the Manager, R&C Managed Services and ensure a constant flow of communication, knowing when to escalate issues to the relevant stakeholder(s).Study the regular quality control and quality assurance reports and coach analysts on the findings and learnings of the reports.Track and observe employees using a performance management and development tool that provides an overall context and framework to encourage employee contribution This includes goal setting, constructive feedback sharing, training and performance development planningEnsure timely delivery of projects in accordance with client agreement.Ensure that the team members strictly adhere to the Dow Jones’ and client’s policies & procedures.Focus on personal self-development and growth as an employee.Skills, Experience And Qualifications:Minimum 3 years of experience in AML compliance and/or Name Screening.Ability to analyse large datasets.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.A professional attitude will be necessary as the role will be exposed to client facing environments when working on-site at client offices.Experience with Factiva, Dow Jones Risk and Compliance (or similar products)are considered an advantage.Fluency in English is essential.Must have excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively interact with senior management as well as team members and peer groups.Demonstrate a strong sense of urgency by responding immediately to escalated issues and rapidly changing prioritiesAbility to deal with highly confidential information in a professional mannerAbility to maintain attention to detail and accuracy under pressure situationsMotivated, team-oriented, and able to work independentlyMust be a proactive self-starter who values personal accountability and ownership, and thrives,working under limited directionDow Jones , Making Careers NewsworthyAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets .Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, please reach out to us at TalentResourceTeam@dowjones.com . title: Oliver Wyman (MMCi) - Singapore - Research Manager
description: MARSH & McLENNAN INSIGHTS: RESEARCH MANAGER POSITIONFocus: Climate Resilience and / or Transformative TechnologiesWHO WE AREMarsh McLennan CompaniesMarsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC) is the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. The company’s nearly 75,000 colleagues advise clients in over 130 countries. With annual revenue over $17 billion, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading firms.Marsh advises individual and commercial clients of all sizes on insurance broking and innovative risk management solutions.Guy Carpenter develops advanced risk, reinsurance and capital strategies that help clients grow profitably and pursue emerging opportunities.Mercer delivers advice and technology-driven solutions that help organizations meet the health, wealth and career needs of a changing workforce.Oliver Wyman advises private sector and government clients on strategy, risk management, and organization transformation.Marsh and McLennan Insights (MMC Insights)The Insights team is a global team that sits within the Marsh & McLennan Advantage – our organization’s unique approach to harnessing the collective strength of our four businesses to deliver the full value of the firm to clients. Working both independently and with research partners, the team explores the major threats and trends facing industries, governments, and societies, with a view toProducing new thought leadership and amplifying the firm’s best intellectual capitalEducating colleagues and catalyzing collaborationProviding MMC with a voice on important issues and influencing external dialogueThe team works on key themes that form long-term drivers of change. Our research is global in scope and cuts across sectors and industries. To learn more about MMC Insights, go here.WHAT WE OFFEROur full-time Research Manager position offers exceptional career growth and opportunity. You willGain exposure to a variety of industries including: Digital & Technology, Financial Services, Health & Life Sciences, Energy & Utilities, and CommunicationsManage the execution of individual and/or team-based research projects. This typically includesDeveloping hypotheses; managing data collection, model creation and analyses; conducting primary and secondary research; creatively tackling information limitations; and surfacing insights for the benefit of the business leaders and senior management.Synthesizing findings into written presentations and documents; reviewing and discussing with internal and external stakeholders; presenting key insights and findings to internal colleagues as well as external stakeholdersSupport in managing and mentoring the research analyst team (8 people). This typically includes project administration, resource allocation, and career guidanceWork with the different global theme leaders (Directors) in Insights on theme-related researchThe role will predominantly work in one or both of the areas identified in the next section, but will also work at the intersection with other themes and with the Directors overseeing themThe Directors work for a global audience, and are based around the globe. This role involves working across time zones and geographic boundaries to bring the best content to our colleagues and clientsYou will work with the Directors in adapting global content to geographies of emerging markets, as well as contribute to global best practice researchGain significant exposure to firm leadership on Group and local business levelWork with industry experts and business leaders across the four businesses of MMC as well as external partners and stakeholders (e.g. partnerships and content sharing with multinational development banks, international nonprofit organizations, tertiary institutions, among others)Have the opportunity for broader career progression through employment with MMC, by joining one of the four businesses for a longer-term career in due course; this will depend on performance as well as job opportunities in the businesses at the timeWe are structured to attract, retain and reward outstanding people, and offer a true meritocracy with no artificial barriers to development and success.As per other members of the team, the role will be contracted through Oliver Wyman and will be based in their Singapore office.WHO WE ARE LOOKING FORWe are seeking mid-level applicants with a master’s degree (or equivalent) for our Singapore office with more than six years of experience in research and/or management consulting, with a particular interest in the areas of climate resilience and / or transformative technologies and how they are grappled with.Our climate resilience agenda examines:How climate change is increasing risks such as natural catastrophes and resource scarcity and the different implications for companies, financial institutions and governmentsThe role of solutions such as insurance, risk transfer and investment in resilience in meeting these new challenges, and how these approaches may need to evolveHow political, regulatory, technological and behavioral responses to climate change are redrawing the enterprise risk landscape and how companies should respondHow climate change interacts with other strategic themes for Marsh & McLennan, including the challenge of closing the protection gap, disruptive technologies and healthy societiesOur transformative technology agenda focuses primarily on:How emerging technologies focused on data management, advanced analytics, connectivity, and automation (among other capabilities) will influence businesses and broader societyHow companies can capture value from these technologies and plan for the implications for their workforce, business models, and customersHow the potential unforeseen consequences of and risks inherent in the use of these technologies can be anticipated and mitigatedThis role offers the opportunity for exposure across the above agendas, as well as a range of interlinked industries and client challenges which are addressed across the four businesses of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To that end, we look for intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and creativity with a strong background in research, critical thinking and analysis of different kinds.We do not require a specific academic major or industry experience and we value extracurricular activities and evidence of leading an interesting and impactful life beyond work. Knowledge of the insurance or consulting sector is a plus, as is experience working with leading technology vendors.The candidate should have a demonstrated ability to produce engaging, high-quality written output, in theses, articles, reports or other form. They should also be an effective communicator.Fluency in English (excellent written and spoken) is essential.

title: Executive / Senior Executive / Assistant Manager / Manager (Analytics), Strategy and Analytics Branch, Planning Division, SPSG
company: Ministry of Social and Family Development
description: The Strategy and Analytics Branch of the Planning Division in the Social Policy & Services Group (SPSG) formulates and coordinates the execution of the Group’s strategic priorities. The Branch works in close partnership with the divisions in SPSG, as well as other MSF divisions and government agencies.Responsibilities:Specific areas of work under the Branch’s purview include:a) service innovation and design, including refinement and further development of the Social Service Office (SSO) model and conceptualising pilots on new approaches for service delivery in SSOs;b) service integration – design and incorporation of new service lines in SPSG, close collaborations with other government and community partners to jointly design integrated and holistic help;c) research and data analytics to inform operations, operations policy, and service planning; and d) futures thinking on the future social service landscape, policy, and service delivery principles.We are looking for a data analyst with a keen interest in mining data to inform operations, operations policy and service planning decisions in SPSG to join the Analytics team. You will need to have a good understanding of the business needs within SPSG, be able to draw insights from data to inform decisions around service delivery, and support the design and evaluation of pilots. You will also help to systematically build up data and analytics capabilities in SPSG.RequirementsPossess a good knowledge of concepts and techniques in data analytics. Training and/or relevant experience in text analytics, predictive analytics, geospatial analytics and developing analytical dashboards is an advantage.Able to devise creative solutions and build consensus with multiple stakeholders, who may have differing views.Comfortable looking at issues through both a strategic and operational lens.Able to work independently and as part of a team.Possess good organisational, communication, presentation and writing skills.

title: Manager, Investments & Asset Management
description: As part of the Investment and Asset Management team you will be assisting in the formulating and executing of asset management strategies and plans for the Data Centre portfolio to optimise income and realise the highest value for our assets. presenting financial analysis to key internal stakeholders.Carry out commercial and financial due diligence for assets to be acquired, working with external advisers/ consultants.Work with in-house counsel and Lead to manage legal adviser(s), review and negotiate key legal terms within the legal documentation related to acquisitions with external legal counsels in the various jurisdictions.Working closely with tax advisors on the structuring of transactions including stamp duty analysis and use of offshore tax entities or other jurisdictions as may be necessary.Preparation and presentation of Investment memos / presentations for the acquisitions.Sector research to keep apprised of updated trends and market news/information including the review and analysis of financials, market information and analyst reports from sources including Tier One Research, Bloomberg, and Data Centre Dynamics etc.Work with portfolio companies on asset management including oversight of existing portfolio assets and integral involvement in new development assets or expansion plans.RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Finance/Banking or equivalentCFA / CPA qualificationExperience in Data Centres and/or real estate industryMinimum 2 years’ experience in investment banking, merger & acquisitions, deal execution and risk managementStrong technical skills in financial modelling, valuation, and due diligence (e.g. commercial, financial)Possess good knowledge of the Korean market, culture and able to successfully navigate complexities of business relations.Able to communicate fluently and effectively in Korean and English to successfully transact business deals and contracts.MS office skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)Ability to work effectively across various stakeholder groups.Strong analytical skills and attention to detailIndependent and able to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment

and services.Your Skills & Experience:Mastery in techniques and lean agile methodologies that maximize flow of value and are deeply rooted in Agile, Lean and continuous delivery principles, with an title: Assistant Manager, Business Analyst
description: Bring your career aspirations to life with AIA!1. To deliver all activities related to the facilitating and creation of accurate and clear User Requirements for all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents related to the Customer Experience Division2. To deliver all activities related to the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) management of all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents related to the Customer Experience DivisionUser RequirementsReview project/new product specification/enhancement/production incident request.Facilitate the necessary discussions with relevant stakeholders to clearly identify and articulate the business outcomes needed for the project/new product specification/enhancement/production incident request.To be constantly in-tune with business goals, objectives and strategies of the organization and to use that knowledge to help ensure the business outcomes are aligned with broader organizational picture.To maintain a deep awareness on how business process works, to enable effective impact analysis of the changes requested on existing business processes.Where possible, provide options or possible solutions from a technology and process perspective, to meet these business outcomes.Identify processes related dependencies, and highlight processes improvements where needed, to facilitate these changes.To actively participate in impact analysis from a system perspective, identifying dependencies in peripheral systems, modules etc.To clearly articulate and document the agreed business outcomes, and business solutions into a User Requirements Documents, and to facilitate and obtain sign off from relevant parties.Participate and provide input into design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate system designs and validate proposed solutionPrepare and finalize Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM) to sync up with Business Requirements, Functional Specifications Document and Test Plan with input/participation from Business Subject Matter Expert, IT Developer, System Analyst and Test Manager.UAT Management & Post Deployment SupportDevelop test strategy, plan, criteria, and expected results; aligning Test Plan with UR, FSD, and/or system impact (regression testing).Review and plan resources such as provide estimation on man-days required base on total test cases, test scopes, complexity of test cases, determine total testers required and work with Tester Resource Manager for resource allocation for UAT.Ensure all project parties are aligned on the project plan by reviewing the Test Plan with Business SME, Business Tester, System Support Tester, IT System Analyst, and facilitate sign off.Ensure necessary system access are granted to testers for UAT so that testers are able to carry out UAT assignments within project timeline.Ensure availability of test environment and thereby test scope can be completed within project time frame.Monitor the progress of test case execution, pass rates, while coordinating defect fixes with IT System Analyst.Follow up and manage UAT defects/ errors reported in identified Defect Management Tool in a timely manner.Approve the UAT upon the sign-off of UAT results by testers.Coordinate Post Deployment verification with Production usersDaily ResponsibilitiesEnsure accurate effort estimation for tasks / project work and timely updating of actual time spent for all work in eResource Scheduler.Weekly report to supervisor on works progress and issues. Ensure issues are tracked and resolved in a timely manner.Consolidate gaps identified during UAT for follow up in a master list.Perform other job functions and ad-hoc tasks assigned by supervisor in order to meet operational and/or other requirementsExternal interaction and management of stakeholders : Demand & Supply TeamTo ensure accurate inputs on resource availability to the D&S team; to enable meaningful discussions on task / project schedulingAPO / Product Team / Other stakeholdersEnsuring quality and timely delivery of the User Requirements for all system enhancements / projects / new products / production incidents, focusing on “On-Time, On-Budget, On-ScopeEnsure accurate assessments on required effort for tasks /projects, advising & securing on resource required on test execution, to enable projects to be delivered ‘on-time, on-budget, on-scope’Actively identify and highlight risks and issues related to the tasks, and to actively contribute in identification of solutions and mitigating steps.IT / Business StakeholderPrepare accurate and detailed Change Request, User Requirements and walkthrough with System Analyst & Business Subject Matter Expert and perform any revisions as necessaryFacilitates necessary discussions to identify viable solutions to the business problem, factoring in the outcomes of the impact analysisWork with System Analyst & IT Business Analyst to identify test scope, scenarios and total test casesEnsure clarity and deep understanding of the new product/enhancement background/features, UR, FSD & System Design, to enable a robust and comprehensive Test Plan to be createdBusiness StakeholdersPerform impact analysis and work with relevant stakeholder to make a decisionAgreed test scenarios / situations where Business Users (as Tester) will assist in test executionCommunicate effectively or provide training to keep relevant stakeholders and business users of latest system enhancement/changes or issuesBuild a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives.You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

title: Account & Finance Manager
description: Roles & Responsibilities· Provide financial reports and interpret financial information to managerial staff while recommending further courses of action.· Advise on investment activities and provide strategies that the company should take· Maintain the financial health of the organization.· Analyze costs, pricing, variable contributions, sales results and the company’s actual performance compared to the business plans.· Develop trends and projections for the firm’s finances.· Conduct reviews and evaluations for cost-reduction opportunities.· Oversee operations of the finance department, set goals and objectives, and design a framework for these to be met.· Manage the preparation of the company’s budget.· Liase with auditors to ensure appropriate monitoring of company finances is maintained.· Correspond with various other departments, discussing company plans and agreeing on future paths to be taken.· Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company, such as payroll, invoicing, and other transactions· Oversee financial department employees, including financial assistants and accountants· Contract outside services for tax preparation, auditing, banking, investments, and other financial needs as necessary· Track the company's financial status and performance to identify areas for potential improvement· Seek out methods for minimising financial risk to the company· Research and analyse financial reports and market trends· Provide insightful information and expectations to senior executives to aid in long-term and short-term decision making· Review financial data and prepare monthly and annual reports· Present financial reports to board members, stakeholders, executives, and clients in formal meetings· Stay up to date with technological advances and accounting software to be used for financial purposes· Establish and maintain financial policies and procedures for the company· Understand and adhere to financial regulations and legislation.· Monitor the day-to-day financial operations within the company (payroll, invoicing, and other transactions)· Prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting· Participate in strategic data analysis, research, and modeling for senior company leadership· Support project analysis, validation of plans, and ad-hoc requests· Manage the company's financial accounting, monitoring, and reporting systems· Ensure compliance with accounting policies and regulatory requirementsRequirements· Experience in the financial sector with previous possible roles such as financial analyst· Extensive understanding of financial trends both within the company and general market patterns· Proficient user of finance software· Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills· Able to manage, guide and lead employees to ensure appropriate financial processes are being used· A solid understanding of financial statistics and accounting principles· Working knowledge of all statutory legislation and regulations· BS/MA degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics· Professional qualification such as CFA/CPA or similar will be considered a plus· Responsible for the financial health of a company or organisation.· Producing financial reports and developing strategies based on financial research.· Guiding senior executives in making sound business decisions title: Product Manager
description: Are you a talented and driven problem solver who is eager to join our HQ in Kuala Lumpur? Someone with a startup mentality, who is capable of integrating into a multicultural team?Projects you will be working on?We are looking for a Product Manager to be the user-centric, coordinating and creative head for the development of SOCAR's flagship car-sharing mobile application, delivering a seamless experience for SOCAR's user base.SOCAR changes the way people in South East Asia move around by being the biggest car-sharing platform in South East Asia. We are currently the biggest player in Malaysia and aim to scale out our product offering across more verticals and geographies.We are growing fast - this is an extremely exciting moment for SOCAR.What will you be engaged in?As our Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to transform the way hundreds of thousands of user experience the SOCAR car-sharing platform, have a major impact on company growth, partner with product leaders across the company, and build a cross-functional team of engineers, product designers, analysts and data scientists.Product concept, design and prototyping all the way to developmentProject management and establish ownership of the deliverablesCollaborate with the CEO and Engineer Team Lead to create product plans, roadmaps, requirements and prototypes based on the product strategyProduct roadmap prioritisationDocumenting needs and priorities from various stakeholders and translating that into clear product requirementsDesign, track and measure MVPsPrepare and review product requirements documents (PRD)Organize the continuous stream of product releasesEnsure the compliance with the release scheduleIdentify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growthDeliver high availability and reliability of solutions/featuresCollaborate with engineers to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resourcesAre you the ideal candidate?First and foremost ask yourself: Are you customer-obsessed? This is SOCAR's prime value that drives our mission forward. If your heart and mind shout “YES, I am!”, you have just identified a fundamental match between you and your future SOCAR team.Experience of working on Product Manager or other relevant positionSignificant experience in product lifecycle managementYou believe in customer obsession and building products that deliver the optimal experience to all key stakeholdersBackground in software development and program management is preferredUX/UI experience is a bonusStrong organizational, leadership and communication skillsStrong problem-solving, perceptive and creative leaderStrong documentation skills.User-centric mindsetDetail orientednessWhat we will offer you?Be part of the fastest-growing car-sharing company in the world!Opportunity to drive new ideas and make a measurable impact on company metricsWork with incredibly driven people with great executable ideasCompetitive SalaryMedical InsuranceSOCAR travelling creditsPhone allowanceInternational environment (we are 10 different nationalities in the office!)The chance to launch new markets in different countriesEndless company events (Futsal, cinema, birthday cakes, celebrations, team lunch and dinner ... )How will your roadmap to join SOCAR look like?After you submit your application, you can expect to prepare for the following steps in the hiring process:1 session - Talent Acquisition Team (Virtual or face-to-face)1 sample task (To be reviewed and presented in the technical round)1 session - Technical round (Virtual or face-to-face)1 session - CEO & CTO (Virtual or face-to-face)-Check out our Homepage(https://socar.my/)Find us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/socarmalaysia)(https://www.facebook.com/socarmy)Follow us on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/socarmy)

title: Manager - Enterprise Risk Management

You will be working with the Enterprise Risk Management Director and leading a small team supporting the execution of activities related to the development and enhancement of existing and net-new risk programs (e.g., Strategic Risk). title: Product Manager
description: Bhinneka merupakan perusahaan e-commerce O2O (Online to Offline) pertama dan terbesar di Indonesia. Didirikan 1993, kami memiliki lebih dari 1 juta pengguna aktif serta 70.000 produk unik yang terdaftar di situs kami. Dengan perkembangan rata-rata tahunan sebesar 61% dan kurang lebih 700 Bhinnekanerz, kami terus mencari talenta-talenta untuk bergabung dan berkembang bersama-sama.Deskripsi Pekerjaan :Tim produk kami mendukung proses bisnis kami, menetapkan visi untuk produk internal yang berkembang. Kami menggunakan data, penelitian, desain, strategi, dan empati guna menuju tujuan Bersama, menyeimbangkan beragam perspektif dan memberdayakan tim kami untuk melakukan pekerjaan secara lebih efektif. Seiring skala bisnis kita yang berkembang, ada banyak ruang bagi Anda untuk tumbuh bersama kami dan menyederhanakan kehidupan bagi ribuan pelanggan di seluruh Indonesia dalam tim yang selalu berfokus pada kami dan menciptakan produk menyenangkan yang patut dipercaya.Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab Pekerjaan :Bertanggung jawab atas produk teknologi secara keseluruhanMenentukan lingkup dan fitur produk teknologi (sistem sekarang dan sistem di masa yang akan datang) dengan mengevaluasi spesifikasi dan fitur teknologi yang sedang digunakan, mempelajari kebutuhan pengguna (business user maupun customer), melalukan/merancang survei pengguna dan pasar, dan membandingkan dengan kompetitor di Indonesia dan duniaMengkomunikasikan rancangan roadmap teknologi dan mendapatakan persetujuan dari management dan userMenulis user requirement untuk fitur/teknologiMerancang rencana transisi teknologiMengimplementasikan produk teknologi/fitur baruMemimpin development teknologi dengan memimpin pack yang terdiri dari developer, designer, QA, etcSPESIFIKASI PEKERJAAN :Persyaratan UmumTingkat pendidikan min. S1 Sederajat, diutamakan lulusan Business Management, Information Systems, atau Computer ScienceTingkat pengalaman minimal 2 tahun sebagai product manager di salah satu dari perusahaan teknologi/startup ternama, atau pengalaman minimal 1 tahun sebagai consultant/analyst di salah satu dari top 10 perusahaan strategy consulting dimana ia telah mengimplementasikan framework yang mencakup aktivitas teknis dan bisnisPersyaratan KhususMemiliki kombinasi sbb: pemikiran very inquisitive / critical mindset with an ambitious / visionary business approachMemiliki kemampuan komunikasi terbaik dan “can-do” attitudeMemiliki ketertarikan mendalam dan jangka panjang dengan teknologi dan industri e-commerceMemiliki pengalaman untuk menyajikan berbagai laporan bisnis dan presentasiDapa memimpin proyek yang mencakup berbagai divisi bisnisMemiliki kemampuan problem-solving yang kuat

title: SBU APJ Sales Operations Manager Singapore,
description: Based on our continued success and growth, we are looking for a Senior Manager of Sales Operations to act as a critical business partner to the Security Business Unit APJ Sales organization, driving revenue growth, increase sales productivity and accelerating sales cycles.Why VMware Carbon Black?At VMware Carbon Black, you will have the chance to make an impact in the ever-evolving cybersecurity space. Our advanced technology tackles even the toughest challenges and stays ahead of the latest threats.If you want to join an agile company that’s building bleeding edge technology in the cloud, VMware Carbon Black is the place for you. Driven by passionate people who are dedicated to making the world safer, it’s no wonder we’ve been named a “Top Place to Work” by the Boston Globe for four consecutive years. Join us!Why You MatterReporting to Director SBU Sales Operations, this role will be the critical Sales Operations business partner for the SBU APJ Sales team, executing strategies to accelerate revenue growth, leading best practice sales execution initiatives and managing efficient operations to improve sales productivity and accelerate sales cycles.What You’ll DoSales Strategy & Planning – leading Sales strategy and planning, partnering with Sales, Marketing and Operations leadership to develop and implement a Sales growth plan, with optimal coverage, quota and incentive mechanisms.Business partner – act as a Sales business partner, leveraging data and leading strategic and operational initiatives to accelerate revenue/bookings, increasing Sales productivity and shorten the lead-to-close cycle. Represent the APJ Sales teams in critical programs to ensure that materials, collateral, methods, tools, processes, reporting are all suitable for a rapid and effective best practice sales execution modelManage the Sales operating rhythm – in partnership with Sales leadership, establish, orchestrate and manage the Sales management operating rhythm to drive consistent best in class planning, inspection and execution against pipeline, leads, forecast, opportunities and accounts.Sales Performance – review sales performance on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis to support sales management. take appropriate action and provide input to sales enablement and management programs to improve sales performance.What You’ll Bring5+ years Sales Operations leadership and experience in fast paced software / SaaS environmentsDemonstrated success being a Sales Operations business partner to a sales team of 30+ sellersExpert in forecasting, sales methodologies, SFDC and sales execution disciplines to drive efficient execution at scaleExcellent team and interpersonal collaboration and operational leadership skillsA Bachelor’s degree in Business or Technology related area is requiredA change leader and ambassador for sales to drive revenue growth, increase productively and accelerate sales cycles with a partnering, solution orientated, ‘easy to do business with’ approachCategory : Business Strategy and OperationsSubcategory: Business Operations AnalystExperience: Manager and ProfessionalFull Time/ Part Time: Full TimeRemote: YesPosted Date: 2020-09-28VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

title: IT Service Governance & Reporting Manager
description: IT Service Governance and Reporting ManagerKuala Lumpur, Malaysia,Competitive Salary and Benefits PackagePermanentJob Family: IT.Johnson Matthey have an exciting opportunity for an IT Service Governance and Reporting Manager to join our team in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia on a permanent basis.Role Summary:The IT Service Governance & Reporting Manager is accountable for the governance and ongoing development of IT Service Management policies and procedures across JMIT. Polices will include areas such as Incident & Problem Processes, IT Controls, Disaster Recovery and Patching.The role will ensure these policies and controls are effectively achieved and deliver service reporting and performance data that aligns to these goals, manages our key risks and encourages continuous improvement across the teams.Key responsibilities:The IT Service Governance & Reporting Manager is responsible for the following activities and others which may arise through the development of the role:Own and continuously improve the key IT Service Management policies and procedures in areas such as Incident & Problem Management, IT Controls, Disaster Recovery and compliance.Independently work with senior technology owners and teams across JMIT to ensure there is awareness, compliance and support for these policies.Be able to challenge, encourage and drive changes in outcome across different teams and stakeholders.Develop, run and continuously improve service and control reporting and performance data so that it provides technology leaders in Infrastructure & Operations with clear insights into our performance and areas to improveEnsuring IT Key Controls and IT Continuity/Disaster Recovery plans are monitored, tracked and where there are issues tracked and focus is maintained to closure.Manage the IT Controls Analyst whose primary focus this activity is.Ensuring Patching plans are monitored, tracked and managed in line with our Patching policy.Manage the Patch Lead role whose primary focus this activity is.Work closely with the wider IT Service Management leadership team to ensure that cohesion throughout the wider function and IT Service Management continues to add value to the whole of JMIT.Work closely with the JMIT Quality Manager to track and manage Infrastructure & Operations risks including any relevant audit actionsRequired Skills:Experience in coordinating the work of multiple teams and planning, prioritising and coordinating their own tasks.Experience of communicating clearly with a range of people at different levels of the organisation and communicate technical issues using a range of styles, tools and techniques.Experience with working with a range of technologies and teams.Able to engage in detail whilst maintaining the overall plan.ITIL Practitioner v3+ or higherStrong people, communication and relationship building skillsStakeholder management and influencing skills to effectively build relationships across JMITTakes a customer focused approachStrong people management skillsA little about us:Johnson Matthey is the global leader in sustainable technologies, applying our cutting-edge science to create solutions with our customers that make a real difference to the world around us. Our science and research help to reduce pollution, relieve pain, restore hearing and boost crops. Behind all of this, we’re an international business made up of many extraordinary parts. We have been in business for over 200 years. From a single office in London in 1817, we've built a global presence with significant operations in more than 30 countries. We support our customers' needs from 43 major manufacturing sites all around the globe, providing consistency and quality wherever they are.How to apply: A full job description is available on request from UKRecruit@matthey.com If you have the necessary skills and experience to join our team, please apply onlineJohnson Matthey Plc is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.#LI-JM1

title: Customer Care Manager
description: Are you a good communicator with strong relational skills? Do you enjoy coaching and mentoring colleagues, achieving team objectives, and striving to deliver world-class customer support?We’re looking for a Customer Care Manager within the Energy & Natural Resources division to:manage the performance of a growing functional and/or regional team of 7-8 colleaguesbe accountable for the performance and results of the teamrecommend and implements operational changes that increase efficiencies and/or information quality solutionsprovide guidance and ensures clarity around priorities and goals for the teamguide talent identification and development processes for the teamwork with other departments including product management, sales, and other customer care teams for collaborationYour teamYou will be leading the newly formed ENR Customer Care Penang team in Penang, Malaysia. The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success. Our global insights impact nearly every major sector - from aerospace to automotive. We empower our customers by isolating cause and effect, risk and opportunity in new ways so they can make well-informed decisions with greater confidence. This is a force we call The New Intelligence.Join usBoundaries belong on maps, not in your work. Start every day at IHS Markit with the excitement of what’s next, by working with people from across the globe on interesting, cutting-edge projects and gaining once-in-a-lifetime learning experiences. It is easy to be passionate and invested in your work here, knowing you are causing an effect for some of the world’s most influential companies. You’ll get to be hands-on with, and see the direct impact, of your work. Career satisfaction just comes with the territory here-Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. title: Senior Manager - Commercial Strategy and Intelligence (Business Analyst)
description: This role will be responsible for developing a strong understanding of U Mobile’s performance across all the products and services, to develop and implement a process for monitoring and reporting it. It requires working across teams, getting to know all that is going on in the organization and challenging teams on how they assess and improve their performance. This role is also instrumental in developing forecasts of the business, using statistical and analytical techniques to understand the key drivers towards company’s annual target.The role’s challenges lie primarily in the breadth of its accountabilities, requiring significant commercial agility, a nose for inconsistencies, the ability to go beyond the analysis of data to arrive at true business insight, and the presence to support senior leaders in robust commercial decision-making.Job Responsibilities:1. Performance Reporting and AnalysisLead the analysis of business performance and develop relevant reporting structureOptimize our KPI dashboardSynthesize performance trends and business performanceIdentify and highlight opportunities for performance improvementCommunicate the business performance to the management and other stakeholders2. Analytical support Drive strategic analysis and provide recommendations for ad hoc requests, both from within the team and externally3. Forecasting and PlanningDevelop business forecast based on business insights to identify business gaps on monthly basisDevelop Annual performance target based on Marketing strategiesWork with product teams to ensure that the right KPIs and targets have been setKey Experiences and QualificationsMinimum 8 years of working experience in a similar rolehave a solid track record of reliably monitoring performance metricsSuperior business judgment based on skills and experienceAwareness of data visualisation principlesStrong analytical skillsResults-driven, high-performing, high-quality work attitudeHave a high threshold for ambiguity and maintain professional demeanor under pressureCompany OverviewU Mobile is Malaysia’s most dynamic and innovative mobile telecommunication service provider that offers millions of next generation mobile consumers the freedom to “Live Connected”. Since 2007, the company has been constantly providing high quality mobile voice and data services with its wide distribution network backed by affordable pricing strategies. It has one of the most unique telecommunications network structures in the region backed by its own-built network infrastructure, which supports high-speed mobile broadband; and Asia’s first active 3G Radio Access Network (RAN) sharing, covering major urban areas in the East and West Malaysia.Customers of U Mobile can choose from a variety of competitive prepaid, postpaid, high-speed mobile Internet plans and latest mobile devices to achieve a fully connected lifestyle anywhere and anytime . The products and services distinguish themselves through attractive value propositions and value-added services, giving consumers high quality mobile services at best value rates. U Mobile also made its products and services to be highly accessible through traditional and non-traditional distribution channels to broaden audience reach. These strategic business approaches are the core reasons why U Mobile was awarded the coveted Frost & Sullivan’s “Most Promising Service Provider of the Year” at the 2012 Frost & Sullivan Malaysia Excellence Awards.U Mobile’s major shareholders include U Telemedia Sdn Bhd (an investment by Tan Sri Vincent Tan, Founder of Berjaya Group) and Straits Mobile Investments Pte Ltd (a subsidiary of Singapore Technologies Telemedia Pte Ltd - ST Telemedia). U Telemedia’s stake in U Mobile provides an unparalleled support advantage, as U Mobile is able to reach out to a wider audience through the Berjaya Group of Companies for its nationwide distribution channels, local business network and joint marketing collaborations. This partnership is also supported by ST Telemedia’s telecommunications expertise, which gives U Mobile an edge by increasing competitiveness in the marketplace.U Mobile will continue to leverage on strategic partnerships and innovation to translate technological advancements into more affordable and flexible products and services for its millions of customers. The aim is to provide customers an enhanced and seamless mobile experience with U Mobile.Live Connected with U Mobile!For more information, please visit http://www.u.com.my or participate in U Mobile’s various social activities by visiting http://www.fb.com/umobile.Why Join Us?We’re a company that’s all about fun and we welcome new members to join and grow further with us. Today, U Mobile boasts a vibrant workforce and culture that centre on its 5 corporate values of excellence through Passion, Trustworthy, Innovation, Teamwork and Fun . These values are pillars to the company’s overarching mission:- ‘To be the admired Mobile + Digital brand that people entrust to transform their lives"Where all employees are encouraged and challenged to be creative and innovative, always think out of the box and strive to surprise customers with the best products, services and the entire mobile experience with U Mobile.So if you’re passionate and ready to explore a rewarding career with us, send in your application now!

title: Hotel Revenue Manager / Anaylst
description: Be Motivated: Determined and committed with a strong drive to meet goals.Be A Leader and Influencer: A leader at the peer level. Possessing a keen ability to influence and manage upTeam Player: Works effectively as a member of the management teamCommunicates well with peers Articulates revenue management strategies, ways to execute those strategies, and expected resultsTechnically Savvy: Detailed understanding of how applications support and augment the revenue management functionObservational: Good listener with strong observational skillsCan anticipate business needsAble to read situations, identify change events, understand environments and respond accordinglyInfluencer: Can convince management teams to act based on dataNegotiator: Able to develop and maintain business relationships with third-party distribution partnersOrganized: Capable of prioritizing between revenue-generating actions and time-consuming tasks with low-yield impact. Sound ability and knowledge to develop operations standards and strategic processesDeep and broad analytical skills are a must for an effective revenue analyst. But you will also need an equal understanding of all areas of a hotel and resort operation, especially all the property’s revenue generating functions: · Produce property-level business reporting of all relevant performance KPIs on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis.· Provide periodic dynamic forecast of expected results, variances and budget comparisons· Analyse overall monthly hotel performance and provide summary report with recommendations to improve long-term strategies.· Set best practice standards for: competitor analysis, environmental scanning, market modelling, distribution yield management, business mix yield management, length of stay yield management, inventory availability by channel, pricing control and new pricing concepts· Monitor overbooking levels and opportunities daily· Continually monitor booking pace; respond to unexpected variances· Perform competitive benchmark studies and follow market trends· Create and maintain a 12-month rolling demand calendar· Manage and oversee tactics and strategies for all third-party distribution channels· Manage and oversee tactics and strategies for branded distribution channels· Assess, analyse and price group business strategies, including function space and group room contribution to food and beverage· Regularly check the input and the quality of data points such as segmentation, denials tracking, etc.· Conduct quarterly property performance review and develop strategic and tactical action· Evaluate performance of distribution partners and contracted rates (OTA, transient, leisure, tour operator, corporate, consortia, crew, groups, etc.)· Monitor the cost of distribution by channel and adjust channel mix where necessary· Promote and measure upsell revenue· Where appropriate, monitor and factor non-room revenues into the overall revenue management strategies and practices. This includes meeting and banquet space, restaurant, bar, spa, golf, etc.Knowledgeable of hotel technology including:· RMS, CRM, PMS, CRS, distribution channels (OTA, metasearch, GDS, channel managers, etc.)· Familiar with integration models and business models for the aboveJob Type: Full-timeSalary: RM4,000.00 - RM5,000.00 per monthExperience:Revenue Accounting: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Inventory Control Manager
description: At Jabil, we empower the brands who empower the world – it's our reason for being and the guiding force that's driving us to become the most technologically advanced manufacturing solutions provider on the planet. Whether we're serving one of the world's biggest and best known brands or the coolest tech startups, our resolve never wavers. We share common desires with these brands: to make the world a better, safer and cleaner place.JOB SUMMARYManage, control and direct all inventory control, which includes receiving, stockroom, shipping, and Inventory Analysts. Provide exceptional support to customers, team members, and shareholders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESLEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESRecruitment and Retention:Recruit, interview and hire Inventory Control, Stockroom, Prep and Shipping Supervisors.Communicate criteria to recruiters for Inventory Control, Stockroom, Prep and Shipping Supervisors position candidates.Coach Inventory Control staff in the interviewing/hiring process.Monitor team member turnover; identify key factors that can be improved; make improvements.Employee and Team Development:Identify individual and team strengths and development needs on an ongoing basis.Create and/or validate training curriculum in area of responsibility.Coach and mentor Inventory Control staff to deliver excellence to every internal and external customer.Create and manage succession plans for Inventory Control function.Performance Management:Establish clear measurable goals and objectives by which to determine individual and team results (i.e. operational metrics, results against project timelines, training documentation, attendance records, knowledge of operational roles and responsibilities, personal development goals).Solicit ongoing feedback from Workcell Manager (WCM), Business Unit Manager (BUM), peers and team member on team member's contribution to the Workcell team. Provide ongoing coaching and counseling to team member based on feedback.Express pride in staff and encourage them to feel good about their accomplishments.Perform team member evaluations professionally and on time.Drive individuals and the team to continuously improve in key operational metrics and the achievement of the organizational goals.Coordinate activities of large teams and keep them focused in times of crises.Ensure recognition and rewards are managed fairly and consistently in area of responsibility.Communication:Provide weekly communication forum for the exchange of ideas and information with the department.Organize verbal and written ideas clearly and use an appropriate business style.Ask questions; encourage input from staff.Assess communication style of individual team members and adapt own communication style accordingly.FUNCTIONAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESBusiness Strategy and Direction:Know and understand the campus strategic directions.Define, develop and implement an Inventory Control strategy, which contributes to the campus strategic directions.Develop an understanding of the Workcell business strategy as it pertains to Inventory Control.Provide regular updates to BUM, WCM, and Operations Manager on the execution of the strategy.Cost Management:Identify creative ways to reduce cost by streamlining processes and systems (i.e. modification of responsibilities or consolidation of tasks, elimination of non-value-added processes, or complete re-engineering of processes and systems).Utilize tools to monitor departmental cost and cost trends, striving continuously to improve value.Provide feedback to peers (BUMs, WCMs, Functional Managers (FMs) on cost and cost trends.Forecast Development and Accuracy:Prepare timely forecasts for the department.Compare forward forecast results to historical actual results for trend assessment and analysis.TECHNICAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESDrive continuous improvement through trend reporting analysis and metrics management.Assess the adequacy of data gathering methods utilized by the workcells.Assure that procedures and work instructions are efficient and not redundant.Offer new ideas and suggestions for improvement. Identify and implement new practices and processes that are "best in field."Demonstrate a commitment to customer service; anticipate, meet, and exceed expectations by solving problems quickly and effectively; making customer issues a priority.Lead by example; "walk the talk."Facilitate any physical inventories as necessary.Establish new measurement systems if/where possible.Exchange knowledge and information with other Jabil facilities to ensure best practices are shared throughout the Jabil organization.Ensure 100% adherence to all company policies and procedures (i.e. Health and Safety, Quality).Ensure all sensitive and confidential information is handled appropriately.Ability to read, analyze, interpret and communicate regarding common scientific and/or technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents.Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directorsAbility to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor.Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy.May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.JOB QUALIFICATIONSKNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTSAbility to title: Quality manager
description: At Jabil, we empower the brands who empower the world – it's our reason for being and the guiding force that's driving us to become the most technologically advanced manufacturing solutions provider on the planet. Whether we're serving one of the world's biggest and best known brands or the coolest tech startups, our resolve never wavers. We share common desires with these brands: to make the world a better, safer and cleaner place.SUMMARYDrive continuous improvement through the development and implementation of Quality processes, systems, tools and techniques. Provide exceptional support to customers, team members, and shareholders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESRecruitment and RetentionRecruit, interview and hire Quality Engineers, OBA (out of box audit) personnel and Quality Analyst resources.Communicate criteria to recruiters for Quality Engineers, OBA (out of box audit) personnel and Quality Analyst candidates.Coach Quality Engineering staff in the interviewing/hiring process.Monitor team member turnover; identify key factors that can be improved; make improvements.Employee and Team DevelopmentIdentify individual and team strengths and development needs on an ongoing basis.Create and/or validate training curriculum in area of responsibility.Coach and mentor Quality Engineering staff to deliver excellence to every internal and external customer.Create and manage succession plans for Quality function.Performance ManagementEstablish clear measurable goals and objectives by which to determine individual and team results (i.e. operational metrics, results against project timelines, training documentation, attendance records, knowledge of operational roles and responsibilities, personal development goals).Solicit ongoing feedback from Workcell Manager (WCM), Business Unit Manager (BUM), peers and team member on team member's contribution to the Workcell team. Provide ongoing coaching and counseling to team member based on feedback.Express pride in staff and encourage them to feel good about their accomplishments.Perform team member evaluations professionally and on time.Drive individuals and the team to continuously improve in key operational metrics and the achievement of the organizational goals.Coordinate activities of large teams and keep them focused in times of crises.Ensure recognition and rewards are managed fairly and consistently in area of responsibility.CommunicationProvide weekly communication forum for the exchange of ideas and information with the department.Organize verbal and written ideas clearly and use an appropriate business style.Ask questions; encourage input from staff.Assess communication style of individual team members and adapt own communication style accordingly.FUNCTIONAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESBusiness Strategy and DirectionKnow and understand the campus strategic directions.Define, develop and implement a Quality strategy which contributes to the campus strategic directions.Develop an understanding of the workcell business strategy as it pertains to Quality.Provide regular updates to BUM, WCM, and Operations Manager on the execution of the strategy.Cost ManagementIdentify creative ways to reduce cost by streamlining processes and systems (i.e. modification of responsibilities or consolidation of tasks, elimination of non-value-added processes, or complete re-engineering of processes and systems).Utilize tools to monitor departmental cost and cost trends, striving continuously to improve value.Provide feedback to peers (BUMs, WCMs, Functional Managers (FMs) on cost and cost trends.Forecast Development and AccuracyPrepare timely forecasts for the department.Compare forward forecast results to historical actual results for trend assessment and analysis.TECHNICAL MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIESDrive continuous improvement through trend reporting analysis and metrics management.Assess the adequacy of data gathering methods utilized by the workcells.Assure that procedures and work instructions are efficient and not redundant.Offer new ideas and suggestions for improvement. Identify and implement new practices and processes that are "best in field."Demonstrate a commitment to customer service; anticipate, meet, and exceed expectations by solving problems quickly and effectively; making customer issues a priority.Understand and drive regulatory and compliance certifications as appropriate (i.e. regulatory requirements surrounding ISO9000, ISO14000, QS9000, BABT, TUV). Act as the company's quality management representative (QMR).Establish new measurement systems if/where possible.Exchange knowledge and information with other Jabil facilities to ensure best practices are shared throughout the Jabil organization.Ensure 100% adherence to all company policies and procedures (i.e. Health and Safety, Quality).Ensure all sensitive and confidential information is handled appropriately.Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor.Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree and seven years experience, including two years in a supervisory role required.Jabil, including its subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Search & Recommendations Quality Analyst Manager, Human Evaluation
description: SummaryPosted: Oct 9, 2020Role Number:200198424Are you passionate about analyzing data patterns for large scale search engines? As part of our Evaluation team, you will be a market expert and analyze of a diverse portfolio of Apple Media Product evaluations tasks. The team represents the user’s perspective as they vet new features being introduced to AMP. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include rating, analyzing, and creating innovative ideas to help improve our search features, and reporting systematic issues to statisticians and engineers.Key QualificationsA demonstrated passion for data analysis, data-informed product innovation, building and crafting data culture5+ years in a managerial role, recruiting top talent, growing, and scaling analytics organizationsDeep understanding of the software development for machine-learned products and services, and how analytics and human evaluation data can help improve those productsAbility to build relationships across multiple functions and establish strong partnerships. Outstanding communication and presentation skills, written and verbal, to all levels of an organizationExperience in executive reporting, and developing analytic recommendations to enable product strategy and growthStrong technical approach - ability to work with engineering teams and develop sustainable solutions for meticulous analyticsExperience working with systems and products that are powered by machine-learned models and an understanding of natural language or speech-enabled productsSelf-sufficient in analyzing and drawing conclusions about the quality and product opportunity from raw and refined product dataSelf-motivated and proactive, with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilitiesStrong analytical product intuition - able to use data impact-fully in guiding development of products and user experiencesKnow how to weave definition of user experience instrumentation, the definition of success metrics, implementation and validation, into the processInnate capability to, directly and indirectly, lead large teams for successDescription- Champion an industry-leading privacy-focused strategy for product measurement, human evaluation, and analytics- Evaluate and improve the quality of critical metrics for key products by analyzing customer problems. Empower others to understand and utilise data for decision making- Keep teams focused on the right priorities to meet tight deadlines; clearly, communicate project progress to leads and executive team- Direct supervision of staff: Performance management, career development, education, and training. Scale the team by recruiting top industry talent- Lead the development of a guideline driven human rating program that operates on a daily measurement cycle. Define what our evaluation tools should do and guide their development- Be involved in new evaluation creation with a view to crisply defining what the success criteria are- Drive high-impact exploratory analyses and investigations to enrich our understanding of how people interact with and use Apple Media Products around the world- Establish team capabilities (through hiring, training, tools, and process) that enable reproducible, transparent, and trusted work that influences decisions- Develop a strong consultancy approach that understands how to support and inform decisions over a large, complex feature development organizationEducation & ExperienceBS in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience.

We invest in tech startups and provide the necessary support and infrastructure for them to be successful. Our portfolio companies include QASymphony, Kobiton, Katalon, Sprynkl, and Grove. If you are passionate, talented and ambitious, work with us or join one of our portfolio companies to conquer the world togetherAbout GroveGrove is an HR Tech company that helps small and medium businesses in APAC digitize their Core HR so that they create attractive Digital Employee Experiences.At Grove, we believe that being an employee-centric company is the key to sustainable success. title: Investment Strategy Manager / Analyst
description: At Prudential, we understand that success comes from the talent and commitment of our people. Together, we have a shared vision in securing the future of our customers and our communities. We strive to build a business that you can shape, an inclusive workplace where everyone’s ideas are valued and a culture where we can thrive together. Our people stay connected and tuned in to what’s happening around us, keeping us ahead of the curve. While focused on the long-term, we look to the future to bring growth, development and benefit to everyone whose lives we touch.This role is part of the Investment team which is responsible for helping PACS achieve its objective of delivering sustainable performances to our policyholders and shareholders.As the Investment Strategy Manager / Analyst, he will be supporting the Head of Investment Strategy to implement SAA/ALM solutions, formulate economic regimes, market strategies and derivatives overlay to enhance risk-returns for Prudential Singapore’s investments. Ensure that the fiduciary duties of PACS as an asset owner have been fulfilled and properly discharged through fund managersEnhance SAA/ALM Framework and support the investment process across the insurance assets of PACS.Support development of sound and sustainable macroeconomic methodology to formulate long-term economic regimes and market strategies across the asset classesPropose SAA/ALM solutions including portfolio hedging in consideration of capital, returns and risks for liability-driven solutions. Monitor these portfolio solutions regularly or when economic regimes change, including financial impact and rebalancing when necessaryAssist evaluation of existing and prospective investment strategies and mandates. Monitor asset mispricing, new market trends for cross asset value arbitrage and asymmetric risk-reward trades through structured solutionsWork with Actuarial, Product and other teams in enhancing asset-liability management, derivative hedging and asset sourcingAssist in articulating the investment views and strategies to the various distribution channels through communications, presentations and investment notes.Support other investment functions in areas of product development, customer and corporate communications, financial reporting etc.Who are we looking for:At least 5 years of experience in investment management, capital markets and/or insurance consulting. Actuarial experience will be an advantage.Knowledge market technicalities with relevant accreditation and prior experience in insurance investment concepts such as Dollar Duration, Cash Flow Matching, Risk Budgeting, Capital Optimization etcKnowledge of macro research principles with expertise in portfolio related concepts such as asset allocation and modern portfolio theoryStrong data analytics, modelling and programming skills, and with experience working with at least two or more portfolio tools such as Aladdin, Factset, Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters, Morningstar etcProven ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and deliver resultsQualificationsBachelor degree or post-graduate degree in relevant field of Finance or Accounting Chartered Financial Analyst

title: Manager, Accounts Payable
description: Manager, Accounts PayableLOCATION: Kuala LumpurREPORTS TO: Sr. Accounts Receivable ManagerCompany Background:Ingredion is a Fortune 500 provider of ingredients and ingredient solutions for food, home and beauty care, pharma and industrial applications. Our products help nourish, comfort, sustain, and improve the lives of people around the world. The wide range of value-added solutions we offer are strategically designed to address changing consumer trends and preferences. Our specialty ingredient portfolio includes starch-based texturizers, clean and simple ingredients, plant-based proteins, specialty sweeteners, food systems and specialty ingredients for pharmaceutical and industrial applications,Ingredion has been named to Fortune’s World’s Most Admired List of Companies for the last eleven years and Ethisphere Institute has named us as one of the world’s most ethical companies for the last seven years. We service more than 18,000 customers around the world and operate in more than 26 countries. Our strong commitment to sustainability aligns with the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals and we are working towards sustainably sourcing 100% of our primary crops. Ingredion maintains a strong balance sheet and delivers EBITDA margins of >15%, annually generating nearly $700MM in cash from operations.We bring the potential of people, nature and technology together to make life better.That’s our purpose. We are all IN to make life better!Every day, Ingredion employees bring their skills, creativity, and passion together to deliver ingredient solutions that enhance people’s lives. We are innovators who combine the power of technology with the best of nature to delight our customers and consumers. We hold ourselves to the highest standards in ethics, safety, quality and sustainability. Unlocking the potential of people, nature and technology to make life better is what drives us in every aspect of our business.If you are interested in making life better, we are all IN to learn more about you! A bit about what you can expect from the employee experience at Ingredion:An environment that enables innovation and collaborationWe are creating the conditions that inspire and enable innovation - in our products and services, as well as in how we do our work day-to-day.Our ValuesOur highly talented people have a passion for learning and achievement and are driven by our inspiring purpose to make life better and our core values:We actively work to safeguard and enable the wellbeing of our people, the quality of our products and our reputation for trust and integrity.We earn the right to be customer-preferred by delivering mutual enduring value at every touchpoint of the customer experience.We embrace diversity and proactively foster an inclusive work environment where each person is valued and feels inspired to contribute their best.We courageously strive for breakthrough innovations driven by our relentless curiosity, bold thinking, speed of decision-making and agile execution.We think and act like owners - where everyone takes personal responsibility to anticipate challenges, proactively search for opportunities and make decisions that are in the best interest of the company.A warm, welcoming environmentAt Ingredion, everyone belongs! We embrace diversity and foster an inclusive work environment where individuals feel supported and enabled to contribute their very best every day.A place where you can grow personally and professionallyWe believe everyone has great potential, and we strive to nurture that potential into great personal and professional achievements.The chance to make a differenceNo matter where you work in the company, you’ll have an opportunity to make life better… for our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world.Ingredion is hiring an Accounts Payable Manager . The role will be responsible for directing and overseeing the daily management of the accounts payable staff and service delivery of all Ingredion EMEA & APAC invoices from receipt of invoice through payment and vendor inquiry support.SUPERVISION: Provides oversight and guidance to Accounts Payable staff of Lead AP Analysts, associates and contractorsREPORTS TO: Sr Accounts Receivable ManagerAs an Accounts Payable Manager, your responsibilities will include:Ensures the accuracy of the entire A/P process as it relates to vendor payment, processing of purchase orders, receiving invoices, payment of invoices and communication with vendors and internal customers.Ensures company policies and procedures are being adhered to as they pertain to accounts payable.Communicates all activities to the SSC Director and escalate important issues when appropriate.Manages and completes all projects as assigned.Identifies areas of continuous improvement and manages work on required solutions.Executes audit requests.Manages A/P KPIs and ensures the compliance of the SLAs.Prepares performance department reports as required.Releases and processes payments, prepares reportingDevelops work plans, identifies data needs, and successfully interprets analytic insights.Creates and produces basic performance reporting and analytics.Manages AP team toward industry best practice including systems, technologies and toolsThe Accounts Payable Manager position is well-suited for you if you:Project Management background preferredStrong Business & Strategic Acumen; ability to understand Ingredion’s blueprint, business processes and the Company’s key strategies.Ability to complete Performance Reporting & AnalysisStrong risk & compliance background; recognizes importance of sound internal control and maintaining high standards of ethical conduct.Qualified candidates will have:Extensive proven experience in Accounts Payable activities.Demonstrated ability to manage and lead a team.Demonstrated ability to organize, schedule and successfully manage multiple priorities.Minimum four years of high-volume A/P experience with at least two years of supervisory experienceStrong SAP backgroundProficient with POs and GR/IRKnowledgeable and proficient in all Microsoft office toolsBachelor’s degree in Accounting preferred.Relocation Available:No
